column1: Check full account and routing number for business
[MX] Loans cannot be created without routing number, which is not being returned from MX
column31:
*Product requirements:*

# We need to include a full business bank account number and full business bank routing number in the nacha file we send to Continental bank: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-118|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-118|smart-link] 
# We need to include a full business bank account number and full business bank routing number in the borrower payment information we set up in Peach: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-341|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-341|smart-link] 
# We need to be able to send the full personal bank account number and full personal bank routing number to peach in the future as borrower payment information if the business defaults.

*Current functionality:*

Currently when an MX bank account is connected, we only receive a partial account number and a null routing number.

Then when we create the nacha file, we hit these additional endpoints to get the full account information ([https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-537|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-537|smart-link]): 

[https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_account|https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_account] 

[https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_member|https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_member] 

We believe these endpoints provide both the full account number and the full routing number.

*Problems:*

# When user tries to complete loan, they get a {{Some MX properties not set}} error due to the null routing number and thus cannot create their loan.
# The full account number and routing number are not available to send to Peach when we create the borrower payment method according to [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-341|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-341|smart-link] 

*Possible suggestions:*

# Hit the above endpoints at the time the MX bank account is connected and store the full account number and routing number in our database
# Allow the loan to be created even if the routing number is null in our database rather than giving the {{Some MX properties not set}} error, and hit the endpoints to retrieve the information when we:
## Create the nacha file (already happening for account number but not sure about routing number)
## Create borrower payment method in Peach (not happening currently)
## Send personal borrower payment info to Peach in the future (need to confirm this will still be available up to 5 years in the future).

*Additional notes:*

# May make [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-566|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-566|smart-link] unnecessary if this solves the routing number issue.
# Whether we stay on MX or not ([https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-554|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-554|smart-link]) will be determined based on efficacy of this fix.

column1: User unable to add phone number
column31:
Currently if an owner has set up MFA using SMS, we do not allow them to update their phone number since then their MFA would not work correctly.

However, we are incorrectly applying this to all phone numbers on all owners.

So in this case, user ID {{ce728b7a-0417-4c33-abff-bc155dc82ae5}} / email {{ron.integrity@outlook.com}} had created an account using SMS MFA.

He was trying to add his co-owner, user ID {{61f8c11f-96a9-43d0-9715-e0e35a425adc}} / email {{misc4sale@hotmail.com}} (now deleted).

The user doing the editing had SMS MFA set up on their account so they should not be able to edit their own phone number. However, they DID need to add a phone number for the second owner, but they couldn‚Äôt, because we incorrectly locked that phone number field as well.

Session recording here: [https://fsty.io/v/8LPyCuKc|https://fsty.io/v/8LPyCuKc|smart-link] 

The user who was unable to have a phone number added had {{"phoneNumberChangeDisabled":false}} in the db, so I‚Äôm not sure why it was showing as locked.

Current logic seems to be:

* If owner has SMS MFA set up, they cannot edit any phone numbers (incorrect).

Logic should be:

* Any owners *with* SMS MFA set up canNOT have their phone number edited, regardless of who is doing the editing.
* Any owners *without* SMS MFA set up CAN have their phone number edited, regardless of who is doing the editing.
* Basically, just follow the rules of {{phoneNumberChangeDisabled}} and don‚Äôt care about what user is logged in.

This is preventing an application from being correctly submitted, since we don‚Äôt allow the application to be submitted without all owner information complete, and they cannot complete all the owner information.

column1: Restructure alloy table
column31:
I think we may need to restructure the way the alloy table works in order to be able to have more accurate data and visibility on our side. Obviously this will be a large lift, so I‚Äôm sharing some ideas here of how I could see it working.

||*column*||*type*||*description*||
|id|string| |
|AlloyJourneyToken|string|JA-xxxxxxxxxx if the application went through Alloy, null if the application was auto-denied|
|applicationStatus|enum: started, pending, manual_review, docs_requested, insufficient_data, frozen_file, business_docs, approved, denied|we should ideally track a single overall application status so it‚Äôs clear exactly what stage the applicant is at, what steps have been passed, and what is required for them to move forward|
|createdAt|timestamp| |
|updatedAt|timestamp| |
|deletedAt|timestamp|timestamp when isArchived was marked as true|
|isArchived|boolean|currently if we want to reset an application to an editable state, we delete the record from the alloy table entirely, but we need to have the record of the previous application submitted. instead, we should mark it as {{isArchived}} and only use ones where that field is false|
|archivedNote|string|note entered in admin when archiving the application|
|dti|float|in order to be able to effectively run reports for Continental Bank, we need to be able to pull the {{DTI}} calculation from Alloy's credit workflow and store it in our database (and pass over to peach). it is possible for this field to be null from alloy if the application was manually approved|
|estimatedIncome|float|in order to be able to effectively run reports for Continental Bank, we need to be able to pull the {{estimated_income}} from Alloy's income 12-24 months workflow and store it in our database (and pass over to peach). it is possible for this field to be null from alloy if the application was manually approved|
|creditScore|integer|in order to be able to effectively run reports for Continental Bank, we need to be able to pull the {{vantage_score}} from Alloy's income 12-24 months workflow and store it in our database (and pass over to peach). it is possible for this field to be null from alloy if the application was manually approved|
|declineCodes|string|we would like to include all decline codes in one column, regardless of whether they were declined automatically by us or declined by alloy.|
|incomeNeeded|boolean|we want to be able to track how many applications ever needed this, even after the status of the application changes, so we can improve the product over time|
|creditFrozen|boolean|we want to be able to track how many applications ever needed this, even after the status of the application changes, so we can improve the product over time|
|kycDocsNeeded|boolean|we want to be able to track how many applications ever needed this, even after the status of the application changes, so we can improve the product over time|
|kybDocsNeeded|boolean|we want to be able to track how many applications ever needed this, even after the status of the application changes, so we can improve the product over time|
|tags|string|we would like to be able to pull all the tags on each evaluation from an application and combine them into one field here|
|reviewer|string|name of person who reviewed the application. will be null if the application was not manually reviewed|



After this restructure, then we would add an {{applicationId}} column to the companies table and users table, which would then reference this table. {{applicantId}} would stay attached to companies/users even if archived, and would only be removed if/when replaced with a new ID if/when the application is resubmitted.

column1: Replace Argyle document upload integration with Ocrolus
column31:
We would like to explore replacing the income history document upload functionality through Argyle with Ocrolus.

Instead of a user clicking on the doc upload option and launching an argyle link modal, we would create our own modal:

!Frame 100.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

The upload should only support JPEG, PNG, BMP, TIFF, and PDF. If they try to upload a different file type, we should give them the following error: {{Please upload a PDF or image (JPEG, PNG, BMP, or TIFF).}}

When a user uploads documents, we would create a book in Ocrolus: [https://docs.ocrolus.com/reference/create-a-new-book|https://docs.ocrolus.com/reference/create-a-new-book|smart-link] 

* name: {users.firstName} {users.lastName} / {users.id} / {companies.companyName}
* is_public: true

We will then need to upload images to the book: [https://docs.ocrolus.com/reference/upload-images-to-book|https://docs.ocrolus.com/reference/upload-images-to-book|smart-link] 

And upload PDFs to the book: [https://docs.ocrolus.com/reference/upload-pdf-to-book|https://docs.ocrolus.com/reference/upload-pdf-to-book|smart-link] 

After uploading the documents, we should show a row in the income history list as {{{number} documents added}}

We will also need to store the Ocrolus Book ID on the users table, so that we can pass it to Alloy when the application is submitted.

column1: Combine funding file and nacha file for Continental on weekends
column31:
Continental Bank does not fund loans on the weekend. Because of this, it is possible that on Monday morning, they would have 3 separate funding files and nacha files waiting for them (one from Friday evening, one from Saturday evening, and one from Sunday evening). This is inconvenient for them from a process and accounting perspective, and they would prefer to have them combined into 1 file.

Thus, we would like to NOT send any funding files or nacha files to Continental Bank on Friday nights or Saturday nights. On Sunday nights, the file that we send should contain any loans that have accumulated from all three days.

column1: Figure out DMARC issues
column31:
Some people are not getting our emails due to authentication failures because our DMARC protection isn‚Äôt set up correctly and I don‚Äôt know what I need to do to fix it because I thought we tried to do this before but apparently I didn‚Äôt do it right. üòÖ



From our bank partner, who is sometimes ending up blocking some of our emails:

{quote}It looks like the emails from ‚Äò[getpaintbrush.com|http://getpaintbrush.com]‚Äô are failing all DNS checks.  Most emails on our ‚ÄòAllow List‚Äô have to pass at least one check, and those that fail all still end up in quarantine.  Here is the setting explanation:

Emails from an address in the allow list with enforced authentication will have to pass at least one of the DNS checks ‚Äì e.g. DMARC, SPF, or DKIM ‚Äì to be delivered, skipping subsequent scans. If an email from the allowed address with enforced authentication fails all the DNS checks, then Sophos Email will ignore the allow list entry and subject the email to subsequent scans.

By definition DMARC protection is to help prevent email fraud and establish domain trust

Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC) is an email authentication protocol. It is designed to give email domain owners the ability to protect their domain from unauthorized use, commonly known as email spoofing. The purpose and primary outcome of implementing DMARC is to protect a domain from being used in business email compromise attacks, phishing email, email scanning.

If you use a relay device or email is sent from another domain but has [getpaintbrush.com|http://getpaintbrush.com] on it, you can get this

I‚Äôm sure your email admin can make sure your domain integrity is fixed.{quote}
column104: Make sure the platform is super duper secure

column1: Investigate alternatives to MX
column31:
*Option 1: Direct replace with Plaid*

Plaid is extremely similar to MX but actually works. They are the dominant player in the space and have been around for a long time.

[https://plaid.com/docs/|https://plaid.com/docs/|smart-link] 



*Option 2: Use a bank connection aggregator*

There are a few aggregators that have come into play recently. The risk with these is that they are new, which means we could run into issues with them. But the pros are very compelling‚Äîthey allow us to interface with Plaid + MX + Finicity + others over time, while we only use one API, and they normalize the bank data from all of those for us, and balance the connections‚Äîi.e. if Plaid has the best connection to Mercury it will use that one, but if Finicity is the only one that has a connection to Continental Bank it will use that one, etc.

There are a few players in this space:

* [https://www.quiltt.io/|https://www.quiltt.io/|smart-link] 
** Docs: [https://www.quiltt.dev/guides/getting-started|https://www.quiltt.dev/guides/getting-started|smart-link]  
* [https://www.meld.io/|https://www.meld.io/|smart-link] 
** Docs: [https://docs.meld.io/docs|https://docs.meld.io/docs|smart-link] 
** PW {{build-easy}}

column31:
User seems to have not logged into any payroll provider and did not upload any docs but somehow still has a record appear in their income history when they close out of the modal: [https://fsty.io/v/hjaZBdut|https://fsty.io/v/hjaZBdut]

I think this may actually be a user experiencing the bug described here, since they did not add any valid credentials? [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-532|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-532|smart-link]

column1: Remove countdown on SMS MFA
column31:
Users get confused and think that the countdown is how long they have to enter their code, and that they are required to send a new code after the timer runs out. 

We would like the functionality to be:

* Grayed out and unclickable for 1 minute (current functionality)
* Black and clickable after 1 minute (current functionality)
* No countdown displayed (CHANGE)

column1: Order industry list alphabetically
column31: Right now the industry list order is just random as we created them. It would nice for them to be sorted A ‚Üí Z

column1: Change typing function in dropdowns
column31:
Right now a lot of users are getting stuck because we allow them to type an input in the dropdowns that isn‚Äôt a valid option, and then they get an error when they try to submit. This is especially an issue in the get-started form.

!Screen Shot 2023-03-27 at 6.32.03 PM.png|width=543,height=134!

!Screen Shot 2023-03-27 at 6.32.11 PM.png|width=546,height=127!



Ideally they should be able to type in all the dropdowns as a way to quickly move through the forms, but not to create their own inputs. See the single select option here as an example of how the desired behavior could work: [https://react-select.com/home|https://react-select.com/home]

column1: Cannot upload business documents after we updated process in Alloy
column31:
We updated our process in Alloy so that when we are unable to verify information about a business, we ask them to upload additional documents similar to asking them to update identity documents.

From my understanding from Alloy, this would work exactly the same so it wouldn‚Äôt require any changes on our side (it would just return a request to us to upload docs and we would pull up the modal, but the modal would have slightly different content).

However, that is not what actually happened. We had users who were asked to add business docs and just ended up with a screen that kept spinning and refreshing.

!image-20230328-000634.png|width=100%!

Which makes sense, because while the modal itself may not require any code changes, we need to create the UI to be able to prompt users to open the modal. üòÖ

!Frame 95.png|width=91.66666666666666%!

[https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=12-756|https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=12-756]

 Text should be:

{noformat}Unfortunately, it looks like we were unable to verify one or more of the following:
Proof of your ownership in the company
Proof your business is currently in good standing
Proof of address of the company.
In order to finish processing your application, we need more documentation from you. Your articles of incorporation may have all this information, or you can also provide additional documents.{noformat}


‚ö†Ô∏è  Alloy creates tags on the evaluation and those tags help us know exactly what was unmatched. Do we get those sent back in the API? If so, we would be able to make the list above dynamic to tell them which thing specifically we weren‚Äôt able to verify, instead of saying ‚Äúone or more of the following‚Äù

!Screen Shot 2023-03-28 at 2.00.44 PM.png|width=58.333333333333336%!

column1: Mobile get started form does not scroll to errors
column31:
When I hit submit on the get started form on mobile, if there is an error, it does not scroll me to where that field is. It should scroll me to the first mobile error so I can see what needs to be addressed.

Currently since it does not scroll to the correct error, it seems like the submit button did not work. 

Video here: [https://www.loom.com/share/d2e2d5a43d0d42f193bcce102a5b8d07|https://www.loom.com/share/d2e2d5a43d0d42f193bcce102a5b8d07|smart-link]

column1: Alloy journey reconfiguration
column31:
We are having a lot of issues with Alloy due to running all the credit, income, individual, and business checks at the same time, which will both help the application work better and also save us money on the checks that are run. Instead, we would like to run them one at a time in the following order:

# Send over the personal guarantor. If denied, do not send anything else over.
# If approved, send over all additional owners (if applicable). If denied, do not send anything else over.
# If approved, send over business.



Here are the instructions from Alloy:

* You send one entity (person/business) at a time to the [create Journey Application endpoint|https://developer.alloy.com/public/reference/post_journeys-journey-token-applications] with the {{do_await_additional_entities}} parameter set to {{true}}.
* If you receive a response that an entity is denied, you will [update the Journey Application|https://developer.alloy.com/public/reference/put_journeys-journey-token-applications-application-token] with the {{has_finished_sending_additional_entities}} parameter set to {{true}}.¬†
* If you receive a response that each successive person entity is approved, you will [update the Journey Application|https://developer.alloy.com/public/reference/put_journeys-journey-token-applications-application-token] with the {{has_finished_sending_additional_entities}} parameter set to {{true}} after the last entity (business) is sent.
* Once we receive the {{has_finished_sending_additional_entities}} parameter set to {{true}}, the Application Outcome logic will take over.
** If any single entity is denied, the entire application will be denied.

column1: Intercom not getting updated Alloy status to be able to send correct emails
column31:
*Example 1:*

User {{a32b02b0-d031-4920-bb0c-5c6bdd665c9e}} submitted their application at {{2023-03-23 19:46:44.993+00}}. It initially went into manual review, however, then it went into an {{insufficient_data}} for the user journey and {{docs_requested}} for the business state. This is reflected in the database Alloy table and behaving correctly in the product. 

However, the {{Alloyapplicationstatus}} in Intercom is still listed as {{manual_review}}, which means that we did not trigger the emails to go out to the user to notify them that they needed to add any more information. The status should have updated to {{insufficient_data}} since that is what we are showing in the product as well.



*Example 2:*

User {{9b4b2690-1d1a-4a5e-bac8-1e7774177cfb}} submitted their application at {{2023-03-25 02:06:09.199+00}}. It initially went to manual review. However, then it was updated at {{2023-03-27 18:28:26.912+00}} to {{docs_requested}}. The database has the correct information, however, the {{Alloyapplicationstatus}} in Intercom is still listed as {{manual_review}}, and the {{Paintbrushapplicationstatus}} in Intercom is still listed as {{application-pending}}. The status should show {{dos_requested}} so that we can trigger the emails correctly.

Statuses are also not getting updated correctly once a loan is approved. For example, the application with jaToken {{JA-1DmOMx8sSKAntjItc5fp}} has uploaded docs and now been approved, and the database has both the business and owner as approved, but Intercom shows it still as stuck at the upload docs stage.

!Screen Shot 2023-03-27 at 5.47.05 PM.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

column1: Automatically trim spaces from emails
column31:
User attempted to fill out /get-started form with email addresses {{rbull69757@aol.com}} and {{maggiemalones1@gmail.com}} and both were rejected as invalid email addresses.

Video here: [https://www.loom.com/share/d2e2d5a43d0d42f193bcce102a5b8d07|https://www.loom.com/share/d2e2d5a43d0d42f193bcce102a5b8d07|smart-link] 

This was due to the user including a space after their email address as seen here:

!image (3).png|width=613,height=255!

!image (4).png|width=583,height=365!

Unfortunately, most phones insert a space automatically by default if you autocomplete your email address, and the majority of our get-started forms are being completed on phones, so this could be an issue that could impact a lot of users.

Rather than rejecting the email address as invalid, we should automatically trim any spaces from the email address.

column1: Install reddit pixel
[MX] Hit additional endpoints to get better data for bank account numbers
column31:
*Problem:* after testing on prod it appears that current MX configuration is not giving us ‚Äúfull‚Äú account numbers. More details in this Slack thread: [https://ezetech.slack.com/archives/C03GKQURP4Z/p1675198317681749|https://ezetech.slack.com/archives/C03GKQURP4Z/p1675198317681749|smart-link] 

*Solution:* 

[https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_account|https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_account] 

[https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_member|https://docs.mx.com/api#verification_mx_widgets_list_account_numbers_by_member]



We can try and hit these additional endpoints to save ‚Äúbetter‚Äú bank account numbers (they still will not be full but they will have more digits) 

We will hit these endpoints NOT on MX step, but when cronjob to send ACH files is run. In other words, when ACH file is actually being sent to bank via SFTP, we will make a request to MX to pass ‚Äúcorrect‚Äú bank account number. 

IF for some reason MX does not return bank account number (it is either empty or has less than 8 digits), we have to input ‚ÄúFAILED‚Äú warning in the ACH file

column1: Edit destination for Continental CSV and Nacha files
column31:
Unfortunately the bank changed the way they are processing files in their ftp folder and we now need to route our files into subfolders in order for them to receive them.

* CSV of loans created each day should go to existing ftp, but then go into the {{Reports}} folder within it
* NACHA file should go to existing ftp, but then go into the {{ACH}} folder within it

I believe this should just be a 1-line change for each of them to add an additional directory command for where the files need to go.

column1: External loan ID is not created in Peach
column31:
When we create a loan in Peach, the external loan ID is not being saved in Peach for us to be able to use to query or report on loans.

In the request body, we should include the {{externalId}} field with the ID from our loans table to match.

API documentation: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Loans/#operation/peach.people.loans.handlers.loans_add|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Loans/#operation/peach.people.loans.handlers.loans_add|smart-link]

column1: Alloy. It is possible to create an Alloy journey with an empty array of employments.
column31:
It is possible to create an Alloy journey without an empty array of employments.

* Proceed to the Income History step
* Press ‚ÄúAdd income‚Äú
* Choose any of the employers
* Use invalid login and password for authentication
* Press ‚ÄúConnect‚Äú
* See that authentication failed
* Press on any place that is outside the Argyle SDK
* Refresh the page
* See that the list of employments has been pushed with 1 element
* Press ‚ÄúI've added 2 years of history‚Äú
* Press ‚ÄúSave‚Äú
* Press ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äú

Expected result: Alloy journey should not be created, if Argyle user has not employments. argyleUserId.employments.length == 0.

column1: Applications can be submitted without income history
column31:
From Northcross‚Äôs remediation report:

{quote}It was also found that potential applications could also be submitted without having an income history. This is possible by initially adding income history and then removing it. After the income history is removed, it is possible to submit the application. While this does bypass the application workflow, it results in an incomplete loan application that should be denied.
{quote}

STR (case 1):

* Fill in all the loan application steps
* Add employment via Argyle
* Mark the checkbox ‚ÄúI've added 2 years of history‚Äú
* Remove employment using the ‚ÄúRemove‚Äú button
* Proceed to the [/loan-application/submit|/loan-application/submit] 
* See that ‚ÄúIncome history‚Äú has ‚ÄúTo do‚Äú status
* Press the ‚ÄúSubmit‚Äú button
* See that it is possible to submit an application



STR (case 2):

* Fill in all the loan application steps
* Add employment via Argyle
* Do not mark the checkbox ‚ÄúI've added 2 years of history‚Äú

column1: Update fields in Continental funding file
column31:
The csv we generate each night for Continental currently has a lot of information in it. Continental has reduced the number of fields they would like to have included. Moving forward, we would like to only include:

* loan_id
* rate
* principal_balance
* expected_funding_date
* business_name

The other fields can be removed.

The original file is here, with fields that can be removed highlighted in red: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Z6ddfC8T8ggc2EhPe1CcdHo4BXSoPwZZI6q1igguQgE/edit#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Z6ddfC8T8ggc2EhPe1CcdHo4BXSoPwZZI6q1igguQgE/edit#gid=0|smart-link]

column1: As a user I would like to pick the account which gets returned from MX on the paintbrush UI
column31:
Problem: Even though user can choose type of account in the MX modal, for some reason MX sometimes returns multiple accounts

Solution: Implement radiobuttons on our UI so that user can choose checking or savings

Cases:

* If MX returns ONLY one account (CHECKING or SAVINGS) we just connect it and do not show any radiobuttons or NEW errors
* If MX returns multiple accounts, remove any that are not supported (loan, credit card, etc.), then:
** If there is only one account remaining that is checking or savings, we just connect it (page gets reloaded RIGHT AFTER user chooses radiobutton, we do not add any logic to save button) and do not show any radio buttons or NEW errors
** If there are multiple accounts that we can support, show yellow error {{Please choose which account you would like us to use, or link a different bank here.}} ‚ÄúLink a different bank here‚Äù should be underlined and clear all MX info and lets the user to start the process from scratch. Each account that is type checking or savings should have a radio button with the name of the account (not the name of the account holder) and last 4 digits of the account number
* If there is no checking or savings returned from MX, throw this error: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-454|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-454|smart-link], but with modified text: ‚ÄúWe support only checking or savings accounts. Looks like the bank which you are trying to connect cannot provide us with checking or savings accounts. +Please add another bank‚Äù+ (Underlined text clears all MX info and lets the user to start the process from scratch)
* if theres is null (unlikely but just in case) in account type, show 454 error from task 454



(+) Additional feature: put *account name* text on bank card so that user knows which account they have added

!Frame 109.png|width=100%!

column1: As a user I would like to go to my borrower portal from paintbrush with one click using SSO
column31:
This task is a follow-up after this spike: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-189|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-189|smart-link]

Task goal: user should have an ability to click here


!Screenshot 2022-12-19 at 11.14.22.png|width=1053,height=493!

And they will me immediately taken to borrower portal without needing to enter borrower portal log in details.

This task will take a decent amount of time, because:

* We will need to integrate with an identity provider (onelogin or similar)
* Integration with an identity provider means changing logic of our authentication on paintbrush (and the fact that we have MFA does not make it easier)
* Identity providers are not free but we need to talk to them in person to find out how much it really costs, it seems like onelogin says: 4 dollars per user per month which seems a lot: [https://www.onelogin.com/product/pricing|https://www.onelogin.com/product/pricing|smart-link]
* Even though we have peach APIs for SSO, it seems that we will need more info than that, meaning that we will have to spend some time with Peach implementing it properly which adds complexity as well
* All in all, a lot of professionals online claim that if you really want to have SSO, it is not worth it to have only for 1 external log in, it is more logical when you have 3-4+ external logins to utilize SSO to the fullest

To sum up, we are looking at 20+ storypoints together with integration. If we break down these tasks, it might be 20+13 in total.

column1: NULL fields from MX break checkSimilarity logic and user gets stuck on MX step
column31:
[https://www.loom.com/share/c68087f00ca5489bbf91db31a7457c07|https://www.loom.com/share/c68087f00ca5489bbf91db31a7457c07|smart-link]

Account: [stephen@powerbx.com|mailto:stephen@powerbx.com]



 Generally there are 2 cases possible:

1. All 4 fields (owner_name; address; email; phone from MX Owner object) are NULL

2. At least 1 of the fields above is not NULL



CASE 1:

If all 4 fields are NULL, then we apply similar regardless 



CASE 2: 

If at least 1 of the fields above is not NULL, then run checkSimilarity as usual ((!) IMPORTANT, we are currently reducing our similarity threshold to 1 in this task which will be parent task to the current one: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-495|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-495|smart-link])

column1: Additional text errors when user inputs not valid choice in dropdowns
column31:
Due to the fact that we recently have started allowing users to enter words in almost all dropdowns, so now when user enters invalid choice (which we do not have in our dropdown) the errors are weird. 



STR how to see weird errors:

1. Type random word in the dropdown field

2. Press save

3. See the first error (which most likely is ‚ÄúThis is a required field‚Äú)
4. Erase what you just have typed

5. Type again

6. Press save again

7. Observe the weird error (ex. ‚Äúindustry must be a string‚Äú)



!industry.png|width=1074,height=855!



We need to change them

1. /get-started page: ‚ÄúIndustry‚Äú dropdown. New error text: ‚ÄúPlease select industry from the list‚Äú

2. /business-information: there are 4 dropdowns:

* Industry (what to do: when pressing save and there a word which does not correspond to anything in the dropdown, throw an error: ‚ÄúPlease select industry from the list‚Äù)
* State (Already handled in [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-475|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-475|smart-link])
* Business type (what to do: when pressing save and there a word which does not correspond to anything in the dropdown, throw an error: ‚ÄúPlease select business type from the list‚Äù)
* Registration State: same error with the same logic as in ‚ÄúState‚Äù field

3. /owner-information. (?) There is also State dropdown but I am not quite sure if it works ok or not, need to recheck

column1: Refactor Peach client
column31:
Currently, we are not handling properly all plausible errors from Peach‚Äôs side. The peach process has been growing a lot during the paintbrush application development and now is a good time to introduce the process of handling potential errors in a proper manner.

Required steps for successful Paintbrush loan creation (200 response on {{POST}} to {{/loans}} endpoint):

* Create Peach Borrower. If the borrower already exists - skip this step
* Create Borrower Contact Info in Peach, details in [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-190|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-190|smart-link]
* Create Peach User IS OPTIONAL, hence can be removed from {{/loans}} endpoint and moved to the queue
* Create Loan in {{loans}} table in our DB. (make sure that rolling back {{await Loan.create()}} transactions will not break sequences in SQL, and every time loan is created it will have unique name, even after rollback)
* Create Peach Loan is REQUIRED. Fetch loans by company.peachId, if there is a loan created in peach - skip this step. Assign {{peachLoanId}} to {{loan}} row in our database.
* Create Payment Method can be moved out from endpoint to the queue.
* Creating agreements ({{SetupAutopay}} and {{CreateAgreements}} services) can also be moved to the queue



Queue:

By the time queue task is executed, we have Peach Borrower created in peach, Contact Info is attached to every user in the company, Loan is created in our DB, as well as Peach Loan is created.

# {{CreateUser}} service. Will create users in peach.
# {{CreatePaymentMethod}} service creates a Payment Instrument entity in peach, which is also used in {{SetupAutopay}} service => SetupAutopay depends on this step.
## Making note here‚Äîcurrently if this step fails, we still create the loan in Peach but do not save it in our DB, which can lead to the loan being created as many times as the user clicks the button. We need to make sure we either have the checks in place before the loan is created, or that we save the loan being created even if we show this error.
# {{CreateAgreements}} service creates document descriptors in peach. Also in the future this service probably will be responsible for pdf generation and upload.
# {{SetupAutopay}} service uses Payment Method from step 2 and creates autopay agreement



We can run services 1, 2, 3 in parallel.



P.S. Every day at 5PM all yesterday‚Äôs loans are activated in peach. This turns on autopay in peach => by the time {{activateLoans}} task runs, we need to make sure that {{SetupAutopay}} was already succesfully run. So we probably need either to make sure that {{SetupAutopay}} was successful, or change logic of fetching Loans, so that we can retry older ones, if they were not activated.

But now we are changing our logic and putting links inside errors so that user can start everything from scratch (examples here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-478|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-478|smart-link])

So for this case in the screenshot ({{status = CONNECTED, checkSimilarity = not_similar}}) we need make the words ‚Äú+connect a different one+‚Äú a link, clicking on which will refresh the page and delete MX entity from DB and form MX and open MX widget

column1: Update logic for loan activation in Peach
column31:
Right now we activate the loan 1 day after the loan is created. However the bank does not process funds on non-business days. Thus, we should update our logic with the following considerations:

# Activate a loan the day after it is originated, UNLESS
# If the activation day falls on a Saturday or Sunday, wait until the next business day (Monday - Friday)
# If the activation day falls on a federal reserve holiday, wait until the next non-holiday: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1WcpOOHwD8oLGrOE_lUuKlQCoHgL7jUsvso5KHh-iOIk/edit#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1WcpOOHwD8oLGrOE_lUuKlQCoHgL7jUsvso5KHh-iOIk/edit#gid=0]

#2 and #3 should combine. So, for example, if I complete a loan on Friday, September 1st, 2023, I should send the information to Peach as we currently do, and send the NACHA file to the bank as we currently do. However, we should:

# Not activate the loan in Peach on Saturday because it is a weekend
# Not activate the loan in Peach on Sunday because it is a weekend
# Not activate the loan in Peach on Monday the 4th because it is a federal reserve holiday
# DO activate the loan in Peach on Tuesday the 5th because it is a business day and is not a holiday

‚ö†Ô∏è  *NOTE*: {{expected_funding_date}} for a loan should always match the activation date for a loan. Thus, when we create the CSV for Continental each day with details of all the loans originated, we will need to update the {{expected_funding_date}} to match this logic.

column1: Add direct doc upload option when more income history is requested
column31:
When more income history is requested, it will often be because the user was not able to link enough payroll accounts because they didn‚Äôt have access to any others, which means that any additional income to be added will be through a doc upload. The current experience through Argyle makes it hard to find the doc upload, so we would like to also provide an option for them to upload documents directly.

*Logic:*

* When Alloy returns {{insufficient_data}} on income, we will display this screen, now with 2 options instead of 1
* The first option, {{Connect additional payroll accounts}}, should follow the current behavior and open the Argyle link ID {{23T5JEO8}} 
* The second option, {{Upload additional income documents}}, should open the Argyle link ID {{IJSBSR9L}}
* We should follow the current logic for resubmitting to Alloy‚Äîwhen _either_ is completed successfully, we resubmit automatically.

column1: User gets stuck on password creation if they hit back using browser during MFA setup
column31:
Right now if a user hits the back button on their browser during MFA setup rather than using the back button in our app, they will be taken back to the password creation step, even though they‚Äôve already created a password, so they‚Äôre unable to create a new one.

Ideally the back page should only take them one step backwards to the step where they‚Äôre choosing which method (SMS, auth app, or skip). If not possible, then it would be great if we could redirect them to the login page or the /loan-application since at this point they should already be logged in I believe.

If they are already logged in at this point since they‚Äôve already created their password, the issue may be solved by: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-412|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-412|smart-link] and we might not need any additional work.

Video: [https://www.loom.com/share/28927203f0704139bf099e991806f1c5|https://www.loom.com/share/28927203f0704139bf099e991806f1c5|smart-link]

column1: [MX] Change FAILED status error text
column31:
Currently on front-end during FAILED MX error we are throwing:

‚ÄúThere was a problem validating your credentials with your bank. Please contact +re-enter your bank details+. If it does not work, contact +Paintbrush Support+‚Äù



After seeing it live we understood that this is inconvenient for a user, so we need to add an option to add new bank account (new text):

‚ÄúThere was a problem validating your credentials with your bank. Please +re-enter your bank details+. If it does not work, please +add a different bank account+‚Äú

(!) +add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

column1: Hide API endpoint access from users
column31:
It‚Äôs possible for users to access our /api/v1/company endpoint and see all their data about themselves that they shouldn‚Äôt necessarily be able to access such as their user ID and company ID, as well as attempt to edit it via the API (for example, trying to add an Argyle or MX ID via API that isn‚Äôt valid would be very bad). We should probably make this endpoint inaccessible to users.

Reference: [https://grain.com/share/highlight/bleOt2tcn1J5dMOPLUIOQgpGV0HsJSv7m6MvWaOq|https://grain.com/share/highlight/bleOt2tcn1J5dMOPLUIOQgpGV0HsJSv7m6MvWaOq|smart-link]

When he mentions in the video that he showed me he found it earlier, he‚Äôs talking about this: [https://grain.com/share/highlight/27a1ZG6PP2eCBujv6WRr5ELy5mItB047hi15c2WN|https://grain.com/share/highlight/27a1ZG6PP2eCBujv6WRr5ELy5mItB047hi15c2WN|smart-link]
column104: Make sure the platform is super duper secure

column1: Add rate limiting to email fields in the application
column31:
Reference: [https://grain.com/share/highlight/BKmwKe66kzwPeS4XjokGOOSuBDl8T0M54TtmA2uv|https://grain.com/share/highlight/BKmwKe66kzwPeS4XjokGOOSuBDl8T0M54TtmA2uv|smart-link]

If a user tries to enter an email address that already exists, we give them an error that they can‚Äôt use that email address. This is unavoidable. However, this could be a way for hackers to test out which email addresses do and don‚Äôt have accounts on Paintbrush, which they can then try to take advantage of in other ways. 

We should add rate limiting on how many times/how quickly they can change their email address (probably something like 3x per day is more than enough) to make sure they don‚Äôt try to exploit this.
column104: Make sure the platform is super duper secure

column1: Log event when email address of user is changed
column31:
As a security precaution, we would like to be able to notify users whenever their email address is changed.

For example:

* I am logged in as [kaela+37@getpaintbrush.com|mailto:kaela+37@getpaintbrush.com] 
* I change my email address under owner information to [kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com|mailto:kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com] 
* Now I can only log in as [kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com|mailto:kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com] and I can no longer log in as [kaela+37@getpaintbrush.com|mailto:kaela+37@getpaintbrush.com] 
* I would like to send an email to send an email to both [kaela+37@getpainbrush.com|mailto:kaela+37@getpainbrush.com] and [kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com|mailto:kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com] telling them their email address was updated, in case it was a mistake or due to hacking

Suggestion:

* Currently we already update the email address of the user in intercom from [kaela+37@getpaintbrush.com|mailto:kaela+37@getpaintbrush.com] to [kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com|mailto:kaela+38@getpaintbrush.com] automatically
* We would like to send a timestamp event to intercom on the user which is something like {{email_updated}} that we can use to trigger the communication to the user to be sent out
* I don‚Äôt know how to be able to send an email to the old email address via intercom without creating a second user which sounds like a terrible idea because it would break our logic in a million other ways for what triggers users to get emails, so I‚Äôll have to think on that one. ü§î

Reference: [https://grain.com/share/highlight/wRvUgQsN6cCjrhqGNORV1xafTOQ3cLnmwKtNMBWp|https://grain.com/share/highlight/wRvUgQsN6cCjrhqGNORV1xafTOQ3cLnmwKtNMBWp|smart-link]

column1: Upload loan agreement document content (PDF)
column31:
After we have created the document descriptors, we need to add the content of the loan agreement and the personal guaranty. 

This can be done 1 of 2 ways:

# We export the HTML of everything they signed and upload it to Peach, then convert it to a PDF
# We generate a PDF of what the user signed, then upload that directly to Peach

#2 sounds like more work to me but probably better in the long run so we can also add an option for users to download their agreements they signed directly on the page where they signed them. I‚Äôm open to doing that now, or doing #1 for now if it‚Äôs easier and not worrying about #2 until we decide to build a way for users to download their agreements when they‚Äôre signing them.



Upload HTML:

# Upload HTML content: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.upload_person_document_content|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.upload_person_document_content]
# Then render the content to PDF: {{https://sandboxapi.peach.finance/api/communicator/render-to-document?fmt=html}}
[https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.convert_person_document|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.convert_person_document]

Upload PDF:

# Figure out how to export content to PDF ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
# Upload PDF content: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.upload_person_document_content|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.upload_person_document_content]



----

Scope: 

# Change logic of saving of agreements: we will now save loan agreement, personal agreement AND income guarantee (because all 3 steps should be consistent) texts on backend in PDF + create and endpoint which will return the PDF to front-end.
# Where to save PDF: in repository
# Add library which generates PDF
# Final step: add signature in the bottom of the PDF and send it to Peach

column1: [MX] Show error for user when they connect more than 1 account during MX SDK oAuth flow
column31:
Sometimes there are cases when user can connect several account via checkboxes on bank‚Äôs website (these banks do not use MX SDK, they use their website instead):



!Screenshot 2022-12-02 at 07.57.08.png|width=923,height=576!



The problem is that our logic is designed to use only one account. 

How to fix: when user connects >1 account, we throw an error on front-end:

‚ÄùLoan funds can only be deposited into a single business bank account. Please +try again+ and only choose one account this time. Or you can add another bank instead.‚Äù

Error color: RED

Logic in text: Try again will refresh the page and open MX modal to add account + wipe an existing info which we got from MX. 


(!) Issues with MX Sandbox: Unfortunately MX sandbox always send us 8 accounts by default so it is a behavior which we do not need in our app at all. I think we need to add ENV variable for all develops and demo, which will ignore this error

column1: Handle rare error statuses from MX
column31:
EXPIRED, FAILED, DELAYED are handled here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-468|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-468|smart-link]

MX docs: [https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_members_connection_statuses|https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_members_connection_statuses]


PREVENTED:

Warning color: Yellow

Warning text: ‚ÄúThe last 3 attempts to connect have failed. Please +re-enter your credentials+ to continue importing data. +Or add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text:  ‚Äú+re-enter your credentials‚Äù+ is a link which reopens MX modal. +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



DENIED:

Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúThe credentials entered do not match your credentials at this institution. Please +re-enter your credentials+ to continue importing data. +Or add another bank account+.

Extra logic with text: ‚Äú+re-enter your credentials‚Äù+ is a link which reopens MX modal, +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



REJECTED:

Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúThe answer or answers provided were incorrect. +Please try again. Or add another bank account.+‚Äù

Extra logic with text: ‚Äú+Please try again‚Äù+ is a link which reopens MX modal. +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



LOCKED:

Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúYour account is locked. Please log in to the appropriate website for your bank and follow the steps to resolve the issue and +reconnect+ the bank afterwards. +Or add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: +Reconnect+ should open MX modal. +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



IMPEDED:

Warning color: Yellow

Warning text: ‚ÄúYour attention is needed at this institution‚Äôs website. Please log in to the appropriate website for your bank and follow the steps to resolve the issue. +Or add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



RECONNECTED (we will skip for our MX flow, we do not need this status)




!Screenshot 2022-11-28 at 15.21.40.png|width=1194,height=138!



DEGRADED:

Warning color: Blue

Warning text: ‚ÄúWe are upgrading this connection. Please try again later.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: N/A

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



DISCONNECTED:

Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúIt looks like your data from the bank cannot be imported. We are working to resolve the issue‚Äù

Extra logic with text: N/A

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



DISCONTINUED:

Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúConnections to this institution are no longer supported. Please +add another bank account+‚Äù

Extra logic with text: +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



CLOSED:

Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúThis connection has been closed. You may track this account manually. If reopened, you may connect the institution again. +Or add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO


DISABLED:

Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúImporting data from this institution has been disabled. +Please contact us+ if you believe it has been disabled in error. +Or add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: +Please contact us+ is a link which opens intercom chat. +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



IMPORTED:

Warning color: Yellow

Warning text: ‚ÄúYou must re-authenticate before your data can be imported. Please enter +your credentials+ for your bank. +Or add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: +your credentials+ is a link which opens MX modal. +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



RESUMED:

Warning color: Blue

Warning text: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre verifying your information. We‚Äôll let you know as soon as this is complete.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: N/A

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



IMPAIRED:

Warning color: Yellow

Warning text: ‚ÄúYou must re-authenticate before your data can be imported. Please enter +your credentials+ for your bank. +Or add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: +your credentials+ is a link which opens MX modal. +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO

column1: Autofill address causes state dropdown to break
column31:
See video here: [https://www.loom.com/share/71743046dfa0413db05187906bd12e5d|https://www.loom.com/share/71743046dfa0413db05187906bd12e5d]

Repro steps:

# Start typing an address that has been saved in your browser defaults
# In preview, it will look like state will fill address dropdown correctly
# But when you hit enter to actually autofill the address, the state dropdown will open with nothing filled in and cannot be closed by clicking out of it
# Typing to find state also does not work
# State dropdown must be scrolled to find correct state in order to be able to close it and edit any other fields
column136: {build={count=1, dataType=build, failedBuildCount=0, successfulBuildCount=1, unknownBuildCount=0}, repository={count=28, dataType=repository}, json={"cachedValue":{"errors":[],"summary":{"repository":{"overall":{"count":28,"lastUpdated":"2022-12-19T16:06:35.000+0200","dataType":"repository"},"byInstanceType":{"GitLab":{"count":28,"name":"GitLab"}}},"build":{"overall":{"count":1,"lastUpdated":null,"failedBuildCount":0,"successfulBuildCount":1,"unknownBuildCount":0,"dataType":"build"},"byInstanceType":{"cloud-providers":{"count":1,"name":"Other providers"}}}}},"isStale":true}}
column137:
12/–¥–µ–∫/22 4:28 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;(+) [~accountid:5e315f59082f050e722342a5]  After retesting here is what we have decided needs to be done:

* We detect if autofill has been used on the State dropdown
* If it has been used: we do not show a dropdown (but you still can type the state if you want to)
* When user clicks [Save] button, we run a check to validate both front-end and backend and IF the exact autofill from a user does not correspond to states which we have in dropdown. 
If YES: then it is ok and we save it
If NO: we throw an error under the State field: ‚ÄúPlease choose a valid State from the dropdown‚Äú
column138: 19/–¥–µ–∫/22 2:51 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:62f52046f15eecaf50109d14]  we will fix other texts here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-512|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-512|smart-link]

column1: Change the logic of creation of "loan name".
column31:
Originally, we were using the ‚Äúloan name‚Äù for sending files via NACHA files. Now it is used for Peach. As it is generated randomly there is a possibility of a collision (!). We should change the ‚Äúloan name‚Äú to smth that will not cause any issues with NACHA files, Peach and will not cause a collision and possibly can be used as a human-readable identifier of a loan. 
NACHA file documentation: [https://secureinstantpayments.com/sip/help/interface_specs/external/NACHA_format.pdf|https://secureinstantpayments.com/sip/help/interface_specs/external/NACHA_format.pdf] (page 6, 7th column ‚Üí Individual Identification Number)

[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17hQUjRIRabeKWpK00RIRwX6SQ1pXqn_YLDbFWB21DyI/edit#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17hQUjRIRabeKWpK00RIRwX6SQ1pXqn_YLDbFWB21DyI/edit#gid=0|smart-link](row 33 here, Identification Number)



üîß Decision: let‚Äôs implement incremental ID starting from 10,000,000,000

column137: 24/–Ω–æ—è/22 7:39 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  What do you think? Can we do it as we think is best or we need to consult with Peach about this name?
column138: 25/–Ω–æ—è/22 2:31 AM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] not sure I understand the issue; shouldn‚Äôt the loan name in our DB also be unique?
column139: 25/–Ω–æ—è/22 2:44 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  It has only 5 symbols, which means that eventually we will run out of numbers:) So we need to make it at least 8-10 symbols. The questions is: how flexible are we in terms of Peach limitations. (We are ok for NACHA file because it allows up to 15 symbols)
column140:
26/–Ω–æ—è/22 1:58 AM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;Ah got it, since the loanName we are sending to Peach is just metadata we are adding to the loan and not anything they are requiring in their API, there are no unique constraints, so collisions won‚Äôt be an issue, and we can format the field however we want.

I‚Äôm not too worried about length since as we start creating more and more loans we can increment to 6, then 7, then 8, etc.

We already have the nickname in Peach that is human readable, and this loan name is more for working with the bank as an additional measure to be able to track what a loan was converted from or to as we start building the income-driven repayment option.

column1: Business information. "Not registered" registration state option should added to the list of auto_denied reasons.
column31:
Business information. "Not registered" registration state option should be added to the list of auto_denied reasons. If the option "Not registered"  option of the ‚ÄúRegistration state‚Äù dropdown is chosen, the info should not be sent to Alloy because of the auto_denied reason:

column1: MX SDK stops aggregation jobs once the modal window has been closed.
column31:
MX SDK stops aggregation jobs once the modal window has been closed. The record for the account is created in DB, however, MX need some time to process the request so the modal should not be closed for a while. 
Solutions:

* Disabling the page from the point when the aggregation requests start their work until the /api/v1/mx/success-connect-member request is sent.

STR:

* Proceed to the connection of bank accounts
* Choose any institution (MX)
* Log in
* Wait for the modal window to show the process of connecting
* Click on any place on the page that is outside the modal window



üîß How to fix:

-Start polling as soon as a user presses [Connect bank account] button (in DB only ‚Äúuser‚Äú field has been populated, member is not mandatory)-  
(!) Decided with [~accountid:5fb24d170d2f61006ff8509d]  to remove all data from DB and MX if user closes the modal manually. Details: TBD by Kostia

column1: Update "Save" button logic on loan creation steps
column31:
General logic is described here [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-427|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-427|smart-link]

 For this task we need to make some changes since agreements behavior is a bit different from application flow.



If you are pressing next on any agreement except autopay agreement, the application will not let you go to next page due to validation. 

So generally if user presses save and there is at least one ‚Äúincomplete‚Äú step (either any agreement or MX), the user has to be redirected to that step. If everything is completed, then redirect to ‚Äúloan summary‚Äú page ((!) UPD: As described by Kaela in comments it should not redirect backwards, only forward if something is not completed)

column137:
24/–Ω–æ—è/22 12:35 AM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  But what about autopay agreement which is optional? I mean there is a big chance that everything will be completed except it, so we will just ‚Äúforce‚Äú users to sign it because we will be redirecting to it?

Or should we remove ‚ÄúAutopay agreement‚Äù from this logic? In a way that even if it is in ‚ÄúTo Do‚Äù State, we will redirect to it only from ‚ÄúIncome guarantee‚Äú (because it is previous step) and not from other steps?
column138:
25/–Ω–æ—è/22 2:41 AM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;It shouldn‚Äôt force people to do the autopay agreement because this is just allowing us to skip over some screens, but being taken to them is still the same.

Additionally, this will only take people forwards, not backwards. So for example, if loan agreement, personal guaranty, and personal bank account are completed, but autopay agreement and business account are not. I connect business bank account and hit save. Rather than taking me to the next step, it would skip that since I‚Äôve already completed it. It would thus take me to /create-loan, but it would not take me backwards to the autopay agreement.
column139:
25/–Ω–æ—è/22 2:46 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  okok, to sum up: 

* We are moving only forwards
* Not forcing users for autopay [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-472|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-472|smart-link]
* We redirect users to autopay even though it is optional but only from ‚Äúprevious‚Äú steps

column1: Handle EXPIRED, DELAYED and FAILED MX logic properly on front-end
column31:
We need to show proper errors for each of these 3 statuses, they will have either red, yellow or blue warning


Link to light warning: [https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=2799%3A11919&t=VHqz84nOE7JyKFyv-0|https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=2799%3A11919&t=VHqz84nOE7JyKFyv-0]

MX docs: [https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_members_connection_statuses|https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_members_connection_statuses]



EXPIRED:
Warning color: Yellow

Warning text: ‚ÄúThe answer or answers were not provided in time. +Please try again+ or +Add another bank account+.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: ‚ÄúPlease try again‚Äú has to be a link clicking on which the MX modal has to be reopened. +Add another bank account+ should remove MX info that already has been added to our DB, refresh the page, so that it acts as if user is adding a brand new acc

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



DELAYED: 

Warning color: Blue

Warning text: ‚ÄúImporting your data from your bank may take a while. Please check back later.‚Äù

Extra logic with text: N/A

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO



FAILED: 
Warning color: Red

Warning text: ‚ÄúThere was a problem validating your credentials with your bank. Please contact +re-enter your bank details+. If it does not work, contact +Paintbrush Support+‚Äù
Extra logic with text: ‚Äú+Paintbrush Support+‚Äù has to be a link, clicking on which will open intercom chat. +Re-enter your bank details+ should re-open MX modal

Is bank with remove button visible on our front-end: NO

column1: Update overview on personal guaranty
column31:
We would like to add 3 additional bullet points to the of the personal guaranty overview and update one of the existing ones. See copy below and screenshot for where they should be added and which one needs to be updated.

Add:

{quote}*1 month:* If you miss commercial payment for one full month, your loan will default and convert to the personal guaranty

*3 requirements:* To qualify for income-driven repayment‚Äîtax form, proof of income or lack thereof, personal bank account connection

*0 impediments:* Having any of the following will disqualify you from income-driven repayment and instead require a full personal guaranty: fraud or breach of agreement; recent personal delinquencies, collections, or charge-offs; or any personal bankruptcies, foreclosures, or repossessions{quote}

Update:

{quote}*15%:* Percent of your gross income you‚Äôll pay on a monthly basis if you qualify for the income-driven repayment accommodation{quote}

column1: Updates to industries list
column31:

* NEW: Restaurants
* NEW: Transportation/warehousing
* NEW: Auto/parts dealers

Logic:

* All previously existing industries keep same logic
* {{Real estate/construction}} keeps same logic as {{real estate}}
* 3 new industries should all be denied:
** If filled out during self-assessment, they will be told they are not a good fit
** If filled out during application, they will be automatically denied wit reason code {{industry}} when application is submitted

column1: Update age requirements for Nebraska and Alabama
column31:
In Nebraska and Alabama, the legal age to be able to enter into a legal contract is 19, not 18. Thus, we need to make updates to the DOB field if someone is in these states.

Logic:

* If owner‚Äôs state != Nebraska and != Alabama, then DOB must be >= 18
* If owner‚Äôs state = Nebraska or Alabama, then DOB must be >= 19
* If owner‚Äôs state is unknown, then DOB must be >= 18
** Once owner‚Äôs state is known, then apply the logic above

We also need to update the error message since it‚Äôs not always 18 that is required.

* Old error message: {{All owners must be at least 18 years old to qualify for a Paintbrush Loan.}}
* New error message: {{All owners must be of legal age to qualify for a Paintbrush Loan.}}



UPD: we will also change Alloy error to more ‚Äúgeneral‚Äú

column1: [Peach] Turn on autopay at the same time loan is activated
column31:
This is a for from this task [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-343|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-343|smart-link]

*Step 6: Turn on autopay*

POST /people/{{PEACH COMPANY BORROWER ID}}/loans/{{PEACH LOAN ID}}/autopay

{noformat}{
    "previewMode": false,
    "amountType": "statementBalanceAmount",
    "isAlignedToDueDates": true,
    "offsetFromDueDate": null,
    "paymentInstrumentId": "{{PAYMENT INSTRUMENT ID FROM STEP 1}}",
    "agreementDocumentId": "{{DOCUMENT DESCRIPTOR ID FROM STEP 2}}"
    "sendNotice": false
}{noformat}



It has to be done separately, because we discovered that autopay cannot be turned on while loan is in originated status, full context in this thread [https://ezetech.slack.com/archives/C037J908HDF/p1668625183864089|https://ezetech.slack.com/archives/C037J908HDF/p1668625183864089|smart-link]

column1: [NeuroID] Refactor forms on loan application
column31:
Currently 3 forms are hidden with CSS, but the forms should be rendered once at a time, because NeuroID does not support dynamic data attribute changes on input.

To test: 

* Top 2 bugs in comments in [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-178|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-178|smart-link] have to disappear.

column1: Update wording on application submission page
column31:
Now that we‚Äôve been testing live applications, it turns out our application decision usually isn‚Äôt immediate because Argyle takes a long time to pull in all their employment history. That means we need to set better expectations with applicants.

On the application-submit page, we need to update the wording. The first sentence should be updated instead of {{Many applicants get a decision immediately.}} It should say {{Many applicants get a decision within 15 minutes.}}

The rest of the paragraph should remain the same.

!Screen Shot 2022-11-12 at 9.16.10 AM.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

column1: Only allow checking or savings accounts to be connected
column31:
If a bank account from MX is one of the following types:

* loan
* credit_card
* line_of_credit
* prepaid
* checking_line_of_credit
* cash
* investment
* mortgage
* property
* insurance

We should give an error with the following message: {{Looks like we can't support that type of account. Please connect a checking or savings account or contact our support team for assistance.}}

!Frame 108.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

Clicking on the {{contact our support team for assistance}} part should:

* open the intercom chat bubble
* log a mixpanel {{Need Help}} event with {{Help Prompt Type}} = {{Error}}

column1: [REMOVE FROM INTERCOM INTERFACE AFTER RELEASE] applicationDecision not reporting correctly in Intercom
column31:
in Paintbrush [Test] in Intercom, the {{applicationDecision}} field does not seem to be getting filled correctly. A lot of applications are showing denied when the {{paintbrushApplicationStatus}} and {{alloyApplicationStatus}} both seem to indicate that is not the case. 

Possible solutions:

# Fix this field so that it reports correctly
# Remove this field from intercom so that it does not cause us to have incorrect data that could trigger incorrect behaviors and emails in the future (or prevent correct ones from happening). Because we have {{paintbrushApplicationStatus}} and {{alloyApplicationStatus}}, this field is not critical.

!Screen Shot 2022-11-13 at 6.59.30 PM.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

column137: 21/–Ω–æ—è/22 2:55 PM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;If it‚Äôs not critical - I think we can just go with removing this field, since there are some problems to set it up correctly (approved/denied event is getting triggered for every user/company separately, and only after all events have come through - our server decides whether the application decision was false or true, this status just represents whatever alloy sends us)
column138: 21/–Ω–æ—è/22 3:12 PM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;Property itself also needs to be removed from Intercom, but only AFTER deployment to production (otherwise it might start throwing errors), so I‚Äôm not sure how to handle it [~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e]

column1: Update contact info borrower affiliation
column31:
Due to limitations on Peach‚Äôs side, we need to switch which borrower some of the contact info is associated with.

Original logic here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-190|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-190|smart-link]

New logic:

* Business address ‚Üí contact associated with business borrower (same as before)
* Personal guarantor address ‚Üí contact associated with personal guarantor borrower (same as before)
* Other owners' addresses ‚Üí contact associated with those borrowers (same as before)
* {color:#bf2600}Personal guarantor phone number ‚Üí contact associated with {color}{color:#bf2600}*business*{color}{color:#bf2600} borrower ({color}{color:#bf2600}*DIFFERENT*{color}{color:#bf2600}){color}
* Other owners' phone numbers ‚Üí contact associated with those borrowers (same as before)
* {color:#bf2600}Personal guarantor email ‚Üí contact associated with {color}{color:#bf2600}*business*{color}{color:#bf2600} borrower ({color}{color:#bf2600}*DIFFERENT*{color}{color:#bf2600}){color}
* Other owners' emails ‚Üí contact associated with those borrowers (same as before)

The request body will be the same when creating the contact, it will just be the path parameters that will be different‚Äîwhich borrower ID is used when creating the contact.

(!) Only needs to be updated moving forward, not for any existing contacts.

column1: Update loan creation fields
column31:
1. When we create a loan via API, we have a field for {{originationLicense}}. Previously this was set to {{nationalBank}} but it actually needs to be {{stateBank}}. This applies to all loans created.



2. It looks like when we‚Äôre creating loans in Peach, we‚Äôre not adding any metadata on those loans. We would like to include the following fields in the request:

{noformat}"metaData": {
    "loanName": name from loans table,
    "convertedFrom": null
    "convertedTo": null
    "repaymentType": "business"},{noformat}



3. Additionally, it looks like we‚Äôre setting {{itemsOrServicesFinanced: "www.cbankus.com"}} but this field should be null/left off the request entirely.

column1: Update text and link for PG to join application
column31:
When someone adds another owner to the application who is a personal guarantor, we show a warning saying that person needs to work on the application with them and have them go through the self-assessment form to create their account.

!Screen Shot 2022-11-11 at 10.43.52 AM.png|width=83.33%!

Now that we have /create-account, we would like to update this warning.

*New text:*

{quote}{personal_guarantor} will need to work on this application with you. Please have them +create their account here+.{quote}

*New link:* /create-account

column1: MX account displays "In Progress" even though it has been added
column31:
[https://www.loom.com/share/7feab3df729845babb4740bb68dd16d2|https://www.loom.com/share/7feab3df729845babb4740bb68dd16d2|smart-link]

* company: 2bfcd116-5e07-4f1a-a2e9-d04644a518b7
* pg: 0f39347e-f68f-44d9-b70a-e03555bad884
* second owner: ed017679-90db-4496-8843-cdac3b4b60b7 (person who connected the bank account in a weird state)



This happens from time to time because sometimes MX sandbox takes longer to send us the info than usual. Therefore the name is not added to DB which results in this ‚ÄúIn Progress‚Äú state. Good news is this is unlikely to happen on APP because MX claims that their prod env works much better than sandbox


üîß More investigation is needed as well as the strategy how to fix this because it is not very straighforward

column1: Iovation integration [INFORM ALLOY WHEN RELEASED]
column31:
Documentation: [https://help.alloy.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/9407674390683/Integrating_with_Web_Sites.pdf|https://help.alloy.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/9407674390683/Integrating_with_Web_Sites.pdf]

Article: [https://help.alloy.com/hc/en-us/articles/4405646102043-iovation-Integration-Device-Data-Aggregation-|https://help.alloy.com/hc/en-us/articles/4405646102043-iovation-Integration-Device-Data-Aggregation-]

* Integrate front-end with iovation script. This will collect and send tracking data to iovation, also will collect blackbox, which needs to be sent to our server.



Answers from Alloy:

# It‚Äôs not yet 100% clear what is a "blackbox" in the iovation doc and how to store it, and also at what point it should be collected and sent? 
{color:#0747a6}You don't need to store anywhere. You would, however, collect it for each applicant, and then pass it along to Alloy{color}
# Should we collect this data and submit it on every form? 
{color:#0747a6}You do not need to collect it on every form. You collect it once and pass that information to Alloy. Nothing should change about their device from page to page. {color}
üßëüèª‚Äçüíª Developer notes: we will create this data when data is submitted to Alloy from paintbrush (thus we will not even need to save it to our DB)





(!) (THIS IS OPTIONAL!!! Maybe will need to create another devops task after this)
 In order for script to work for users whose browsers are configured to disable third-party JavaScript, or that block the TransUnion domain, we need to set up reverse proxy on the server that serves static front-end files to proxy all requests with base url {{/iojs}} to point to {{ci-first.iovation.com/*}} . This should be done by the devops team after integration.

column1: Authenticate getpaintbrush domain on intercom
column31:
In order to be able to have our emails send out from Paintbrush from an @getpaintbrush.com email address and in order to be able to send some of the types of emails at all, we need to authenticate our domain.

*We need to create the following DNS records in our domain provider:*

CNAME: intercom._domainkey.getpaintbrush.com.
Value: [f9d7d22b-beb6-470f-84d9-c41de2e69e05.dkim.intercom.io|http://f9d7d22b-beb6-470f-84d9-c41de2e69e05.dkim.intercom.io].

CNAME: [outbound.intercom.getpaintbrush.com|http://outbound.intercom.getpaintbrush.com].
Value: [rp.paintbrush.intercom-mail.com|http://rp.paintbrush.intercom-mail.com].

*Additional instructions*

You are going to add two CNAME records to your domain on your domain provider's website. They give Intercom permission to send emails on your behalf by authenticating this domain.

* Look for a place to create or add a new record
* Choose CNAME for the record type
* Copy the Name info from the first record below and paste it into your record's Name or Host field. This field may also be called Hostname or Host record.
* Copy the Value info from the first record below and paste it into your record's Value field. This field may also be called Data or Points To.
* If you have an option for TTL, either leave it at the default setting or choose the lowest value offered.
* Add or save your record

Now repeat those steps, but this time copy/paste the info for the second record.

column1: Small ownership amounts don't allow partial percentages
column31:
Once you get below 9.5, fractions of a percent are no longer accepted for some reason in the product:

* 9.5 is allowed
* 9.4 not allowed
* 8 allowed
* 8.2 not allowed
* 7.7 not allowed
* 6 allowed
* 5 allowed
* 5.3 not allowed
* etc

!Screen Shot 2022-11-04 at 12.42.38 PM.png|width=370,height=133!

This isn‚Äôt a big issue since likely people won‚Äôt be adding owners with such smaller ownership amounts, but would be good to fix at some point.

column1: Update "Save" button logic on loan application
column31:
If a user presses ‚ÄúSave‚Äù on a page in the application or create loan process:

* if the next page is not ‚Äúcomplete‚Äù then go to next page
** Ex: I press save on ‚Äúowner information‚Äù and have not filled out ‚Äúincome history.‚Äù I should be taken to the ‚Äúincome history‚Äù page. (currently working as expected)
* if the next page IS complete, go back to loan application or loan creation summary page
** Ex: I press save on ‚Äúowner information‚Äù and have already filled out ‚Äúincome history‚Äù so that it shows it is ‚Äúcomplete.‚Äù Instead of being taken to that page, I should be taken back to the loan application summary page.

column1: Log MX verification tasks in Mixpanel
column31:

[https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-468|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-468|smart-link]
[https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-478|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-478|smart-link]
