column137:
07/–¥–µ–∫/22 10:20 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  Will it be enough if we just reuse these statuses we are going to implement for intercom?
[https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-479|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-479|smart-link]
column138: 07/–¥–µ–∫/22 11:39 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] yes, it might even work better if we log them only in Mixpanel and then they just get passed to Intercom from Mixpanel similar to how we‚Äôre handling other data and events.
column139:
12/–¥–µ–∫/22 2:36 PM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] [~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52] summing up what we have here and in [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-479|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-479|smart-link]

We want to track every ‚Äòstatus‚Äô field change in MX table. So every time the status changes - we will create a Mixpanel event (which will be duplicated in Intercom automatically).

There is a nuance that‚Äôs not quite clear to me though:

both mixpanel and intercom events are tied to a specific user id. So we can‚Äôt send events on behalf of a company, it always has to be a user. Should we use a personal guarantor user id for events of connecting both personal and bank account?

I.e. status changes from ‚ÄúCHALLENGED‚Äù to ‚ÄúDENIED‚Äù on the Business Bank Account, the personal guarantor of that company will receive mixpanel event ‚ÄúMX_BUSINESS_STATUS_CHANGE‚Äù with a {‚Äústatus‚Äù: ‚ÄúDENIED‚Äù} property. This will be propagated to the intercom on the same user level. The same will be with Personal Bank Account, with the only difference of event name.



Is that the desired outcome?
column140:
12/–¥–µ–∫/22 10:22 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818] ah good to know. are we able to tie them to the user who took the action of connecting the bank account? it will most likely be the personal guarantor bank account, but for example:

* personal guarantor connects personal bank account: tie MX personal bank account statuses to personal guarantor user ID
* second owner connects business bank account: tie MX business bank account statuses to second owner user ID

If not possible, then let‚Äôs always connect to the personal guarantor user ID.

column1: Add credit score section to decline page when decline chargeoff_delinquencies_collections is received
column31:
When we first built the logic for the decline page, the decline code {{chargeoff_delinquencies_collections}} did not exist.

Currently we have logic so that if certain decline codes are triggered, the section titled {{Obtain a copy of your credit report}} appears on that page.

We should include the decline code {{chargeoff_delinquencies_collections}} in that logic so that the credit report section appears any time that code appears.

See original doc here, with new decline code highlighted in red (some other parts may have changed since this doc was created): [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Z4I7lLZELBuBgElnTj_CtVM8F6RAbiW8lqUx-kg5JmY/edit#|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Z4I7lLZELBuBgElnTj_CtVM8F6RAbiW8lqUx-kg5JmY/edit#|smart-link]

column1: Update income instructions
column31:
We want to replace the copy in the Income History tab with the following:

----

We need at least 2 years of employment history to verify your income. 

* This is your personal income, not revenue from your startup.
* You can add as many income sources as you need by connecting your payroll provider or uploading W2s, 1099s, or paystubs.
* If you‚Äôre not sure who your payroll provider is, the easiest way is often to check your bank account deposit statement.
* You can still access your payroll account even after you‚Äôre no longer employed at a company, though you may need to reset your password if you don‚Äôt remember it.

----

We also want to change the button from {{Connect Payroll}} to {{Add Income}}

!Frame 55.png|width=1024,height=1161!

column1: Switch personal guarantor modal does not close automatically
column31:
When I try to switch the personal guarantor, a confirmation modal appears as expected. However, when I click {{Yes}} to confirm that I want to switch the personal guarantor, the following should happen:

# The personal guarantor should be switched
# The modal should be closed.

Currently #1 is happening but #2 is not. This means that a user can get confused and might think it didn‚Äôt work, and click yes multiple times again (which will do nothing since it has already been switched), or have to click cancel or click somewhere else on the page in order to get the modal to disappear.

Video: [https://www.loom.com/share/d3dfed0229f24ed9bbc04ad85a0ce071|https://www.loom.com/share/d3dfed0229f24ed9bbc04ad85a0ce071|smart-link]

column1: Update logic for owner info page
column31:
Right now, when I land on the owners page for the first time, I see the summary of all owners:

!Screen Shot 2022-10-21 at 9.27.05 AM.png|width=768,height=827!

This is confusing because it‚Äôs not immediately clear what action I should be taking.

Instead, we would like to use the following logic.

When a user navigates to the {{Owner Information}} page from a different section of the application (either by saving on the business information, hitting the scroll on mobile, or clicking on the owner information tile):

If:

# There is only one owner in the business, and
# The information for that owner is not complete

Then we would like to take you directly to the edit page for that owner:

!Screen Shot 2022-10-21 at 9.28.41 AM.png|width=784,height=981!

If:

# There is more than one owner, OR
# There is only one owner but their information is complete,

Then we would like to go to the summary page for the owners (current page people are directed to).



After I hit save on an individual owner‚Äôs information (regardless of if it is all filled out or not), it will take me back to the main summary page, following its current behavior.

column1: Always store EIN consistently
column31:
Right now someone can submit an EIN as {{87-1756576}} or {{871756576}} and both are accepted. On the client side, this is the ideal behavior.

However, on the backend, we would like to strip out any formatting and make sure we only store it as {{871756576}} regardless of how it was submitted.

Currently if the EIN is submitted as {{87-1756576}}, when we send it to Alloy, they cannot read it to be able to verify the business identity.

column1: Create release branch and set up release branch logic
column104: Move everything to production and get ready to launch
column137:
07/–Ω–æ—è/22 7:52 PM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;Release workflow:

* The developer checks out {{git checkout <commit-sha>}} to the commit that needs to be deployed
* Based on the change, the developer increments the version of an app (ideally, following semver [https://semver.org/|https://semver.org/|smart-link]) in the following format {{v0.0.1}} , by creating ({{git tag v0.0.1}}) and pushing ({{git push origin v0.0.1}}) a tag.
* Pushing the tag triggers the deployment job creating the release: [https://gitlab.com/getpaintbrush/paintbrush/-/releases|https://gitlab.com/getpaintbrush/paintbrush/-/releases]


Hotfix workflow:

* Pull latest tags from repository {{git fetch --tags}}
* Checkout to the latest released tag {{git checkout $LATEST_TAG}} and create hotfix branch {{git checkout -b hotfix/myfix}} from this tag
* Commit your changes and push the branch to remote, also tagging the same commit with new version number and pushing the tag
* Merge hotfix branch to master if needed

column31:
I went through the get-started flow with email address {{kaela+8@getpaintbrush.com}}

When I tried to add a password, it wouldn‚Äôt save or move forward, but also wasn‚Äôt giving an error on the page. When I used the console inspect tool, it showed the following errors:

!Screen Shot 2022-10-19 at 5.22.55 PM.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

I refreshed and tried filling out the form again as {{kaela+8@getpaintbrush.com}}. However, this time I got an error saying the account had already been created and telling me to log in instead. (user {{5a2e8f02-4a5e-4850-8b4a-92af566bfc85}})

When I tried to log in as that user however, the page just kept refreshing without moving forward: [https://www.loom.com/share/bd820562e72c41129a4e2593332d36fb|https://www.loom.com/share/bd820562e72c41129a4e2593332d36fb|smart-link]

However, the company for this user (company ID {{73cae907-4984-4588-9861-4e7354349427}}) does have the companyName field filled in the database, so I‚Äôm not sure why it‚Äôs giving that error.

column1: Add recaptcha to login page
column31:
Logic of recaptcha v3 and v2 should be the same as on sign up page:


* Score >= .7: Automatically approve login without requiring a user to take additional actions
* Score <= .2: Automatically reject any logins that are flagged as bots without requiring user to take any additional actions AND (!) show this page, the link there will redirect here [https://getpaintbrush.com/funding-options|https://getpaintbrush.com/funding-options]

!Screen Shot 2022-10-19 at 10.41.34.png|width=1643,height=737!
* Score > .2 and < .7: Require a captcha v2 under ‚Äúsign in‚Äú button: [https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/display#explicit_render|https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/display#explicit_render] 

(!) We do not need to update user‚Äôs recaptcha score in DB

column1: Add decline data to intercom
column31:
If an application is declined, we need to add the Alloy decline codes to Intercom so we can send the appropriate email notifications to applicants.

We would like to add all the below information to the *company* in intercom, regardless of what type of code it is and if it was related to an owner or the business.

There are a few possible ways we could do this:

# Create a tag for each decline code: [https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/create-and-update-tags|https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/create-and-update-tags] and then tag the company with each decline code: [https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/tag-companies|https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/tag-companies]
# Add each decline code as a custom company attribute that can be true/false/null: [https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/create-or-update-company|https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/create-or-update-company]
# ??

We also have the same issue with the score factors related to the credit score.

Finally, we need the credit score that was pulled on the application.

----

üîî Logic description after planning (+notes to QAs):

!image-20221024-123240.png|width=50%!


After discussion it has been decided that we need to track Alloy decline codes to Intercom on server side. 

* We will duplicate events from Mixpanel to Intercom on server side. (There are new events in this doc: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pm91hvM_OiMfh_C4SWmI1NW3ywdMY0FQ/edit#gid=460168433|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pm91hvM_OiMfh_C4SWmI1NW3ywdMY0FQ/edit#gid=460168433|smart-link])

!Screen Shot 2022-10-20 at 08.41.25.png|width=1698,height=113!

column1: application_progress Intercom event not being tracked
column31:
See: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-115|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-115|smart-link]

In Intercom, we want to be able to know every time a user takes action on their application. This event should be triggered either:

* every time a database change is made to the application before it has been submitted, 
AND/OR
* every time a user clicks save/submit within the application.

While these don‚Äôt measure the exact same thing, they are fairly close in terms of what we‚Äôre trying to assess for this purpose‚Äîuser working on the application‚Äîso either will work based on whichever is easiest to track.



UPD. we ended up deciding to duplicate all mixpanel events to intercom
column136: {pullrequest={dataType=pullrequest, state=MERGED, stateCount=1}, build={count=1, dataType=build, failedBuildCount=0, successfulBuildCount=1, unknownBuildCount=0}, json={"cachedValue":{"errors":[],"summary":{"pullrequest":{"overall":{"count":1,"lastUpdated":"2022-11-03T13:43:36.774+0200","stateCount":1,"state":"MERGED","dataType":"pullrequest","open":false},"byInstanceType":{"GitLab":{"count":1,"name":"GitLab"}}},"build":{"overall":{"count":1,"lastUpdated":null,"failedBuildCount":0,"successfulBuildCount":1,"unknownBuildCount":0,"dataType":"build"},"byInstanceType":{"cloud-providers":{"count":1,"name":"Other providers"}}}}},"isStale":true}}
column137:
12/–æ–∫—Ç/22 3:54 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52] We have an idea: we are tracking all of this already in mixpanel. [~accountid:62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818] is proposing to connect intercom to these mixpanel events and send intercom events whenever mixpanel events are triggered on these buttons.

What do you think about this? or you want it to be independent?

P.S. This is will be easier to implement and to test
column138:
12/–æ–∫—Ç/22 7:14 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] [~accountid:62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818] I think this could work great; however, there are several different events in Mixpanel that make up the {{application_progress}} event we‚Äôre trying to save in Intercom. Would it be possible to consolidate them into one event in Intercom, or would we end up with a lot of different ones?

For example, in Mixpanel, we have the following events:

* Edit Business Information
* Edit Owner Information
* Edit Owners List
* Edit Income
* Submit Application
* Information Added
* Edit Loan Terms
* Edit Income Guarantee
* Edit Autopay Agreement
* Edit Business Bank Account
* Edit Personal Bank Account
* Complete Loan

Ideally in Intercom, we would have one event:

* event name: application_progress
** metadata: mixpanel event name (Edit Business Information, Submit Application, Edit Business Bank Account, etc.)
** metadata: user ID
** metadata: company ID
** metadata: timestamp

Alternatively, rather than trying to build for this specific use case, we could just send all Mixpanel events to Intercom automatically with all their metadata attached, and that could be super helpful in addressing this use case and some of the other tickets as well.
column139:
13/–æ–∫—Ç/22 11:16 AM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52] thanks for your clarifications üôÇ 

Then I think we can just go with duplicating all mixpanel events to intercom, since it‚Äôs easiest to implement, maintain and it will be helpful for future.
column140: 19/–æ–∫—Ç/22 4:54 PM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e]  [~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52] FYI, all mixpanel events will be duplicated to Intercom with all metadata EXCEPT for mixpanel super properties, since they are passed with cookies only by http and not readable from client side.

column1: Account creation page
column31:
Sometimes users will need to be able to create an account on our site without filling out the self-assessment form.

For example:

* User already filled out self-assessment form but did not complete the step of creating their password. We email them and ask them to finish creating their account and applying for their loan. We would like to direct them to a page where they can do just create a login without having to start the self-assessment all over again. (This is the primary use case.)
* Owner 1 adds Owner 2 to an application. Owner 2 should be able to create an account to help fill out the application without having to fill out the self-assessment form again. (This is currently being solved by just making them fill out the self-assessment form and is likely a small edge case, so not that big of a deal.)

Suggested UX:

Page url: /create-account

!Account creation.png|width=91.66666666666667%!



Error handling logic:


* If email already exists in DB and password is not set ‚Üí Let the user set a password and user has to be redirected to our new and secure log in flow (with MFA)
* If email already exists in DB and password is set ‚Üí show the warning which we already have on ‚Äúget-started‚Äú page:

!Screen Shot 2022-10-12 at 10.53.20.png|width=490,height=142!

* If email is NOT in DB at all ‚Üí  show the similar warning as above, but with text: ‚ÄúLooks like we‚Äôre missing a few details before you can create your account. +Get started here+.‚Äú (+Get started here+ redirects to ‚Äúget-started‚Äú page)

column1: Add Mercury prompt to business bank account page
column31:
If a user has not added their business bank account yet, we would like to add a prompt to help them create a business bank account in case they don‚Äôt have one yet.

!Frame 79.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

Copy:

{quote}Don‚Äôt have a business account yet?

We‚Äôre +partnered with Mercury+ to provide full-stack banking for startups. When you set up your account with them, you can get expedited approval,  and if you spend $10K on your debit or credit card within your first 90 days, you‚Äôll get $500 cash. +Use this link to get started.+{quote}

Underlined portions should direct to: [https://mercury.com/partner/paintbrush|https://mercury.com/partner/paintbrush]

Logic:

* This prompt should appear below the regular copy that already exists on the page, and above the connect account button.
* This prompt should ONLY show up if the bank account is not currently connected.
* If a bank account is connected, the prompt should disappear.
* If a bank account is connected but then is removed, the prompt should reappear.

column1: Add account lock up during authenticator MFA after 5 incorrect authenticator attempts
column31:
Authenticator logic has to be done here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-307|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-307|smart-link]
Account lock up logic has to be done here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-292|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-292|smart-link]

We need to implement the same logic of lock up on authenticator MFA as on login. 

 So if user enters incorrect authenticator code 5 times within 24 hours here: 

!Screen Shot 2022-09-29 at 11.11.31.png|width=1636,height=776!

* We log them out and redirect to log in page
* Show them this warning:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-29 at 11.04.13.png|width=1581,height=811!

* Change text to: ‚ÄúYour account has been locked due to too many failed multi-factor authentication attempts. Please contact support to unlock your account.‚Äú
* The link opens the intercom chat
** When the link is clicked, it should trigger a {{Need Help}} mixpanel event with event property help prompt type {{Error}}

column1: Make sure personal bank account matches personal guarantor
column31:
When the business bank account is connected via MX, we would like to verify that it is in fact connected to the business we have approved the loan for, so we don‚Äôt accidentally approve the application for ‚ÄúSuzie‚Äôs Cool Startup‚Äù and then deposit $50,000 into a bank account for Bob Jones.

We should check the identity endpoint ([https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity|https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity]) to verify the following information:

* The {{owner_name}} matches:
** Name of the personal guarantor
** *Note from Kaela:* possible to do fuzzy matching here? ie if we have {{James Gunther}} on application and bank account is {{Jamie Gunther}} or {{James R Gunther}}?
* {{Address}} + {{postal_code}} matches:
** Address of personal guarantor
* {{Email}} matches:
** Email of personal guarantor
* {{Phone}} matches:
** Phone of personal guarantor

*Logic*:

* If able to do fuzzy matching on names, require 2 matches to pass. If not able to do fuzzy matching on names, only require 1 match to pass.
* If pass: don‚Äôt change anything
* If fail: 
** Give error {{Looks like that bank account doesn't match your information. Please connect a different one or contact our support team for assistance.}}
*** Hyperlink should open intercom help chat
*** Clicking on help link should log a mixpanel {{Need Help}} event with event property Help Prompt Type = {{Error}}
** Page should show as {{In Progress}} and not be able to be {{Complete}} until error is resolved
*** Because of this, loan should not be able to be completed without this step.

!Frame 103.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

column1: Make sure business bank account matches business borrower
column31:
When the business bank account is connected via MX, we would like to verify that it is in fact connected to the business we have approved the loan for, so we don‚Äôt accidentally approve the application for ‚ÄúSuzie‚Äôs Cool Startup‚Äù and then deposit $50,000 into a bank account for Bob Jones.

We should check the identity endpoint ([https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity|https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity]) to verify the following information:

* The {{owner_name}} matches:
** Name of business OR
** Name of one of the owners
** *Note from Kaela:* possible to do fuzzy matching here? ie if we have {{Paintbrush, Inc.}} on application and bank account is just {{Paintbrush}}?
* {{Address}} + {{postal_code}} matches:
** Address of business OR
** Address of one of the owners
* {{Email}} matches:
** Email of one of the owners OR
** -Same email domain as one of the owners- 
*** *-Note from Kaela:-* -Possible to exclude gmail, yahoo, hotmail, etc. to only do custom domains such as @getpaintbrush.com, @eze.tech, etc? If not possible/too difficult for now, then let‚Äôs not match on email domain since it might be too easy to get false positives.- (!) This part is forked here [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-410|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-410|smart-link] ([~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  FYI)
* {{Phone}} matches:
** Phone of one of the owners

*Logic*:

* If able to do fuzzy matching on names, require 2 matches to pass. If not able to do fuzzy matching on names, only require 1 match to pass.
* If pass: don‚Äôt change anything
* If fail: 
** Give error {{Looks like that bank account doesn't match your company's information. Please connect a different one or contact our support team for assistance.}}
*** Hyperlink should open intercom help chat
*** Clicking on help link should log a mixpanel {{Need Help}} event with property Help Prompt Type = {{Error}}
** Page should show as {{In Progress}} and not be able to be {{Complete}} until error is resolved
*** Because of this, loan should not be able to be completed without this step.

!Frame 102.png|width=100%!

column1: Bank account doesn't show up immediately after being connected
column31:
Right now, after I connect my bank account (business or personal) and close out of the MX modal, the bank account still takes a few seconds to appear. During this time, it‚Äôs easy for the user to think it didn‚Äôt work, and click on the {{Connect bank account}} button again, and then start going through the MX flow a second time, but then the bank account will appear on the page.

Ideally, the bank account should appear immediately.

I know we did something with Argyle to make sure the income refreshed to appear immediately‚Äîare we able to do similar with MX? 

üîß Resolution

* Disable the {{Connect bank account}} button/add a loading icon to it.

column31:

{{How much of the company does this person own according to your cap table or articles of incorporation? To be eligible for a Paintbrush Loan, the personal guarantor (the person who will be responsible for paying back the loan at 15% of their personal income should the business fail) must own a minimum of 50% of the business, have a minimum credit score of 720, and have a two-year income history greater than $100,000/year.}}

If the owner being edited is _not_ the personal guarantor, the tooltip copy can stay as is.

column1: Update logic for PG ownership warning
column31:
Currently the warning stating that the personal guarantor must have >=50% of the business shows to every user when they first land on the owners page, because that field is always null. However, it‚Äôs overwhelming to land on the page for the first time and already have an error.

!Screen Shot 2022-09-27 at 9.59.49 PM.png|width=75%!

Instead, we would only like to show this warning if the following conditions are BOTH true:

* The personal guarantor‚Äôs ownership is NOT null, AND
* The personal guarantor‚Äôs ownership is < 50%

column1: Hide personal guarantor radio and tooltip when there is only one owner
column31:
When there is only one owner, it‚Äôs unnecessary to show the radio for the personal guarantor since there‚Äôs no other option available. To simplify the UI, we would like to remove this and only show it if there are multiple owners.

So when there is only 1 owner, instead of showing this:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-27 at 9.53.46 PM.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

We would remove these parts:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-27 at 9.53.46 PM.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

So it looks like this:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-27 at 9.54.45 PM.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

Then, if a second owner is added, the radio would appear and the personal guarantor label + tooltip above, as it currently works.

column1: Store SSNs consistently in DB
column31:
It looks like we‚Äôre storing some SSNs with hyphens in them and some with no hyphens. This will make it extremely difficult to query data in the future, look for matches, etc.

!Screen Shot 2022-09-27 at 9.50.59 PM.png|width=89,height=319!

Ideally we should store all the SSNs in the same format. I don‚Äôt have a strong preference which, though I assume only the numbers is probably the way we need to pass it to Alloy and Peach so that might be better.

column1: Add loan creation expiration
column31:
We want to make sure that the loan agreement is signed within 30 days of the loan being approved.

If the application was approved > 3 days ago and the loan has not been completed, then:

* Add yellow warning banner at the top of loan creation page: {{If you do not complete your loan agreement by {application approved date + 30}, you will need to resubmit your application.}}

!Frame 101.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

If the application was approved >= 30 days ago and the loan has not been completed, then:

* Disable the {{create loan}} button on both FE and BE.
* Show red error banner at the top of the loan creation page: {{Your application was approved 30 or more days ago. In order to complete this loan, you will need to resubmit a new application to verify your information is still accurate. You can contact our support team for help.}}

!Screen Shot 2022-09-27 at 9.45.49 PM.png|width=91.66666666666667%!

* Underlined portion should open the intercom chat bubble.
** Make sure to log a mixpanel event when this is clicked
** Mixpanel help prompt type should be {{Error}}

When the loan switches to expired, the {{applicationStatus}} in Intercom should be updated to {{Expired}}: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-158|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-158|smart-link]











Actual ability to resubmit application will be addressed here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-172|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-172|smart-link]

column138: 25/–Ω–æ—è/22 1:29 AM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;Another thing, in [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-158|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-158|smart-link] it was decided that we will send 2 statuses (1 for alloy status and 1 for internal status), thus we don‚Äôt have {{applicationStatus}} in place. We are using a certain set of internal statuses in the codebase, so it would not be ideal to add another "Expired" internal status just in order to show it in the Intercom, because a lot of our app logic heavily depends on a certain set of these properties). Any suggestions? [~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] [~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]
column139:
25/–Ω–æ—è/22 2:26 AM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] 

The status of the loan agreement, personal guaranty, autopay agreement, business bank account, and personal bank account do not matter on this page. They could be complete, in progress, or to do, and it will not affect if we show the warning or if we expire the loan.

The only logic that matters is when the application was approved, and if the loan was created.

The loan is created when:

* The user clicks the final {{Complete loan}} button and then click it again in the confirmation modal
* We create the loan in our DB
* We create the loan in Peach
* We send the NACHA file to Continental to fund the loan (or put it in the queue to be funded)

If that has not happened, then the approval is at risk of expiration and should show the warning or expire as shown above.

[~accountid:62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818] 

Some thoughts:

# Let‚Äôs use the {{paintbrushApplicationStatus}} in Intercom instead of {{applicationStatus}} and switch it from {{create-loan}} to {{expired}}
# We create a new {{loanExpiredAt}} timestamp field that we send to Intercom
# Very worst case, we can do this off of date math in intercom and not add any new fields.

column1: Set up autopay in Peach
column31:
*Logic:*

* If autopay agreement was signed, follow the full process
* If autopay agreement was not signed, only do step 1

See Peach‚Äôs Postman collection here: [https://www.postman.com/peachfinance/workspace/peach-finance-api/folder/23131454-ee8820f1-90e0-4c40-9c4e-c17425feaf77?ctx=documentation|https://www.postman.com/peachfinance/workspace/peach-finance-api/folder/23131454-ee8820f1-90e0-4c40-9c4e-c17425feaf77?ctx=documentation|smart-link]

*Step 1: Create payment instrument*

[https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-341|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-341|smart-link]

*Step 2: Create document descriptor*

POST /people/{{PEACH COMPANY BORROWER ID}}/documents

{noformat}{
    "type": "loanAutopayAgreement",
    "status": "draft",
    "loanId": {{Peach LOAN ID}},
    "fileName": "LoanAutopayAgreement-{{PEACH LOAN ID}}.html"
}{noformat}

*Step 3: Render to document*

POST /communicator/render-to-document?fmt=html

{noformat}{
    "fmt": "pdf",
    "subject": "autopayAgreement",
    "channel": "document",
    "personId": "{{PEACH COMPANY BORROWER ID}}",
    "documentId": "{{DOCUMENT DESCRIPTOR ID FROM STEP 2}}",
    "context": {
        "lenderName": "Paintbrush, Inc.",
        "paymentMethod": "bankAccount",
        "paymentMethodLastFour": "{{payment method last four}}",
        "supportPhone": "888-888-8888",
        "supportEmail": "support@loan.getpaintbrush.com",
        "dateSigned": "{{created_at date from agreements table for autopay agreement}}"
    },
    "loanId": "{{PEACH LOAN ID}}"
}{noformat}

*Step 4: Make document accepted*

PUT /people/{{PEACH COMPANY BORROWER ID}}/documents/{{DOCUMENT DESCRIPTOR ID FROM STEP 2}}

{noformat}{ 
    "status": "accepted"
}{noformat}

*Step 5: Convert document*

POST /companies/{{COMPANY ID}}/documents/{{DOCUMENT DESCRIPTOR ID FROM STEP 2}}/convert?format=pdf

Company ID for Sandbox: CP-25K9-PGB6

Company ID for Production: CP-KYPK-2R5W

*Step 6: Turn on autopay (forked here:* [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-459|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-459|smart-link]*)*

column1: Create loan agreement document descriptors in Peach
column31:
We want to create the following documents in Peach so the borrower can see what agreements were signed:

* Loan agreement
* Personal guaranty

In order to do this, we need to first create a document descriptor: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.create_person_document|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Documents#operation/peach.docustore.handlers.create_person_document]

Path parameters: Use the BUSINESS borrower ID

Loan agreement

{noformat}{
  "externalId": id from agreements table,
  "type": "loanTermsAgreementOnly",
  "description": "Loan Agreement",
  "status": "accepted",
  "loanId": Peach loan ID,
  "fileName": "PaintbrushLoanTerms",
}{noformat}

Personal Guaranty

{noformat}{
  "externalId": id from agreements table,
  "type": "other",
  "description": "Personal Guaranty",
  "status": "accepted",
  "loanId": Peach loan ID,
  "fileName": "PaintbrushPersonalGuaranty",
}{noformat}



(!) It has to be done after loan has been created

column1: Create borrower payment method in Peach
column31:
In order to be able to set up autopay, we need to pass the business bank account information to Peach. We should do this at the same time we are creating the loan, borrowers, contact info, and users in Peach. We should do this for all business borrowers, whether the autopay agreement has been signer or not.

API documentation: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Payment-Instruments#operation/peach.payment_instruments.handlers.person_payment_instrument_create|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Payment-Instruments#operation/peach.payment_instruments.handlers.person_payment_instrument_create]



PATH PARAMETERS

{{personId}}: the Peach ID for the business borrower

REQUEST BODY SCHEMA

{{isExternal}}: false

{{externalId}}: mxBusinessId

{{verified}}: true

{{instrumentType}}: "bankAccount"

{{accountNumber}}: MX bank account #

{{routingNumber}}: MX routing #

{{accountType}}: MX account type

{{accountHolderType}}: ‚Äúbusiness‚Äù

{{accountHolderName}}: name of account holder from MX



(!) MX has ~10 account types, whereas peach only 2 (savings and checking), we map only savings with savings and checking with checking. If for some unexpected reason there MX sends us other 8, we will throw an error but we will implement this in scope of this task: 
[https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-454|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-454|smart-link]

column1: Rename [Save] button on "loan application" to [Submit] and make it inactive always and for everyone
column31:
We found out that this button does not make much sense on ‚Äúloan application in terms of functionality, but if it is there and inactive it helps user understand what is going on with their application.

So it should be inactive ALWAYS and for ALL users (both for PGs and non-PGs)



!submit.png|width=896,height=816!



(!) This logic is not applied to ‚ÄúYour application is ready to submit page‚Äú. On that page our usual logic (PGs can submit, non-PGs can‚Äôt) works:



!Screen Shot 2022-09-26 at 13.54.57.png|width=630,height=752!

column1: Non-PG owner not directed to correct page for "submit application" and "loan success" states
column31:
When the loan application is filled out completely, all owners, whether they are the personal guarantor or a regular owner, should be directed to /loan-application/submit both when they log in or when they click on the Paintbrush icon or Loan Application in the header.

This works correctly for the PG, but for regular owners, they are only directed to /loan-application.

See video here: [https://www.loom.com/share/3cb11ce03cc4411ba031dc5a6b4b24a7|https://www.loom.com/share/3cb11ce03cc4411ba031dc5a6b4b24a7|smart-link] 



After the loan has been signed, the PG is directed to /loan-success as they should be, but the regular owner stays stuck on /create-loan with no way to move forward. 

See video here: [https://www.loom.com/share/a956a2d4bb804173a045f76291a0a15d|https://www.loom.com/share/a956a2d4bb804173a045f76291a0a15d|smart-link]

column1: Make sure businesses don't have pre-existing debt
column31:
We want to make sure that no businesses have other pre-existing debt. To do this, when the application is submitted, we want to check the {{hasPreexistingDebt}} column. 

If {{hasPreexistingDebt}} = true, then we should automatically deny the application with reason code {{business_debt}} and not bother submitting to Alloy.

If {{hasPreexistingDebt}} = false, proceed with submitting to Alloy as usual.

column1: Skip creating "contact type" if "collision_detected" has occurred in Peach
column31:
We have discovered that emails and phones have to be unique in Peach, otherwise the error ‚Äúcollision_detected‚Äú is thrown and loan is not created in Peach. 

Since we will not have NOT unique emails, we do not worry about it too much, BUT
we might have NOT unique phone numbers, so we need to bypass this error and create loan without phone number if we are getting ‚Äúcollision_detected‚Äú

Check our last comments in this task [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-190|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-190|smart-link] for better understanding

column1: Fill denied codes for all entities in case of "manual_denied {business type}"
column31:
Special request from Kaela in the comment to this task: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-176|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-176|smart-link] 



The company has a status of {{manual_denied}} but the {{deniedCodesManual}} column is empty, which doesn‚Äôt seem like that should be able to happen. The user also has a {{manual_denied}} and has the {{deniedCodesManual}} as {{{business_type}}}. The company is the thing being denied here, because it‚Äôs the business type that is the issue. So we should either:

# Have the {{{business_type}}} denial code on both of them (for PG and for the Company), or
# Don‚Äôt deny the user at all, and only deny the company

(!) We decided to go with option 1

column1: Switch Peach loans to activated 1 day after loan is created
column31:
Currently we should be sending the loans to Peach in an {{originated}} status. We want to do this as soon as the loan agreement is signed so the borrower can access their loan in the borrower portal.

However, we need to switch them to {{activated}} in order for them to actually start accruing interest and charging payments. We want to do this as soon as the borrower is funded.

Currently we do not have a way to receive confirmation that the funds were deposited successfully, but Continental has instructed us to assume the transfer was successful unless they notify us otherwise.

We would like the process to be:

# Immediately after user clicks {{complete loan}}, send loan to peach with {{originated}} status (already happening I believe)
# At end of day, send NACHA file to Continental with funding date set for following day (already happening I believe) (UPD after discussion: yes, ‚ÄúEffective entry date already works for the following day‚Äú)
# Following day at 5 pm EST, set all loans that were created the previous day to {{active}}

column1: Income history should be soft deleted when PG is switched
column31:
See video here: [https://www.loom.com/share/26fd7c5d33264961a4b1b40f09280501|https://www.loom.com/share/26fd7c5d33264961a4b1b40f09280501|smart-link] 

If the personal guarantor has already filled out income history, and then we switch personal guarantors:

* Income history tab should wipe anything related to the former guarantor on the frontend (but not the backend)
* Anything related to the new personal guarantor should be restored (if applicable, ie. if they had previously been the guarantor and added income history, it should appear again)
* When we submit the application to Alloy, we should make sure we only send over the Argyle token for the current PG, even if there are regular owners who also have an Argyle token

column1: Add MFA via authenticator app
column31:
After a user adds a password, we would like to prompt them to add MFA to their account, but they can skip it if they choose not to do it.

Ideally they can choose between:

* Text/SMS
* Authenticator app
* Skip for now

!MFA 1.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

If they choose authenticator app, they will be prompted to scan the QR code. They will also have the option to go back if needed.

!MFA 4 (0a4f976c-c901-4557-8fb9-dfbdeef4efcf).png|width=91.66666666666666%!

When they click next, the screen should change to allow them to input the code from their app or go back if necessary.

!MFA 5 (7a2dddaa-be80-4823-ad74-8ee745580911).png|width=91.66666666666666%!

Ideally they should be able to paste the 6-digit code from their clipboard and it would fill across all 6 boxes.

When they enter the 6th digit, ideally we should automatically recognize the code and log them in or give an error without them having to hit the next button.

!MFA 7.png|width=83.33333333333333%!



(-) If user enters incorrect code, throw an error: ‚ÄúIncorrect code. Please try again.‚Äú

column1: Add security headers to prevent clickjacking
column31:
From Northcross:

{quote}Various security headers were found to be missing from the web application that could lead to clickjacking. Clickjacking is when an attacker uses multiple transparent or opaque layers to trick a user into clicking on a button or link on a framed page when they were intending to click on the top-level page. Thus, the attacker is "hijacking" clicks meant for their page and routing them to another page, most likely owned by another application, domain, or both. This site is vulnerable to clickjacking as seen in Appendix 2 and 5. For this reason, it is recommended to set several security Headers.

¬†

*Recommendation:* Sending the proper X-Frame-Options in HTTP response headers that instruct the browser to not allow framing from other domains.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† *X-Frame-Options*: DENY: It completely denies to be loaded in frame/iframe.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† *X-Frame-Options*: SAMEORIGIN: It allows only if the site which wants to load has the same origin.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† *X-Frame-Options*: ALLOW-FROM URL: It grants a specific URL to load itself in an iframe. However, not all browsers may support this.

¬†

Additionally, employing defensive code in the UI can ensure that the current frame is the most top-level window.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† *X-XSS-Protection*: This response header is a feature of Internet Explorer, Chrome, and Safari that stops pages from loading when they detect reflected cross-site scripting attacks.¬†

¬†

This header is mainly used for legacy browsers, so if there is no need to support legacy browsers, Content-Security-Policies should be implemented instead for an extra layer of defense.¬†{quote}
column104: Make sure the platform is super duper secure

column1: Generate fingerprints client-side
column31:
May be related to: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-203|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-203|smart-link] 

From Northcross:

{quote}The Loan Agreement requires users to sign, electronically, their name and generates a unique fingerprint for this signature. The fingerprint is generated on the client-side and can be altered. This means the integrity of the fingerprint cannot be trusted. For this reason, it is recommended to generate the fingerprint on the server-side.

*Recommendation:* The fingerprint that accompanying loan agreements suggest they exist to uniquely identify that signature from all other signatures. These fingerprints can be altered which defeats their purpose. Instead, generate the fingerprint on the server-side.{quote}
column104: Make sure the platform is super duper secure

column1: Enforce signatures match client side
column31:
We want to make sure the signature on a loan agreement matches the personal guarantor‚Äôs name. Right now we enforce this on the frontend but not on the backend. We should also enforce it on the backend.

!terms.png|width=1657,height=740!



From Northcross:

{quote}The Loan Agreement requires users to electronically sign their name exactly as it appears in their application profile. The application checks to ensure the signature matches the application user only on the client-side with no server-side validation of the data. This means data can bypass the client-side checks and be inaccurate. For this reason, it is recommended to verify signatures on the server-side.

*Recommendation:* The information in the loan agreements seems like it should be indisputable and immutable to better enforce a binding contract. Client-side checks can easily be bypassed. Any sensitive identifying fingerprints should be generated server-side to ensure accurate generation. Any verification checks for the signature should also be done server-side to ensure accuracy of the data.{quote}

column1: Session fixation
column31:
* Refresh a user‚Äôs session information after they authenticate and/or
* Enforce full HSTS

From Northcross:

{quote}Session cookie values are preserved before and after authentication. This allows for attackers to obtain sessions and set them on client devices to obtain a valid session if they login. For this reason, it is recommended to either refresh session information after authentication or enforce HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS).

*Recommendation:* While it is not a vulnerability to retain session information before and after authentication, it can lead to session compromises. Refresh a user‚Äôs session information after they authenticate. Alternatively, enforce full HSTS. HSTS is a web directive that directs how user agents and web browsers handle a connection. The HSTS header enforces all connections over HTTPS and disregards any non-HTTPS calls (including those from any application scripts that are called over insecure connections).{quote}

column1: Enforce password requirements server side when user is creating a password
column31:
Right now we have the following password requirements:

* Must be at least 8 characters

* Must have at least 1 letter

* Must have at least 1 number

* Must have at least 1 special character

However, these requirements are only enforced on the frontend and can be bypassed. We also need to enforce them on the backend.

(!) Additionally: we need to remove front-end validation from /login page on password field because password requirements can change in the future and old passwords might not work

From Northcross:

{quote}The current password policy is only enforced on the client-side web application and should be considered server-side security as seen in Appendix 1. For this reason, it is recommended to enforce a server-side password policy enforcement.

Post requests to /api/v1/users/setup-password can be sent to create a password with no restrictions on the password.

*Recommendation:* The current web application checks the password policy with client-side code and sends the password to the server to be hashed and stored within the database; however, there are no server-side password policy checks to ensure that the user has not bypassed the client-side checks. This creates the potential to have accounts with weak to no security for their account passwords. Implementing server-side password policy checks will mitigate clients bypassing the client-side code.{quote}

column1: Add rate limit to signups
column31:
We would like to rate limit signup attempts through the API.

From Northcross:

{quote}User accounts (email addresses) can be enumerated through two different methods as shown in Appendix 1. While it is impossible to eliminate email enumeration if usernames must be unique, there are solutions that could be implemented to eliminate username enumeration.  For this reason, it is recommended to enforce username and password authentication.

Post requests to /api/v1/users/setup-password can be sent without any rate-limiting or lockouts. 

*Recommendation:* ¬†User enumeration could lead to the compromise of user accounts. Usernames being email addresses also allows for the exposure of sensitive information. To better protect user accounts, consider implementing some architecture changes to eliminate username and email enumeration including:

* Rate limit signup attempts through the API.{quote}

column1: Add reCaptcha to sign up pages
column31:
From Northcross:

{quote}User accounts (email addresses) can be enumerated through two different methods as shown in Appendix 1. While it is impossible to eliminate email enumeration if usernames must be unique, there are solutions that could be implemented to eliminate username enumeration.¬† For this reason, it is recommended to enforce username and password authentication.

*Recommendation:* ¬†User enumeration could lead to the compromise of user accounts. Usernames being email addresses also allows for the exposure of sensitive information. To better protect user accounts, consider implementing some architecture changes to eliminate username and email enumeration including:

* Protect account sign-ups with a CAPTCHA.{quote}

I assume Google‚Äôs recaptcha is the best, but open to other suggestions.

I would love if we could use their silent recaptcha v3 option to do the following.

Automatically trigger silent captcha v3 when they click the {{submit}} button on the self-assessment form: [https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/v3#automatically_bind_the_challenge_to_a_button|https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/v3#automatically_bind_the_challenge_to_a_button]  

* Add score to users DB
* (FORKED TO ANOTHER TASK) Add score to Intercom user metadata (will be done here [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-356|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-356|smart-link])
* Score >= .7: Automatically approve any signups or logins without requiring a user to take additional actions
* Score <= .2: Automatically reject any signups or logins that are flagged as bots without requiring user to take any additional actions AND (!) show the page which Kaela mentioned in comments, the link there will redirect here [https://getpaintbrush.com/funding-options|https://getpaintbrush.com/funding-options|smart-link]
* Score > .2 and < .7: Require a captcha v2: [https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/display#explicit_render|https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/display#explicit_render|smart-link] 
* Captcha v2 should show under the button \[Submit] IF it will show. If it does not show, most likely it will be in a pop-up

 -Automatically trigger silent recpatcha v3 again when they click the ‚Äúcreate account‚Äù button:-

column1: Admins should be able to unlock a user's account
column31:
If a user‚Äôs account get‚Äôs locked due to too many failed login attempts, an admin should be able to unlock the account. We would like to create the following UI for doing so:

!Frame 51.png|width=100%!

A valid email address and 2 boxes must be checked in order for the {{unlock account}} button to be able to be clicked.

The {{additional notes}} section is optional/not required to submit the form.

Ideally upon successful unlock, a toast message (üîß DISCUSS: most likely we will implement just yellow warning which we already have designed, because toast message might take extra tome) should appear saying it was successful, and the form should be wiped.

If it was unsuccessful, the form should not be wiped, and an error should appear on the page.

Errors:

* There is no such email in DB: ‚ÄúSuch email does not exist‚Äú
* User did not check at least 2 boxes: ‚ÄúAt least 2 boxes have to be chosen‚Äú
* If the request does not pass for some other reason: most likely server error which we already have



----

Notes from Northcross:

{quote}There is currently no lockout mechanism for logins. No lockout mechanisms create the opportunity to launch brute-force attacks on user passwords. For this reason, it is recommended to implement various measures that help restrict and eliminate brute-force attacks on user passwords.

*Recommendation*: Account lockout mechanisms include protections for user logins that restrict how and when a user can login. These include:

* Implement a lockout mechanism for successive password guess attempts.
* Implement an unlock mechanism for locked accounts.

*General Guidelines:*

Apply account unlock mechanisms depending on the risk level. In order from lowest to highest assurance:
* Enforce Time-based lockout and unlock based on IP.
* Enforce Time-based lockout and unlock.
* Implement Self-service unlock (sends unlock email to registered email address).
* Enforce a manual administrator unlock.
* Enforce a manual administrator unlock with positive user identification.

Manually by an administrator: this is the most secure lockout method, but may cause inconvenience to users and take up the administrator‚Äôs ‚Äúvaluable‚Äù time.

{quote}

column1: Add account lockout after 5 incorrect login attempts within 24 hours
column31:
In order to prevent people from brute forcing their way through a million passwords, we‚Äôd like to put a limit on how many incorrect passwords can be attempted. Due to the sensitive data in our platform and the high risk of fraud, we want to keep this threshold relatively low.

UPD(!):  Currently, the users get blocked after 5 attempts.
If a user has more than 5 incorrect attempts within 24 hours, they should be locked out of their account for 36 hours. This lockout should be both client-side and server-side.

* When user logs in successfully we should reset the fail count

A warning should appear on the account page when they try to attempt to login each time after the fifth attempt.

The underlined portion should open the intercom help chat.




!Locked out.png|width=100%!

Details from Northcross:

{quote}There is currently no lockout mechanism for logins. No lockout mechanisms create the opportunity to launch brute-force attacks on user passwords. For this reason, it is recommended to implement various measures that help restrict and eliminate brute-force attacks on user passwords.

*Recommendation:* Account lockout mechanisms include protections for user logins that restrict how and when a user can login. These include:
* Implement a lockout mechanism for successive password guess attempts.

*General Guidelines:*

* Is a server-side lockout mechanism being used? 

* What should the number of unsuccessful login attempts before lockout be? If the lockout threshold is too low, valid users may be locked out too often. If the lockout threshold is too high, attackers have a higher number of login attempts before the account before it will be locked. Depending on the application‚Äôs purpose, a range of 5 to 10 unsuccessful attempts is typical lockout threshold.{quote}

column1: Make sure the platform is super duper secure
NON-PG should always see "Application pending" after data has been submitted to Alloy
column31:
Currently PG can see several different pages depending on what Alloy is returning to us (More work history, credit unfreeze etc.) but this info should NOT be shown to NON-PG because only PGs have to handle that (except additional docs). 

To make it more simple, I suggest to ALWAYS show ‚ÄúApplication pending‚Äú page to NON PG while Alloy journey is in progress OR additional docs have been requested.

In other words, IF application has these statuses:

* PENDING (/application-pending)
* UPLOAD DOCS (BUT ONLY IF: additional income history, experian unfreeze credit report)

show application pending page for NON-PG:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-12 at 10.49.29.png|width=718,height=651!

* When additional docs have been requested, show this page to both PG and NON-PG with ALL docs which have been requested (yes, ALL owners can upload all docs of anyone)
* And naturally show DENIED page when the status is DENIED with DENIED codes

Test specifications from Caroline:

You can use the following values for *business_federal_ein* to coerce different business outcomes:

* *_343434343_* *-* Business will be in Manual Review (and the JA will be in pending_review status)
* *_232323232_* *-* Business will be Denied (and the whole JA will be Denied)
* *All other EIN values* - should result in Approved, unless¬†the representatives\[] percent_of_ownership data does not add up to above 80%. If the total sum is < 80%, this will result in a Denied outcome



(!) If manual review for company is active ‚Üí We show ‚ÄúPending alloy page‚Äú

* Complete all further steps correctly
* Press the ‚ÄúComplete loan‚Äú button on /create-loan page
* See the error {{"Some company props not found"}}


Expected result: it is possible to create a loan without address 2.

The bug is in the MASTER branch.

The error from below happens on the MX bank accounts connection stage. The root cause of the issue not the absence of ‚ÄúAddress line 2‚Äú but smth else. I have created a bug for it: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-326|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-326|smart-link] 
And the error that you have received ‚ÄúOoops smth went wrong..‚Äú when clicking the ‚ÄúComplete loan‚Äú button after refreshing the page states that the loan has been created already. column1: Refactor MX table and fields in DB
column31:
To make relations in DB more logical, we need to do the following change:

* Move {{mxPersonalId}} from ‚Äúcompanies‚Äù table to ‚Äúusers‚Äù table. Thus, {{mxPersonalId}} will be connected to a user (if this user is PG) and {{mxBusinessId}} will be connected to a company in their respective tables


This is the conclusion from this spike [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-151|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-151|smart-link]

column138:
01/–Ω–æ—è/22 8:41 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;(!)(!)(!)

After this task has been merged to master, all previous passwords have stopped working. 

If you need to access old account, there are 2 workarounds (you will need direct access to DB to make it work)

Workaround 1:


# Create new user with known password
# Go to the DB
# Copy the hash of the password of this user
# Paste this hash to an old account of the user you need access to
# Log in with ‚Äúold‚Äú user with the ‚Äúknown‚Äú password you created for new user



Workaround 2:

# Run a command 
{noformat}hashPassword('somePassword').then(console.log);{noformat}

2. Then copy this hash and paste it to the needed account in DB

column1: Owner Information. Redirect loop.
column31:
Pressing the ‚ÄúSave‚Äù button when unchecked "I certify I have added all people who own 20% or more of the business and any beneficial owners, and that the information provided is accurate to the best of my knowledge." checkbox causes a redirect loop pressing the Save button when unchecked "I certify I have added all people who own 20% or more of the business and any beneficial owners, and that the information provided is accurate to the best of my knowledge." checkbox causes a redirect loop.

Preconditions:

You must be PG

STR

# Go to Owner Information Page
# Change PG to another owner
# Do not click on the checkbox
# Press the  "save" button
# See the redirect loop

column31:
Once the application is ready to submit, we need applicants to know that we are partnered with Continental, who actually issues the loans.

Underneath the loan criteria, we would like to add the following text:

{{The Paintbrush Loan is issued by our partner, Continental Bank, Member FDIC.}}

This line should be visible on both the personal guarantor and non-PG application submission page.

column1: Show warning when there is less than 80% ownership
column31:
On the owners page, we would like to show a yellow warning about the ownership requirements for the loan.

Copy: {{Please make sure you have added enough people to cover 80% of your business's ownership.}}

Show if:

* Personal guarantor is >= 50% (PG warning is not being displayed)
* Personal guarantor has a password (warning from [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-166|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-166|smart-link] is not being displayed)
* All ownership is < 80%

column1: Update copy on personal guarantor tooltip
column31:
The bank has requested we update the copy on the personal guarantor tooltip

Old:

{quote}This person will be responsible for paying back the loan at 15% of their income should the business fail. To be eligible for a Paintbrush Loan, we require guarantors to own a minimum of 50% of the business, have a minimum credit score of 720, and have a two-year income history greater than $100,000/year.{quote}

New:

{quote}This person will be responsible for paying back the loan at 15% of their personal income should the business fail. To be eligible for a Paintbrush Loan, we require guarantors to own a minimum of 50% of the business, have a minimum credit score of 720, and have a two-year income history greater than $100,000/year.{quote}

Add:

* ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù before ‚Äúincome‚Äù
* period at end of tooltip

column1: Additional documents for PG and owners [PAINT-63 Fork]
column31:
SDK Key 

{noformat}34227e77-ce8a-44a1-b0a7-8101d7a06ba6{noformat}

!Screen Shot 2022-08-23 at 10.21.19.png|width=1103,height=295!



This task was forked from a bigger task [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-63|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-63|smart-link] 

After conversations with Alloy it appeared that SDK does not have the last required update to handle our requests.
Comment from Caroline: 
‚ÄúThere is a new version of our SDK that's set to be released this month that's compatible with multi-entity journey applications, so even if you resolve the first issue you'd still likely run into a processing error. I apologize for the mixup here - I had actually thought that this update had already been released, but after checking internally it's actually slated for August 30th (with some other functionality to make implementing the SDK even easier, too\!).‚Äú

(!) New version of SDK directions are after this line. Old directions have been moved to comments for reference just in case.



To first recap on what's changed about our SDK in this version:

* In the older version of our SDK, all configuration settings had to be set on the initialization parameters when triggering the SDK in your front-end code,¬†when loading the SDK. With the Alloy's latest version, all of the following settings now live within the Alloy dashboard on the Doc-V workflow under the 'SDK Config' section:
** *documents*
** *validationPreChecks*
** *forceMobile*
** *selfie*
** *evaluationData* (this is not configured in the Alloy dashboard, but it is no longer required to set on init for the SDK if you're using Journeys).
* The new version of the SDK does not currently accept an input for the *entityToken* or *externalEntityId*.
** This means that for a multi-entity Journey where 2+ entities need to submit documents, the SDK will prompt the applicant to select which entity within the application that they are uploading documents for. This looks like the following when multiple entities in the journey are in a pending_documents state:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-07 at 15.28.51.png|width=524,height=393!

** After we spoke this AM, I confirmed with our Product team that we are planning on releasing *an update to support specifying the entity upon initializing the SDK in the next 3 weeks*. The implementation of this in the new SDK version will be very similar to (possibly even the exact same as) how it works in the legacy SDK version, i.e., by using an init param.

Some additional notes:

* You can use the same¬†[npm package here|https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alloyidentity/web-sdk], but will need to upgrade to the latest version (right now this is 0.2.12). The docs on the npm package are not updated for the new SDK, but most of it still applies:
** You can use the same alloy.init(), alloy.open(), and alloy.close() functions, and also follow along with the same React snippet at the bottom
** As already mentioned, not all of the initialization parameters listed are relevant
** The callback function response will be different - it will more closely align with the response you'd see for a Journey Application via Alloy's API

(!) UPDATE ABOUT NPM:

The NPM package version that you should use is actually [0.2.13|https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alloyidentity/web-sdk] (08.09.2022), which was pushed today
** You'll need to also include another param, *isNext*, when calling alloy.init(). You can default this to true. So your init params would look something like this (with a different Journey token than what's shown):

!Screen Shot 2022-09-08 at 07.47.04.png|width=806,height=260!
* The parameters passed into alloy.init() should include:
** *key* - you can use the same SDK key that Alloy provided a couple weeks ago. If you need me to resend, please let me know\!
** *journeyToken* - the journey token Paintbrush is using, which is: J-bjXz4XVGyyyxA9uGFDAP
** *journeyApplicationToken* - the JA token for the application where 1+ entities are in pending_documents
** *production* - should be set to false until Paintbrush is ready to go live
** (Optional)¬†*colors* - nested object where you can set the colors used in the SDK window
* [There is a help article here|https://help.alloy.com/hc/en-us/articles/8334843989275-Configuring-Document-Verification-Step-up-using-Alloy-SDK] describing the setup steps required within the Alloy dashboard. I've done¬†all of this already, but¬†you can refer to this in case you want to change anything (now or in the future after going live)

column1: We would like to track user actions using Mixpanel
column31:
We will want to set up Mixpanel to track all user actions throughout the flow so we can track dropoff, behavior, and more.

These videos gives a really good explanation of how Mixpanel‚Äôs data works: [https://help.mixpanel.com/hc/en-us/articles/360021749032-Implementing-Mixpanel-Course-|https://help.mixpanel.com/hc/en-us/articles/360021749032-Implementing-Mixpanel-Course-|smart-link] 

These are all the actions we will want to track: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pm91hvM_OiMfh_C4SWmI1NW3ywdMY0FQ/edit#gid=460168433|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Pm91hvM_OiMfh_C4SWmI1NW3ywdMY0FQ/edit#gid=460168433|smart-link] 

Their full developer documentation is here: [https://developer.mixpanel.com/docs|https://developer.mixpanel.com/docs|smart-link] 



Project token: df1c01d421c7ec765bc6ce78a9796f15

API secret: 0f71c2ae702e92cdf348b2cd643c2c94

column1: Users' actions logging
column31:
After several discussions we have decided that instead of track every action, button etc. We will just be tracking all changes in DB (rough idea is shown in this doc: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MNsxK_n2--JNlIc8S2Eid7S2S33zA3Fyt4Nxl0Ku2Aw/edit#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MNsxK_n2--JNlIc8S2Eid7S2S33zA3Fyt4Nxl0Ku2Aw/edit#gid=0|smart-link] )

We are still to decide how exactly we will do that (separate logging in kubernetes, separate redis DB or maybe even separate app or even maybe just AWS service), so details are TBD

01/—Å–µ–Ω/22 3:22 PM;62c2c9a2e16ddfe82bdee818;[~accountid:62c58aa740923988ba0a890a] there is an ‚Äúaudit‚Äù table in ‚Äúaudit‚Äù schema (NOT ‚Äúpublic‚Äù where all other tables are)

 for every change in any of DB tables via any of the endpoints - you will get a new record in audit table indicating who made this changed and what changed values were, and what table changed and so on. For example: when you register new user there will be 2 new records in audit table. 1st indicates that new row in table {{user}} has been created,  2nd indicates that new {{company}} has been created.

column1: Peach. Loans must be activated to be visible in Peach dashboard
column31:
To make loans visible in Peach Dashboard they should have {{active}} status. It means that we should send an activation request at some point in the flow. 
Right now the loans are created with {{pending}} status.  The Peach representative advised setting the status of the loan to {{originated}} during the creation for reducing the number of API calls ‚ÄúWhen the loan is created, it can be created in the {{originated}} state.¬† This will make it so the loan can be created, and then activated when the funds are dispersed.‚Äù 

Loan activation request: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Loans#operation/peach.people.loans.handlers.loan_activate|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Loans#operation/peach.people.loans.handlers.loan_activate|smart-link] 

(!) The details of the loan can‚Äôt be changed if it has {{originated}} status. From documentation:
‚ÄùOnce the loan status changes to {{originated}} attributes of {{atOrigination}} object become read-only and cannot be updated.‚Äù

{color:#4c9aff}How to test Peach flow{color}:

1) All the steps of the loan application should be completed (business info, owner info, income history)

2) All the agreements should be signed, business  and personal bank accounts should be added

3) You should be logged in. You should find your session ID. It can be found in your browser: Right Mouse Button click -> Inspect ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Cookies ‚Üí {{connect.sid}} ‚Üí you should copy the whole value of  {{connect.sid}} 
Example: {{s%3A71Bcz7vQF4JgCGG0cxzVfIbdj0Z1La-w.oKRT9X535112GF5ML6kV0lxCAKHTQlcuJNF1%2BQcPGQ4}}

4) You should create borrowers. To do it, you should replace {{YOUR_SESSION_ID}} with the value from step 3 and import the request using Postman and then send it:

# open postman.
# click *import* tab on the top left side.
# select the *raw text tab*.
# paste the raw text, then click *continue*.
# confirm the *name* , *format* and *Import as*
# if step *5*. is correct, click *import*.

{noformat}curl --location --request POST 'https://demo.getpaintbrush.com/api/v1//peach/borrowers' \
--header 'Cookie: connect.sid=YOUR_SESSION_ID' \
--data-raw ''{noformat}

In the response, you will see 

{
    "data": {},
    "status": 1
}

5) You can check the list of the borrowers. To do it, you should import the request using Postman and send it:

{noformat}curl --location --request GET 'https://demo.getpaintbrush.com/api/v1//peach/borrowers' \{noformat}

In the response, you will see the full list of the borrowers. 

6) *activation request will be here once implemented*

7) The loan should be available in Peach Dashboard under the account of your company.

column1: As an admin, I would like to filter the transactions in a bank account's history
column31:
When there are a lot of transactions in a loan‚Äôs bank account history, I would like to be able to easily find transactions that can help me get an accurate understanding of what is happening within the business.

These can be split into multiple tasks as we add each filter option over time:

* Search transaction description
* Filter by parent category or subcategory
* Filter by transaction amount (greater than or less than)
* Filter by transaction date (before or after)
* Checkboxes for any of the following booleans on the transaction:
** Bill pay
** Expense
** Income
** Direct deposit
** Fee
** International
** Overdraft fee
** Payroll advance
** Recurring
** Subscription

!Frame 48.png|width=1600,height=2476!



[https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=1683%3A8759|https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=1683%3A8759|smart-link]

column1: As a company employee, I would like to log in to Paintbrush and access administrative tasks
column31:
After launch, we will want to build a way to designate users as Paintbrush admins.

An admin cannot be associated with a loan or company, and when they log in, rather than viewing an application, they would view information about all the applications and/or loans that exist.



How we will do this:


* Introduce user role {{admin}}
* Change user role manually in DB only
* When {{admin}}¬† logs in, he/she can see only 2 admin pages and admin header

This does not follow the style guide for button states here: [https://www.figma.com/file/15Mc1mXrRtfLoUHkucmCFr/Global-Styles-%26-Assets?node-id=142%3A5420|https://www.figma.com/file/15Mc1mXrRtfLoUHkucmCFr/Global-Styles-%26-Assets?node-id=142%3A5420|smart-link] 



The button should be all gray with no border.

column1: Visual formatting for phone numbers
column31:
As a user, it would be nice if we automatically formatted the phone number into NNN-NNN-NNNN.

So if I typed 1234567890 we would automatically format it as 123-456-7890.

If I type 123-456-7890 we would also still format it as 123-456-7890 because the dashes would just type over the ones we have pre-formatted.

We would also not allow them to enter more than 10 digits.

This way they can easily see that they have entered the full number and visually distinguish any errors more easily, and make sure that they don‚Äôt run into any formatting problems.

This would not change the formatting on the backend, this would just be how it is visually styled for the user.
column137: 07/–Ω–æ—è/22 9:48 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;Dup of [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-97|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-97|smart-link]

column1: Autoformat SSN
column31:
As a user, it would be nice if we automatically formatted the SSN into NNN-NN-NNNN.

So if I typed 123456789 we would automatically format it as 123-45-6789.

If I type 123-45-6789 we would also still format it as 123-45-6789 because the dashes would just type over the ones we have pre-formatted.

We would also not allow them to enter more than 9 digits.

This way they can easily see that they have entered the full number and visually distinguish any errors more easily, and make sure that they don‚Äôt run into any formatting problems.

This would not change the formatting on the backend and would just be styling for how the user sees the SSN.

column1: As a user, when I log in, I should always be taken to the right loan application step
column31:
Right now if I log in when the application is complete but not submitted, I see this view:

!Screen Shot 2022-08-09 at 10.01.08 AM.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

However, since everything is completed, I should see the prompt telling me that everything is ready to submit. I should never see everything complete without also seeing the prompt to submit the page. This may be an issue in part because these pages were built as two separate URLs rather than one page with dynamic content.

Similarly, if the application has already been submitted, when I log in, I should see the pending/declined/need more info/loan creation page.

If the loan has already been created, I should see the ‚Äúyou did it‚Äù page.



REDIRECT LOGIC IS DESCRIBED HERE 

[https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=12%3A756|https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=12%3A756|smart-link] 

Pages which we have:

# loan-application ‚Üí default route
# submit-application ‚Üí when all 3 steps are in COMPLETED status
# application-pending (Alloy) ‚Üí NOT 4 and NOT 5
# application-denied (Alloy) ‚Üí either personal guarantor or co-owner denied
# application-upload-docs (1 page, 3 different logics) ‚Üí PG insufficient data/ PG approved/ PG docs requested and Co-owners docs requested
# create-loan (aka ‚ÄúAlloy-success‚Äù) ‚Üí PG, co-owners, company approved
# loan-success ‚Üí loan ID exists in the DB

column1: Implement device fingerprinting when user signs each of 3 loan agreements
column31:
We will want to upgrade the browser fingerprint to device fingerprint to have a better track record of the user who signed the agreements.

There is a possibility that [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-442|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-442|smart-link] will solve this issue
column137:
02/–¥–µ–∫/22 4:19 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  After talking to Alloy regarding Iovation integration and checking online all possible options (both free and paid), we have concluded that there is no viable option known to us which can track devices and give unique device fingerprint for each user.

Check answer from Caroline from Alloy: ‚ÄúThe behavior you described about the blackbox string changing is expected behavior. The blackbox from Iovation is an encrypted key that holds details about the user's session, and is not actually a unique identifier for the device, so it's normal for the value to change.‚Äú

column1: Restrict users from going back to "create loan" flow (+block links) after the loan has been created
column31:
# When user just logs in initially (fill out first 3 steps) ‚Üí restrict everything except the route /loan-application (and all its nested routes, for example /loan-application/business-info)
# After user has filled in all 3 steps` data - he is allowed to visit /loan-application/submit and edit all data that they filled in before
# After application is submitted user sends data to Alloy ‚Üí allow user to visit ONLY one route depending on their status:
- DENIED (/application-denied AND /application-denied/details)
- PENDING (/application-pending)
- UPLOAD DOCS, ADDITIONAL INCOME HISTORY, EXPERIAN UNFREEZE CREDIT REPORT  (/application-upload-docs)
# After user has been approved by Alloy ‚Üí restrict all pages except:
LOAN_TERMS: ‚Äò/loan-terms‚Äô,
INCOME_GUARANTEE: ‚Äò/income-guarantee‚Äô,
AUTOPAY_AGREEMENT: ‚Äò/autopay-agreement‚Äô,
BUSINESS_ACCOUNT: ‚Äò/business-account‚Äô,
PERSONAL_ACCOUNT: ‚Äò/personal-account‚Äô,
CREATE_LOAN: ‚Äò/create-loan‚Äô,
(!) All of the above routes will be moved to one route with nested routes

# After loan has been created ‚Üí restrict all routes except /loan-success



At all times all public routes ('help', ‚Äòfunding-options‚Äô) should be available

If user somehow gets to the restricted link they should be redirected to the page where they should be according to their current status (described here [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-207|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-207|smart-link] )

column1: Alloy
column31:
!Screenshot 2022-06-23 at 10.01.04.png|width=1644,height=864!

# First we are implementing backend part in order to get all requests back and be sure that ID uploads and denied responses are there before we start implementing backend part
# As soon as user submits data to Alloy, we show them ‚ÄúPending page‚Äú
# Check of the status is performed every time when user reloads the page
# If status is pending or ‚Äúmanual review‚Äú go here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-61|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-61|smart-link] 
* If status is ‚Äúadditional documents requested‚Äù (including additional work history), redirect here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-63|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-63|smart-link] 
* If status is denied, redirect here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-62|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-62|smart-link] 
# There can also be cases when user is bouncing back and forth because of missing info or docs, we need to be sure that user is not stuck anywhere and can go from status to status
# (!) Do NOT forget that we need to tag for Alloy who is a PG

column1: Package-lock.json issue
Redirect for app.getpaintbrush.com
column31:
* Right now if a user lands on [app.getpaintbrush.com|http://app.getpaintbrush.com] they are greeted with a blank page.
* If a user is not logged in, [app.getpaintbrush.com|http://app.getpaintbrush.com] should redirect to [https://getpaintbrush.com/|https://getpaintbrush.com/] 
* If the user is logged in, [app.getpaintbrush.com|http://app.getpaintbrush.com] should redirect to the page depending on the status
