column1: Allow businesses to set their DBA name
column31:
Right now we only ask for the legal business name. In the future, it would be nice to have two business name fields. 

The first would ask for their {{Legal Business Name}} name as it shows on their articles of incorporation and registration and would be required. (This is what we currently have.)

The second would be a field for a {{Doing Business As (DBA) Name}} and would be optional.

column1: Add preferred first name
column31: Allow owners to enter a preferred first name they would like to go by, if different from their legal name. This would just be an additional open text field under the last name field.

column1: Create contact info in Peach
column31:
[https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Contact-Information#operation/peach.people.contact.handlers.contacts_add|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Contact-Information#operation/peach.people.contact.handlers.contacts_add] 

After we create borrowers, we should create contact info for them.

path parameters

{noformat}"personId": borrower ID created in Peach for a company or users{noformat}



phone body (phone #s should be provided in [E.164 |https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164]format)

{noformat}"contactType": "phone",
"label": "personal",
"affiliation": "self",
"value": phone number formatted as with +1 country code and no spaces or other special characters,
"valid": true,
"verified": true,
"receiveTextMessages": true,
"status": "primary"{noformat}

email body

{noformat}"contactType": "email",
"label": "work",
"affiliation": "self",
"value": email address goes here,
"valid": true,
"verified": true,
"status": "primary"{noformat}

address body

{noformat}"contactType": "address",
"label": "personal",
"affiliation": "self",
"address": {
"addressLine1": "string",
"addressLine2": "string",
"city": "string",
"countyOrRegion": "string",
"state": "string",
"postalCode": "string",
"country": "US",
"POBox": "string"
},
"valid": true,
"verified": false,
"status": "primary"{noformat}

once this task has been completed:

column140:
19/—Å–µ–Ω/22 4:37 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:62c58aa740923988ba0a890a] [~accountid:62f52046f15eecaf50109d14]  
FYI about testing about emails (most likely we will not have such issues on prod, so this is ONLY about testing):


Sometimes if you are using same emails you might get the error {"message": "collision detected",     "status": 400} because in Peach email has to be unique. This might happen because we sometimes clear the DB and after that what might seem for us as a unique user will not be a unique user for Peach.
column141:
19/—Å–µ–Ω/22 4:43 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52] 

We need a strategy how to handle not unique emails, phones in peach.

Emails are not an issue, emails are unique per user in our app and we do not allow users to create an account with the same email.

BUT, currently we do allow to use same phone numbers for different accounts. And if user sends data to peach with the same phone number, the loan will just not be created in peach because Peach returns "message": "collision detected"


So the question is, in terms of business logic:

1. Should we force users to use unique phone numbers? (just give them an error that someone is already using this phone number) But this option might not be very secure
2. Maybe there is a chance that we do not have to create ‚Äúcontact type: phone‚Äú in Peach for borrowers (the simplest decision)
3. Your option üßê
column142:
19/—Å–µ–Ω/22 7:51 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] the phone number contact isn‚Äôt required in Peach, and I think in a non-testing environment, it will be pretty unlikely that we run into this issue.

So let‚Äôs not worry about adding any logic on our side to enforce unique phone numbers. Then if Peach returns a ‚Äúcollision detected‚Äù message, then we just don‚Äôt create a phone number contact for that user.

column1: Set up SSO for borrower portal
column31:
Ideally borrowers should be able to log into Paintbrush and then access Peach‚Äôs borrower portal without any additional login required.

Peach supports SAML SSO to make this possible: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Auth#operation/peach.security.handlers.saml_sp_auth.idp_initiated|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Auth#operation/peach.security.handlers.saml_sp_auth.idp_initiated|smart-link]

column1: If there are multiple owners who try to edit an application, none of them can edit owner info
column31:
Repro steps:

# Kaela1 adds Kaela2 as an owner on Kaela1's company (this is okay)
# Kaela2 fills out the get started form using the same email address (this is okay)
# Kaela2 creates an account using that same email address (this is okay)
# Paintbrush doesn‚Äôt create a new user or a new company, and Kaela2 gets logged in as the owner on that same application Kaela1 created and can see what's already completed, in progress, to do, etc. (this is okay)
# Kaela1 and Kaela2 can both edit business information and it will save correctly (this is okay)
# NEITHER Kaela1 nor Kaela2 can edit any owner information or change the personal guarantor anymore (this should be fixed so they can both still edit)

See video here: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/15G2DJ3o1sFiITwDLYDtEOO0Iz0xqkkXy/view?usp=sharing|https://drive.google.com/file/d/15G2DJ3o1sFiITwDLYDtEOO0Iz0xqkkXy/view?usp=sharing|smart-link]

column1: Add NeuroID tracking
column31:
NeuroID is a tool that watches for indicators of fraud based on user behavior and how they interact with the form. To take advantage of it, we need to install a javascript snippet on our site.

This is their explanation of how to set it up:

NeuroID is a simple JS installation. It usually takes engineers an afternoon to complete the integration. The integration is often tagged onto existing sprints and waiting for the deployment window to production is the hard part that usually takes the longest. The detailed integration steps are found here: [https://neuro-id.readme.io/docs/quickstart|https://neuro-id.readme.io/docs/quickstart] and here is a video walking through the integration: [https://vimeo.com/717977252|https://vimeo.com/717977252]

Specifically, here is an overview of the deployment process:

# Engineer typically performs the integration on localhost or a dev environment
## Add data-neuro-label attribute to the required input fields
## Load and start the JS (typically just adding the provided script snippet to the header
## Send the user ID (Alloy ID) on whatever page it becomes available
## Stop the JS if required. NID does not required stopping the JS
# Engineer confirms with NID that the data looks correct after walking through a single application
# Deploy the integration to production

*Paintbrush-specific notes:*

* We will need to be able to identify which owner pages are the same as the person who is logged in vs which ones are owners that are different from the person logged in
* We will customize {{nid('start', [page_identifier]);}} on each page so that the page_identifier applies to each of the below pages
** business_information
** owners_list (page summarizing the owners view)
** applicant_information (page where you‚Äôre editing a specific owner, and it‚Äôs the same owner as the person who is logged in)
** additional_owner_information (page where you‚Äôre editing a specific owner, and it‚Äôs a _different_ owner from the person who is logged in)
** income_history
* {{nid('setUserId', [value]);}} is how users will be identified; we will use their Paintbrush user ID for [value]
* Only when the user submits the application, we should call the application submit function:
{{nid('applicationSubmit'); nid('sendData');}}
** We should NOT call the application submit function on any of the business info, owner info, or income history pages when they hit the save button.
* For the applicant_information page, where the owner information being edited is the same as the information about the person logged in, we should label all fields that have the behavior column as {{Known Field}}
* For all other pages, including business_information and additional_owner_information, we should tag each field as {{secondary_address_all_fields}} with a {{--}} after to then label it uniquely. For example:
** {{secondary_address_all_fields--businessAddress1}}
** {{secondary_address_all_fields--businessAddress2}}
** {{secondary_address_all_fields--businessEIN}}
** {{secondary_address_all_fields--additionalOwnerPhone}}
** {{secondary_address_all_fields--additionalOwnerSSN}}
** etc.

column1: Make sure applications are not in a prohibited industry before sending to Alloy
column31:
When a loan application is submitted, we should check their {{industry}}.

Do not send to Alloy if:

* Content creation
* Biomedical/pharmaceutical
* Financial & money services
* Gambling & casinos
* Marijuana and tobacco
* Adult goods or services
* Real estate

Send application to Alloy if:

* Any other code

Instead we should automatically deny that loan with reason code {{industry}} and not bother to send the application to Alloy.

column1: Block non-US IP addresses
column31:
We should require applicants to have a US-based IP address to be able to edit and submit our application.

Note: We will need to figure out a workaround for our engineering team. üòÖ Maybe we whitelist specific IP addresses?

Possible tools: 

* [https://ipdata.co/|https://ipdata.co/|smart-link] 
* [https://www.verifiedlydocs.com/v2/fraudprevention/ipsecure.html#sample-response|https://www.verifiedlydocs.com/v2/fraudprevention/ipsecure.html#sample-response|smart-link]

column1: Block VOIP phone numbers
column31: When users are adding their phone numbers, we would like to perform a lookup to verify that it is a real phone number held by an individual and not a VOIP number that could be used fraudulently.

column1: Block VPNs
column31:
Based on fraud best practices, we should not allow users with a VPN to submit an application.

The ideal state for this is that when they land on the get started page, we tell them Paintbrush is not available in their area.

!VPN.png|width=91.66666666666667%!
column137: 04/–Ω–æ—è/22 8:39 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;Can be addressed in Alloy once Iovation is implemented.

column1: Task to reopen application
column31:
There will be occasional times when an application has been submitted and denied, and after the applicant has talked with support, they will decide to edit their application and reapply. We would like to have a way to manually update the status of their application in this case so they can access the pages and edit their data again and submit when they are ready.

*This can start out as a terminal command or postman API call or whatever is easiest, no UI needed.*

Eventually at some point in the future once we build the admin portal, it will look something like this:

!Frame 50.png|width=100%!

*Terminal command/API call:*

* Should require a company ID and personal guarantor ID to be able to run
* Does not need a reason
* Does not need to create new records in the DB
* SHOULD be recorded in the audit logs however ideally that the change was made to the existing records (can skip if not enough time)

*Should fail/error if:*

* That combo of company ID + PG ID isn‚Äôt valid ‚Üí (Error: ‚ÄúCompany ID and Personal Guarantor ID do not match‚Äù)
* The application is already/still in application status ‚Üí (Error: ‚ÄúThe application is in progress by the applicant‚Äù)
* The application has already been approved ‚Üí (Error with the identical text)
* The loan has already been created ‚Üí (Error with the identical text)

*Should succeed if:*

* That combo of company ID + PG ID is valid AND
* Application is in one of the following states:
** pending
** denied
** needs more info
** manual review

column1: Extra super duper fraud protection
Task to disable users from accessing applicant portal
column31:
We want to be able to disable the account of a user who is not the personal guarantor in instances when two users are both connected to the same company, until we have built out the full user experience for these users with the right permissions and views.

For now, we would like to handle this manually by running a task in the terminal.

We would like to be able to enter the following information:

* current information that will not change:
** user ID
** user email
** company ID
* input data that will be updated in the DB:
** status active/disabled (or some similar type field we will add to the users table)
* checks in place
** the task should fail if all the current information does not match a row in the DB
** the task should fail if personalGuarantor = true for that user

Once [audit history is built|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LPHuq-idCi8KG-V0v7a-_pcJsnoUWPLzIsPTMunxSlc/edit], we will need to make sure these changes are tracked as well.

column1: Task for switching company of user
column31:
We want to be able to adjust the company ID of a user in instances when two users have created an account but need to work on the same company‚Äôs application.

For now, we would like to handle this manually by running a task in the terminal.

We would like to be able to enter the following information:

* current information that will not change:
** user ID
** user email
* input data that will be updated in the DB:
** company ID
** personalGuarantor true/false
* checks:
** task should fail if user ID and user email are not a match for a single row in the DB

Once [audit history is built|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LPHuq-idCi8KG-V0v7a-_pcJsnoUWPLzIsPTMunxSlc/edit], we will need to make sure these changes are tracked as well.

column1: Add warning on owners page when personal guarantor is not current user
column31:
If:

* The personal guarantor is set to a user other than the person logged in, AND
* The personal guarantor has a null password field/has not created an accoount

Then:

* We should display a warning at the top of the page letting them know that person will need to create an account to finish the application:

{{{personal guarantor} will need to work on this application with you. Please have them fill out this form to create their account.}}

Link should direct to the get started form in new tab

If they switch the personal guarantor back to themselves (user who is logged in), or if the other owner has created their account, then the warning should disappear.

column1: Update industry list
column31:
As we‚Äôve worked with the bank on finalizing our credit policy, we need to have a larger list of industries that businesses can identify themselves as so we know if we can eliminate them or not.

This industry list needs to be updated in both the *get started page* and the *business info page*.

Industry list should be (bolded items need to be added, strikethrough should be removed):

* Software
* Hardware
* Locally-based business
* Consumer goods
* Ecommerce/dropshipping
* Consulting
* Content creation
* Biomedical/pharmaceutical
* *Financial & money services*
* *Gambling & casinos*
* *Marijuana and tobacco*
* *Adult goods or services*
* *Real estate*
* -Other-

On the get started page, we should also update the industry logic to say the business is likely not a fit if any of the italicized industries below are selected:

* Software
* Hardware
* Locally-based business
* Consumer goods
* Ecommerce/dropshipping
* Consulting
* _Content creation_
* _Biomedical/pharmaceutical_
* _Financial & money services_
* _Gambling & casinos_
* _Marijuana and tobacco_
* _Adult goods or services_
* _Real estate_

column1: Additional Intercom fields after Alloy integration
column31:
In the original task [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-114|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-114|smart-link]  There are several fields which we do not have at the moment because Alloy integration has not been finished yet.

We need to add these fields in scope of this task:

* applicationStatus
** in_progress, complete (all fields filled out, but not submitted yet), pending, manual_review, needs_income, needs_docs, needs_credit_unfrozen, approved, declined ((!) We do not have this before Alloy)

üîî UPD: 
We will send both Paintbrush application status and Alloy application status in 2 different properties, because otherwise the data can be a mess and difficult to read:

Paintbrush application properties:


{noformat}‚Äòloan-application‚Äô,
‚Äòsubmit-application‚Äô,
‚Äòapplication-pending‚Äô,
‚Äòapplication-denied‚Äô,
‚Äòapplication-upload-docs‚Äô,
‚Äòcreate-loan‚Äô,
‚Äòloan-success‚Äô,{noformat}
 
Alloy properties:

{noformat}'started',
'frozen_file',
'insufficient_data',
'docs_requested',
'denied',
'approved',
'manual_review',
'auto_denied',{noformat}
* applicationSubmittedAt
* applicationStatusUpdatedAt (???)
* loanCreatedAt

These should all be tracked as COMPANY variables.

column1: Updated flow for failed self-assessments

The bullet points under ‚Äúdue to the following‚Äù should be dynamic according to which criteria they fail.

* See the full list‚Ä¶: [http://support.getpaintbrush.com/en/articles/6213228-what-information-is-used-to-determine-loan-approvals|http://support.getpaintbrush.com/en/articles/6213228-what-information-is-used-to-determine-loan-approvals]

* Explore other funding options‚Ä¶: [https://getpaintbrush.com/funding-options|https://getpaintbrush.com/funding-options]

column1: MX data structure
column31:
I like how we‚Äôve split the MX data out into its own table. One issue though is that the mxPersonalID is currently linked to a company, not to the personal guarantor, based on how the data is structured.

A few possible suggestions:

# Have one mxID field on the users table and one on the companies table
# Have them both be on the loans table rather than the companies table (though I think this probably won‚Äôt work since we don‚Äôt create that row until the loan is fully created if I understand correctly)
# Have an ‚ÄúaccountOwnerID‚Äù column on the MX table, and if type=personal the ID refers to the users table, and if type=business the ID refers to the companies table

Or something else better ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
column137:
31/–∞–≤–≥/22 8:14 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  After discussion on planning we have concluded that the most logical way to make your request work is make something similar to bullet point 3, specifically:

* We can add PG id as a column in the MX table, and it will be easier for you to track the info. 

What do you think?
column138:
01/—Å–µ–Ω/22 6:57 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] I think that works fine. Couple questions:

# Will we drop the {{mxPersonalId}} from the companies table at that time since it doesn‚Äôt need to be connected to the company but instead to the PG?
# Is it weird that we are connecting the business to MX and the PG to MX in different ways? Ie MX id on companies table, but user ID on MX table? Shouldn‚Äôt they be handled consistently? Either both the company/user IDs on MX table or the MX IDs are on their respective companies/users tables?
column139:
02/—Å–µ–Ω/22 3:46 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  Based on your questions and what you have described + based on the fact that when table was initially created there were some gray areas in logic, I think the best and the easiest way to do the following thing:

* Move {{mxPersonalId}} from ‚Äúcompanies‚Äù table to ‚Äúusers‚Äù table. Thus, {{mxPersonalId}} will be connected to a user (to PG if they are one) and {{mxBusinessId}} will be connected to a company in their respective tables

Sounds okok?
column140: 02/—Å–µ–Ω/22 6:01 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] that works great, thanks\!
column141: 02/—Å–µ–Ω/22 6:40 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  Great. Create a task to track it [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-276|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-276|smart-link]

column1: Bank connection checkboxes
column31:
We should show a checkmark next to the bank account name to let them know it has been successfully connected.

!Frame 85.png|width=75%!

column1: Make sure owners don't have pre-existing Paintbrush loans
column31:
We want to make sure that no owners have other pre-existing Paintbrush loans. To do this, when the application is submitted, we want to check the social security number of each person against the SSNs of each user who is already connected to an existing Paintbrush loan that has been fully created.

If _any_ of the owners on the submitted application match _any_ of the owners on an existing loan, we should automatically deny with reason code {{paintbrush_owner}} and not bother submitting to Alloy.

If there are no matches, or if the matches are only to in-progress applications, proceed with submitting to Alloy as usual.

column1: Make sure businesses don't have pre-existing Paintbrush loans
column31:
When a loan application is submitted, we should check to see if any loans have already been created in our DB using that EIN.

Send application to Alloy if:

* No matching EINs are found
* Other applications have been started with that EIN

*Do not send to Alloy if:*

* *Other loans have been created with that EIN (in DB there is a loan on ‚Äúloan table‚Äú which has company in companyID which has the same EIN)*

Instead we should automatically deny that loan with reason code {{paintbrush_business}} and not bother to send the application to Alloy.

column1: New question on business info (dept radiobutton)
column31:
In order to help us determine what businesses are a good fit for us, we would like to know if businesses have any pre-existing debt before the Paintbrush Loan. This should be a radio button that is required for them to answer.

!Screen Shot 2022-07-24 at 4.28.50 PM.png|width=75%!

It should also have a tooltip with the following text: ‚ÄúLearn more about what counts as pre-existing business debt here.‚Äù and the whole thing should link to this page: [http://support.getpaintbrush.com/en/articles/6384515-what-counts-as-pre-existing-business-debt|http://support.getpaintbrush.com/en/articles/6384515-what-counts-as-pre-existing-business-debt]

column1: Only the personal guarantor's account should be able to submit the application and create the loan
column31:
The personal guarantor is the one who is legally agreeing to have their credit checked and legally agreeing to the terms of the loan. Thus, not only do we need to make sure that it is their signature on the loan, but we also need to make sure it is their account.

So if I have two owners, like this: 

!Screen Shot 2022-07-24 at 1.47.12 PM.png|width=66.66666666666667%!

Both users should be able to edit the application, but only Stephen should have write access to be able to hit submit on the application, and only Stephen should have write access on anything related to loan creation. We should verify that the email address associated with Stephen‚Äôs account is logged in to be able to do those actions.



Scope:  

(!) Regular user (not PG) can access sign loan and connect MX steps, BUT the buttons and the fields should be disabled with a tooltip, specifically:

* Signature fields on all 3 sign loan steps are inactive:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-12 at 10.32.50.png|width=51.7034990791897%!

* -Hovering with a cursor over signature field on desktop- Let‚Äôs add ‚Äúi‚Äú icon which we have on another screens to maintain design consistency hovering on which OR tapping on mobile will show a tooltip ‚ÄúOnly Personal Guarantor can perform this action‚Äú
* \[Save] buttons and tiles should be active because regular user can go both ways to check agreements
* \[Connect Account] on ‚Äúbusiness account‚Äù should be ACTIVE‚Äîa regular owner can do this action.
* \[Connect Account] on ‚Äúpersonal account‚Äú step should be Disabled  (Hovering with a cursor on desktop OR tapping on mobile will show a tooltip ‚ÄúOnly Personal Guarantor can perform this action‚Äú)

!Screen Shot 2022-09-12 at 10.37.44.png|width=823,height=567!






* \[Complete Loan] button should be inactive with the same tooltip logic as described above:

!Screen Shot 2022-09-12 at 10.40.16.png|width=548,height=594!

column1: Invite personal guarantor
column31:
Only the personal guarantor can submit the application and agree to the loan terms. That means we need to invite them to create their account. Ideally it should work like this: 

* I switch the personal guarantor to someone else
* We send them a text or email with a link to sign in
* When they click the link, ideally:
** It should take them to the forgot password page (see [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-144|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-144|smart-link] )
** We should autofill their email address/autosubmit the form for them
** We should autosend the code to them 
** So they are just told they need to enter the code and then create a password (screens 3 and 4)

We can probably handle sending the invitation in Intercom if:

# We are able to structure the URL so that if I land on something like [www.getpaintbrush.com/forgot-password?email=kaela@getpaintbrush.com&submit=true|http://www.getpaintbrush.com/forgot-password?email=kaela@getpaintbrush.com&submit=true] then it would automatically fill out and submit the form for me to send a code
# We can create an intercom event with the correct metadata (see [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-115|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-115|smart-link] )
column104: Allowing multiple users to fill out a loan application with different permissions

column1: Forgot password
column31:
We need a way to handle users who have forgotten their passwords. Ideally the flow should be as follows:

On the login page, there is an option to choose a ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù

!Log in.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

When this is clicked, if the email is already filled out, skip the next step. If the email is not filled out, ask for their email:

!Ask for email.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

Once they‚Äôve added their email (or if they had already filled it out on the login screen when they clicked ‚Äúforgot password,‚Äù we will send them a verification code and take them to the following screen to input it:

‚ö†Ô∏è I do not know how we should send these codes, as I don‚Äôt think these can be sent via Intercom. These will probably need to be handled the same way we handle MFA, which also won‚Äôt be able to be handled via Intercom. This should maybe be split out into a separate task?‚ö†Ô∏è

!Reset code.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

After they‚Äôve successfully entered their code, they will be prompted to set a new password similar to normal:

!Reset password.png|width=83.33333333333334%!

Designs: [https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=316%3A22265|https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=316%3A22265]

column1: Loan creation pages should not be able to be signed if loan is not approved (DISCUSS AFTER 198)
column31: This is probably just because we‚Äôre waiting on the Alloy piece to be finished, but documenting just in case‚ÄîI should not be able to do anything on any of the loan creation pages (I don‚Äôt mind if users can view them to see what‚Äôs expected, as long as there are no write abilities) until their application is actually approved. I was able to sign a loan agreement when my income history still showed as ‚Äúto do‚Äù because I had the URL.

column1: Signature must match personal guarantor, not just any owner
column31:
The error code says the signature must match the personal guarantor, but the logic seems to only require it to match an owner. I was able to sign a loan as Kaela Worthen when the personal guarantor was Stephen Walter.

!Screen Shot 2022-07-24 at 1.47.12 PM.png|width=821,height=698!

!Screen Shot 2022-07-24 at 1.47.32 PM.png|width=769,height=920!
column137:
25/–∏—é–ª/22 3:09 AM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;After further testing, it appears that it is forcing the signature to match the user logged in, regardless of whether that person is the personal guarantor or not. Since you should not be able to sign on behalf of another person, this is desired behavior. If the person logged in is not the personal guarantor, we will solve that through [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-146|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-146|smart-link] 

Marking this obsolete.
column138: 25/–∏—é–ª/22 4:55 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  Indeed, big chunk of logic now is connected to the person who is logged in because to show demo to bank we are not expecting some ‚Äúweird‚Äú behavior from users clicking buttons all over the place. And yes, I would like to discuss the personal guarantor ‚Äúinvite‚Äú logic in more details during our calls üëå

column1: Income history should show in progress if any have been added
column31:
If any income history has been added but it is not yet complete (checkbox has not yet been clicked), it should show as ‚Äúin progress.‚Äù Right now it shows as ‚Äúto do‚Äù even when I hit save and leave this page and come back to it.

Update: it won‚Äôt change to completed even when I have checked the box. I can‚Äôt get it to move out of ‚Äúto do‚Äù status to be able to move forward in the application.

Double update: I think this is because I had switched the personal guarantor to be someone besides myself, but it was still showing my income history. This should be solved by [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-49|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-49|smart-link] so I‚Äôm marking this as obsolete.

!Screen Shot 2022-07-24 at 1.36.00 PM.png|width=772,height=740!

column1: Owners must be at least 18 years old
column31:
Right now I‚Äôm able to save a DOB that is today‚Äôs date. If a date is entered that is < today - 18 years, we should give the following error: {{All owners must be at least 18 years old to qualify for a Paintbrush Loan.}} and prevent them from saving that field.

column1: Personal guarantor must have >=50% ownership
column31:
This is a new criteria we have established as we have been working with the bank.

*Logic for changing personal guarantor:*

* If the owner has >= 50%, the radio button is active to be able to select for them
* If the ownership % is unknown, the radio button is also active
* If the owner has <50%, the radio button is disabled for them

*Logic if personal guarantor‚Äôs ownership is <50%*

* Show error at the top of the page: {{The personal guarantor must have at least 50% ownership of the business.}}
* Owner info section cannot be complete until personal guarantor has >= 50% ownership and will show {{In Progress}} until this is addressed.

column1: Not able to erase fields from owner information
column31: If I enter something incorrectly into owner information that I want to erase (for example, a second address line that shouldn‚Äôt be there), I want to delete that field and then save. However, deleting the text fields and saving does not update any of the fields as it should and still keeps all of the data. It gives the impression that the save was successful, but when I click back into the owner field, all the data that I ‚Äúerased‚Äù is still there.

column1: Allow owner info to be saved even when incomplete
column31:
Saving owner info should work the same as saving business info‚Äîmissing fields should not prevent you from saving, they should just mark it as in progress and prevent you from submitting the application.

Currently I am not allowed to save new fields in my application because some are missing:

!Screen Shot 2022-07-24 at 12.40.05 PM.png|width=66.66666666666667%!

Instead, it should save and return to the owners page, but have a status bar for each owner. See mocks:

!Frame 31.png|width=91.66666666666667%!
column137:
10/–∞–≤–≥/22 4:20 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  We need to think more about this task:

1. We do not recommend to give users the ability to save empty names, because if they do, when they log in, the name will be empty in the header which will look weird

2. And we surely do not recommend saving empty emails, because there might a problem when user removes email and then just cannot log in (plus saving empty email is in general not the best practice)

To sum up, I am just trying to say that this logic is not that simple as it seemed at first. We need to think more about it. Please let me know what you think about the points I have mentioned above. Thanks\!
column138: 10/–∞–≤–≥/22 6:16 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] I agree, we should require name and email no matter what. It looks like through other changes, that‚Äôs the way it is now working‚Äîthose are the only fields that are required to save an owner and all others don‚Äôt require you to fill them in to save (only to complete), so I think we can mark this one as obsolete.

column1: Full name from self-assessment should be split into first and last name on owner info
column31:
If there are multiple words entered into the name field on the self-assessment form, we should automatically enter the first word as the first name, and all additional words as the last name under owner info.

Currently everything is being entered as the first name.

!Screen Shot 2022-07-24 at 12.34.38 PM.png|width=75%!

column1: Sections should show as "in progress" if there are any non-null fields
column31: If any fields are not null, the section should show as ‚Äúin progress.‚Äù This means that by default when an applicant first creates their account, they will see business info and owner info as both ‚Äúin progress‚Äù since they both have data that has been carried over from the self-assessment form.

column1: After status on a section is completed, it always stays completed
column31:
Once a section shows ‚Äúcompleted,‚Äù it always stays that way. However, as a user, I could delete all the text fields in the application and it would still show as complete when it is no longer complete and should now show as ‚Äúin progress‚Äù again.

column1: Address Line 2 should not be required for section to be complete

We should also make sure it is not required for owners.

column1: Loan application - Income History. Adding of an empoyer cahnges the status of Owner Information
column31:
Progress of Owner information depends on progress of Income History progress.
STR:

# Create a new user
# Add one employer in ‚ÄúIncome history‚Äù tab
# Proceed to ‚ÄúLoan application‚Äù page
# See that the status of ‚ÄúOwner Information‚Äù changed to in progress.

Expected result: progress of each stage is independent.

column1: Loan application. Owner Information. ‚ÄúHome Address Line 2‚Äù should not be required field
column31:
Owner information stays in ‚ÄúIn progress‚Äù until the field ‚ÄúHome Address Line 2" is not filled in.
‚ÄúHome Address Line 2‚Äù is not required field according to the designs. 
STR:

# Create a new user
# Proceed to Owner information tab
# Fill in all the fields except ‚ÄúHome Address Line 2‚Äù
# Save the changes
# Mark ‚ÄúAll owners have been added‚Äù checkbox
# See that the status of ‚ÄúOwner information‚Äú is still ‚ÄúIn progress‚Äú

Expected result: Owner information should show ‚ÄúCompleted‚Äù in case all the fields (except ‚ÄúHome Address Line 2‚Äù) on the page are filled and the checkbox ‚ÄúAll owners has been added‚Äù is marked.


This also needs to be updated for business address.

column1: [Save] redirect logic on "Income history" (3rd step)
column31:
!3rd.png|width=722,height=666!

We need to add additional logic for for this button because it redirects to different pages depending on if all the steps have been COMPLETED or not

IF all the steps have been completed, THEN redirect to ‚ÄúYour application is ready to submit‚Äú

!Screen Shot 2022-07-19 at 11.02.58.png|width=681,height=855!



IF at least one step is IN PROGRESS or TO DO state, THEN redirect to /loan-application page



!Screen Shot 2022-07-19 at 11.04.25.png|width=578,height=737!

column1: New loan table fields
column31:
Over time, it is possible that a loan could transition into multiple states:

* Starts as regular business loan with 15% interest
* Converts to personal guarantee being repaid at 15% of income
* Person goes into active military duty and loan goes into special state to comply with SCRA legal requirements
* Loan is discharged
* Etc

According to our bank‚Äôs recommendations of lending industry best practices, we should create a new loan each time we change the terms of the loan. However, in order to be able to easily track the history across these new loans being created, we want to:

* Have a short, human-rememberable loan ID
* Be able to know what loans converted into and from which other loans

I‚Äôm suggesting the following loan structure, but open to ideas:

* loan ID stays as is
* NEW FIELD: loan name = 3-digit number + status identifier
* NEW FIELD: converted from: previous loan ID (if any)
* NEW FIELD: converted to: loan ID it changed to (if any)

For example:

||*id*||*name*||*companyID*||*userID*||*createdAt*||*updatedAt*||*deletedAt*||*convertedFrom*||*convertedTo*||
|014005b6-e001-49ec-a0d3-8223f7596bd4|123-B|06213efe-07a9-42f7-a24b-293f4eadb239|0992fbf1-cc12-4277-a418-8e601645238b|2022-06-17 15:11:13.174+00|2022-06-29 18:07:07.04+00| | |0d4e11a4-6e2e-4d44-b8ec-48807f3782f5|
|0d4e11a4-6e2e-4d44-b8ec-48807f3782f5|123-PG|06213efe-07a9-42f7-a24b-293f4eadb239|0992fbf1-cc12-4277-a418-8e601645238b|2022-06-29 18:07:07.04+00|2022-07-29 18:07:07.04+00| |014005b6-e001-49ec-a0d3-8223f7596bd4|0f72e2bc-939d-4490-8deb-2ac28beba128|
|0f72e2bc-939d-4490-8deb-2ac28beba128|123-D|06213efe-07a9-42f7-a24b-293f4eadb239|0992fbf1-cc12-4277-a418-8e601645238b|2022-07-29 18:07:07.04+00| | |0d4e11a4-6e2e-4d44-b8ec-48807f3782f5| |



(!) DO NOT forget add all these extra fields to peach
column137:
19/–∏—é–ª/22 6:18 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  2 questions:

1. Status identifier should mean something or it can a random latter?
2. If we user 3 digits + 1 letter we are limited only to 26000 loans (10x10x10x26) which sounds like a lot but there might be some problems after several years when we run out of IDs. Can I suggest to have at least 5 digits?
column138:
21/–∏—é–ª/22 10:29 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] 

1. Ideally status identifier should be as follows:

* B = business repayment (all loans are in this state by default)
* PG = in personal guarantee repayment (converted to this state manually)
* D = discharged (converted to this state manually)
* SCRA = active service member duty
* may be others in the future that we will need to identify

2. Yeah, 5 digits is totally fine. And/or we can just continue incrementing the number as we start running out, whichever you guys prefer\!

column1: Create borrowers in Peach
column31:
We will need to create borrowers in peach using the following endpoint: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Borrowers#operation/peach.people.handlers.borrower_create|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Borrowers#operation/peach.people.handlers.borrower_create] (pw: peachonthebeach)

API key: 92889a81d43342eeb8ae91c97108d8b4

(!) We will need to create 1 borrower for the business AND 1 borrower for EACH owner. So if an application has 3 owners, 4 total borrowers will be created.

Business borrower:

{noformat}{
  "borrowerType": "business",
  "externalId": business ID in Paintbrush,
  "status": "active",
  "collectinsIntensity": "normal",
  "metaData": {
    "industry": string,
    "website": string,
    "address1": string,
    "address2": string,
    "city": string,
    "state": string,
    "zip": string
    },
  "commPreferences": {
    "statementDeliveryChannels": [
      "email"
      ],
    "sendRemindersWhenCurrent": true
    },
  "businessDetails": {
    "businessType: enum "LLC" "cCorporation" "sCorporation" "generalPartnership" "limitedPartnership" "soleProprietor" "nonProfit" "other",
    "businessName": string,
    "businessLegalName": string,
    "incorporatedCountry": USA,
    "incorporatedState": The state code (not full name) where the business was incorporated or organized. For example: CA
    },
  "identity": {
    "identityType": "FEIN",
    "value": string,
    "valid": true,
    "issueDate": date,
    "expirationDate": null,
    "issuingCountry": "USA"
    }{noformat}



Person borrower

{noformat}{
  "borrowerType": "person",
  "externalId": user ID in Paintbrush,
  "status": "active",
  "collectinsIntensity": "normal",
  "metaData": {
    "personalGuarantor": boolean
    "ownershipShare": integer
    "homeAddress1": string
    "homeAddress2": string
    "city": string
    "state": string
    "zip": string
  "commPreferences": {
    "statementDeliveryChannels": [
      "email"
      ],
    "sendRemindersWhenCurrent": true
    },
  "name": {
    "prefix": null
    "firstName": string
    "middleName": null
    "lastName": string
    "maidenLastName": null
    "suffix": null
    "preferredFirstName": null
    },
  "dateOfBirth": in UTC time
  "identity": {
    "identityType": "SSN",
    "value": string,
    "valid": true,
    "issueDate": null,
    "expirationDate": null,
    "issuingCountry": "USA"
    }{noformat}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
How to test:

# You should fill all steps in Loan Application and Loan Creation
# Send POST request to [/api/v1/peach/borrowers|http://localhost:9000/api/v1/peach/borrowers]. In peach will be created borrowers (1 for company and other for startup owners), and you can find all it through peach dashboard [https://paintbrush-agent.peach-sandbox.finance/crm|https://paintbrush-agent.peach-sandbox.finance/crm] or you can send GET request to  [/api/v1/peach/borrowers|http://localhost:9000/api/v1/peach/borrowers]. In DB will be filled peachBorrowerId in users and company tables
{panel}

column1: NACHA file for Continental
column31:
In order for applicants to receive their $50,000 loan, we need to tell Continental who to send the money to and how. NACHA is a standardized format of a .txt file for Continental that contains details for all transactions that need to happen in order to fund the loans. It consists of 6 main parts:

* 1 File Header: The first row, with information about the bank the money is coming from
* 2 Batch Header: The second row. In many NACHA files there are multiple batches within a file, but ours will only ever have 1 batch
* 3 Transaction data: Information about how much money to send to whom. There will be one row for each loan originated. Sometimes referred to as Entry data.
* 4 Batch Footer: The row after all the transactions. Summarizes all the transactions in the batch. Sometimes referred to as the Batch Control Record
* 5 File Footer: Row at the bottom with summary of all the information in the file. Since there‚Äôs only one batch in the file, many of this information will be the same as in the batch footer. Sometimes referred to as the File Control Record
* 6 Padding: NACHA files must have rows in multiples of 10, so if there are not enough rows, then a row of 999s (or multiple rows) are added at the very bottom after everything else



Information for Paintbrush NACHA file fields: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17hQUjRIRabeKWpK00RIRwX6SQ1pXqn_YLDbFWB21DyI/edit#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17hQUjRIRabeKWpK00RIRwX6SQ1pXqn_YLDbFWB21DyI/edit#gid=0|smart-link] 

* Yellow = waiting on bank to provide missing information
* Orange = data will vary each time and need to be input via code
* White = constant 



General guidelines here: 

* [https://secureinstantpayments.com/sip/help/interface_specs/external/NACHA_format.pdf|https://secureinstantpayments.com/sip/help/interface_specs/external/NACHA_format.pdf]
* [https://www.treasurysoftware.com/ach/how-do-i-create-an-ach-nacha-file-detailed-file-format.aspx|https://www.treasurysoftware.com/ach/how-do-i-create-an-ach-nacha-file-detailed-file-format.aspx|smart-link] 



There are a few public repos that may help with creating the NACHA file:

* Go: [https://moov-io.github.io/ach/aws/lambda/json_to_nacha/lambda_json_to_nacha/|https://moov-io.github.io/ach/aws/lambda/json_to_nacha/lambda_json_to_nacha/|smart-link]  
* Elixir: [https://github.com/RiverFinancial/nacha|https://github.com/RiverFinancial/nacha|smart-link]  
* C#: [https://github.com/mycargus/nacho-nacha|https://github.com/mycargus/nacho-nacha]
* .NET: [https://github.com/ekonbenefits/NachaSharp|https://github.com/ekonbenefits/NachaSharp|smart-link] 
* Other repos: [https://github.com/topics/nacha|https://github.com/topics/nacha|smart-link]

column1: Communication
Intercom event data
column31:
To simplify managing all our customer interactions in one place, we want to trigger all our transactional emails, drip campaigns, and sms messages through intercom.

If we can make sure the correct data is sent to intercom, then everything can be handled directly in their app without any additional code.

[https://www.intercom.com/help/en/articles/175-set-up-event-tracking-in-intercom|https://www.intercom.com/help/en/articles/175-set-up-event-tracking-in-intercom]

[https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/event-model|https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/event-model] 

We want to be able to track the following events:

* page_view (triggered whenever a new page is loaded)
** metadata: page_title
** metadata: page_url
* application_progress (triggered whenever a user takes action in the application or loan creation that makes changes to the DB)
** metadata: page_title
** metadata: page_url
** (x) metadata: new_personal_guarantor (boolean)‚Äîtrue whenever the personal guarantor is changed AND the new personal guarantor is not someone who has an account already (we cannot do this task now due to the fact that PG logic is currently incomplete, forked it to this task: [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-164|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-164|smart-link] )

column1: Intercom company data
column31:
To simplify managing all our customer interactions in one place, we want to trigger all our transactional emails, drip campaigns, and sms messages through intercom.

If we can make sure the correct data is sent to intercom, then everything can be handled directly in their app without any additional code.

For each *company*, we need to know the following data: [https://developers.intercom.com/installing-intercom/docs/javascript-api-attributes-objects|https://developers.intercom.com/installing-intercom/docs/javascript-api-attributes-objects] 

* company_id
* name
* created_at
* website
* industry

We will also want to have the following custom attributes on the company: [https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/create-or-update-company|https://developers.intercom.com/intercom-api-reference/reference/create-or-update-company] 

* companyUpdatedAt
* mxBusinessOwnerPhone
* mxBusinessOwnerEmail







[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52] UPD: I have created a separate task [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-158|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-158|smart-link]  for the fields below because we do not have these statuses before Alloy has been implemented

* applicationSubmittedAt
* applicationStatus (approved, declined, manual review, info requested, pending) ((!) We do not have this before Alloy)
* applicationStatusUpdatedAt
* loanCreatedAt

column1: Intercom user data
column31:
To simplify managing all our customer interactions in one place, we want to trigger all our transactional emails, drip campaigns, and sms messages through intercom.

If we can make sure the correct data is sent to intercom, then everything can be handled directly in their app without any additional code. For each *user*, we need to know the following data:

User records: [https://developers.intercom.com/installing-intercom/docs/javascript-api-attributes-objects|https://developers.intercom.com/installing-intercom/docs/javascript-api-attributes-objects]

* email
* user_id
* created_at
* name
* phone
* unsubscribed_from_emails: this is ALWAYS set to false
* user_hash
** [https://www.intercom.com/help/en/articles/183-enable-identity-verification-for-web-and-mobile|https://www.intercom.com/help/en/articles/183-enable-identity-verification-for-web-and-mobile] 
** [https://app.intercom.com/a/apps/at0bg2t2/settings/identity-verification/web|https://app.intercom.com/a/apps/at0bg2t2/settings/identity-verification/web]
* company: links to company object in intercom [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-114|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-114|smart-link] 

We will also want to set the following *custom* attributes on the user: [https://www.intercom.com/help/en/articles/179-send-custom-user-attributes-to-intercom|https://www.intercom.com/help/en/articles/179-send-custom-user-attributes-to-intercom] 

* incomeLevel
* creditScore
* personalGuarantor (boolean)
* isMailingSubscriber
* selfAssessmentStatus (prequalified/disqualified) ((!)we do not have this)
* userUpdatedAt
* userAccountCreatedAt (when was password created on the account)
* personalBankAccountConnectedAt
* mxPersonalOwnerPhone
* mxPersonalOwnerEmail

getFingerprint()

Get Fingerprint. Return a 32-bit integer representing the browsers fingerprint.

I have tested signing of agreements in Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome and Safari (both incognito and default mods) on Mac. 

Also, tested it on Android (Google Chrome, Firefox) and on Safari on IOS. In all the default  cases it works fine. 

Tried changing the orientation and resolution of the screen in Google Chrome (first signature with one resolution and the second with another - it causes error and the agreement can‚Äôt be signed).

But in some cases if the fingerprint differs the agreements still can be signed: 



!image-20220803-115822.png|width=350,height=247!

column1: Navigating between steps saving logic (create loan flow)
column31:
* If user puts signature for the first time, \[Save] button saves this signature and signature field becomes inactive (This has been already done)
* In this task we need to implement the logic that \[Save] button on signatures and MX parts redirects to the next step (In other words most of the time \[Save] button does not save but just redirects further)
* \[Save] button on the last step (Personal account) redirects to ‚ÄúYour Paintbrush Loan has been approved‚Äú page

column1: Messages queue for Continental
column31:
We will need to send Continental data every day via SFTP. These files should be sent on a daily basis at -3 AM est- (UPD: 11PM est (at NIGHT)), even if there are no new loans that day and they are empty.



(!) We need to send only new loans, we need to check if we have sent the loans before and if yes, do not send them again



{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
UPD: Let‚Äôs implement it but switch it off for now before the bank accepts our final file format and enable it before the release

UPD 2 [~accountid:5e315f59082f050e722342a5] : we do NOT have to send empty files. IF there are no new loans, just do NOT send anything on that day

Comment from Kaela:
We should not include all previous loans, ONLY the new loans. the only incrementing is ideally in the trace number ([row 37 in this sheet|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17hQUjRIRabeKWpK00RIRwX6SQ1pXqn_YLDbFWB21DyI/edit#gid=0]), if we can make that increment so that if yesterday we sent a file that had 0124003070000001 and 0124003070000002, today we would send a file that had 0124003070000003 and 0124003070000004
{panel}

column1: Need help prompts
column31:
Throughout the application and loan creation process, we have ‚Äúneed help‚Äù prompts on almost every page.

!Frame 32.png|width=1024,height=1227!

We will want to have the ‚Äúneed help‚Äù button at the bottom of all the application and loan creation pages also open the intercom chat

* Will open intercom chat bubble when clicked
* Installation documentation: [https://developers.intercom.com/installing-intercom/docs/basic-javascript|https://developers.intercom.com/installing-intercom/docs/basic-javascript|smart-link] 
** Should only open the widget when they click on the chat bubble, not be there all the time by default
* Our intercom app ID: at0bg2t2
* When they chat in, we should include the following user data if possible:
** User‚Äôs ID
** URL of the page they chatted in from
** Page title of the page they chatted in from

column1: Allow dropdowns to be edited by typing ('search in dropdown')
column31:
Right now dropdowns can only be edited by hitting enter.

Ideally they should also be editable by typing when the dropdown is selected without requiring the user to hit enter first. For example, on the state dropdowns (business address, business registration state, owner address), I should be able to tab to that field, and then start typing ‚ÄúUtah‚Äù or ‚ÄúDelaware‚Äù and it should open the dropdown and scroll to the applicable field. 

The rest of the current editing and scrolling behavior when typing should stay the same, including being able to hit enter to open the dropdown. This should just be an additional way of opening the dropdown.



Implement it in all dropdowns except ‚Äòcredit score‚Äô and ‚Äòincome history‚Äô

Scope:

* Add permanent ‚Äú+1‚Äú number inside the phone field before the user starts to enter the phone number
* Mask the phone number which user enters in the format NNN-NNN-NNNN (ex. what it will look like: +1 647-208-7188)
* Do not allow to enter more than 10 digits
* Save only plain numbers to DB









Additional info for reference after this line:

----

Right now we only accept phone numbers with numbers and no special symbols, but many people format their phone numbers with dashes or parentheses (for example, my browser autofilled my phone number with that formatting in it).

This is confusing because we can end up giving an error telling them to enter a valid phone number when they have already entered a valid phone number:

!Screen Shot 2022-07-11 at 12.25.17 PM.png|width=50%!

!Screen Shot 2022-07-11 at 12.25.54 PM.png|width=1680,height=1050!

Possible solutions:

* 1st best: We allow parentheses, spaces, and dashes to be typed in, but we strip them out on the backend when saving the phone number. Similarly, if the phone number starts with a 1 or +1, we should strip that out since we don‚Äôt need the country code (we can only accept US applicants right now).
* 2nd best: We don‚Äôt allow them to even enter those characters in on the front end (if they type it, we just ignore it) and have validation that only allows them to enter 10 digits with no additional characters (if they keep typing past 10 characters we just ignore them)
** Bonus if we can automatically show dashes after the numbers for them on the frontend so it‚Äôs visually easier for them to make sure they typed their phone number in correctly xxx-xxx-xxxx



As a user, it would be nice if we automatically formatted the phone number into NNN-NNN-NNNN.

So if I typed 1234567890 we would automatically format it as 123-456-7890.

If I type 123-456-7890 we would also still format it as 123-456-7890 because the dashes would just type over the ones we have pre-formatted.

We would also not allow them to enter more than 10 digits.

This way they can easily see that they have entered the full number and visually distinguish any errors more easily, and make sure that they don‚Äôt run into any formatting problems.

This would not change the formatting on the backend, this would just be how it is visually styled for the user.

column1: Make full name on prequal correspond properly to first name and last name when filling out "owner information"
column31:
The core of the problem is that we have ‚ÄúFull name‚Äú field on prequal page and 2 fields for first name and last name on owner information page: 

Prequal:


!prequal.png|width=1640,height=848!

Owner information:


!333.png|width=1646,height=873!



This causes a problem: Full name is currently regarded as first name by our application.



(!) What has to be done:
When user enters full name on prequal page with 2, 3 or even 4+ words we should ALWAYS regard first name as first word and last name as whatever comes after first word.

Example:

User enters on prequal: Full name: ‚ÄúCuba Gooding Jr.‚Äù

We show on owner information:
First name: ‚ÄúCuba‚Äú
Last name: ‚ÄúGooding Jr.‚Äú

column1: Update warning message on business type and registration state
column31:
Right now when someone chooses Not Registered, we show: ‚ÄúLLC or Corp is required to be registered for the loan.‚Äù

Ideally this error should should read as:

* Businesses must be registered as an LLC or Corporation to qualify for a Paintbrush Loan. If you haven‚Äôt registered your business yet or need to re-register it, you can [+use this link to get $100 off with Paintbrush‚Äôs partner Stripe Atlas+|https://dashboard.stripe.com/atlas/invite/prod-paintbrush-XJDsZt].

The link should direct to: [https://dashboard.stripe.com/atlas/invite/prod-paintbrush-XJDsZt|https://dashboard.stripe.com/atlas/invite/prod-paintbrush-XJDsZt]

Ideally this error should show whenever a user chooses:

* Not registered (either on the state or business type dropdown)
* Sole proprietorship
* Non profit
* Partnership

This error should NOT prevent them from saving‚Äîit is a yellow warning, not a red blocker.

STR:

2) Proceed to loan application page
3) Proceed to Owner Information tab
4) Fill the Email field with the email address of your current account
5) Fill in all the required fields 
6) Press Save button

Actual result: ‚ÄúPlease, contact your system administartor!‚Äù alert is shown - no possibility to save a new guarantor.

column1: Aggregation flow for MX (+"identity" job)
column31:
Pre-conditions: 

While implementing Paint-23 we cut out the so-called aggregation for transactions (to monitor user‚Äôs transactions for our own purposes). This part of task was going to be very long and complicated.

This tasks is tightly connected with ‚Äúidentity‚Äú job (In production identity job requires more time and more sophisticated implementation)



Scope: 

So ‚Äúin production‚Äú there will be instances when user has to give answers to additional questions from banks. Luckily MX can handle all of that with their modal windows and we just need to receive the response from them like: connected, failed, denied, challenged etc‚Ä¶.

Ideally if we receive this response from MX, this would be solved by adding an error message on the page showing the user they need to verify that bank account and with a link to do so:

!Frame 105.png|width=75%!

Clicking on the link would open the MX modal.

If possible, it would be nice to also change the status to a {{needs more info}} status, but that may be a larger lift.

!Frame 106.png|width=58.333333333333336%!

Once they have answered any additional questions or provided information, if the verification is pending, we would show an information blurb and have the status as {{in progress}}.

!Frame 107.png|width=75%!

* During these verifications (there might be 2 verifications actually with different questions, just like we have with Alloy: checking one info first, if there are additional questions, MX will ask for another info) the step will be ‚ÄúIn progress‚Äú which means that the user cannot submit a loan, because we have this logic already 

We should also create logging in Mixpanel for these events, which should also be transferred into Intercom. Placeholder task that Kaela will fill in here: [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-423|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-423|smart-link]

column1: "Need to verify some information page" + upload docs
column31:
This should be one page that could have 3 different types of information requested:

* government-issued ID (will trigger doc upload through Alloy) ((!) NOT IMPLEMENTED, Alloy has update their API to handle the requests properly, more details in this task [https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-251|https://aleph-one.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-251|smart-link] )
 (-)  DO NOT TEST THIS PART\!
** [https://developer.alloy.com/public/docs/_sdk|https://developer.alloy.com/public/docs/_sdk] 
** [https://developer.alloy.com/public/reference/documents-1|https://developer.alloy.com/public/reference/documents-1] ¬†
** [https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alloyidentity/web-sdk|https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alloyidentity/web-sdk] 
* additional income history needed (will re-trigger Argyle SDK/iframe)
* credit file needs to be unfrozen (will trigger modal for them to say they have unfrozen)
** Experian link 1: [https://www.experian.com/freeze/center.html|https://www.experian.com/freeze/center.html]  
** Experian link 3: [https://www.experian.com/blogs/ask-experian/how-to-unfreeze-your-credit-report/|https://www.experian.com/blogs/ask-experian/how-to-unfreeze-your-credit-report/]  

Alloy may send us some or all of these -requests-  responses at different times so the page should be dynamic. We should automatically resubmit to Alloy once all fields on the page are complete.

!Screen Shot 2022-07-28 at 11.07.58 AM.png|width=91.66666666666667%!



[~accountid:5fb24d170d2f61006ff8509d]  (!) UPD+more specifics ([~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  Please review this and let us know if we got everything correctly):

Alloy will NOT send us back ALL responses at once. Instead there will be 3 phases and Alloy will not send us the response to every next phase until the previous phase has been passed.

3 phases:

# More income history¬†required (for PG)
# More docs required (all owners at once)
# Credit file frozen



In other words, if more income history is required, Alloy will not even start checking other owners and we will display on this page for PG:



!Screen Shot 2022-08-15 at 12.01.09.png|width=1106,height=686!



And only after this Alloy will check other owners and let us know if more docs from them are required

column139:
15/–∞–≤–≥/22 7:11 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] [~accountid:5fb24d170d2f61006ff8509d] just to be clear, when you say:

{quote}And only after this Alloy will check other owners and let us know if more docs from them are required{quote}

This is true IF there is more income history required. But if there is sufficient income history, it will skip directly to the next phase. 

So an application could have all 3 phases in order (income history, documents, credit file frozen), or just two of them, or just one of them.

13/—Å–µ–Ω/22 6:26 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;A few issues with the frozen credit experience: [https://www.loom.com/share/fd0f7ddcce7d41c1a4a789bd70732715|https://www.loom.com/share/fd0f7ddcce7d41c1a4a789bd70732715|smart-link] 

# Double lines under the frozen credit prompt, and looks like it would be similar for requested docs/more income needed
# After I say that I've unfrozen my credit, the app gets stuck trying to swap between /application-pending and /application-upload-docs. It shows a loading state, the URL keeps flickering, sometimes shows an empty page needing more docs, and on the first time it happened to me, sometimes loaded the list of pending FAQs as well.
# It doesn't seem to be able to escape the loop until you refresh the page or close out the tab entirely, and then when you come back, it shows that the application has been successfully approved.

column1: Investigate the possible change of jwt to sessions for log in
column31:
Initially we were planning to implement sessions for log in, but the project boilerplate which we used had issues with that and implementing sessions could have taken a lot more time than expected.

So we have decided to implement jwt as quickly as possible in order not to block the development cycle. 

We need to decide about jwt and sessions after our boilerplate has all the bugs fixed regarding this and implement new code from boilerplate to our project

column1: As a regular owner I should not be able to view or go directly to "income history step"
column31:
If I am a regular owner (not a PG)



* Income history tile should be inactive

* Link to income history step should redirect you back to ‚Äúlanding page‚Äú



Comment from Kaella in the task [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-18|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-18|smart-link] :









‚ÄùIdeally if they change the personal guarantor we would remove the employment history on the front end since there is a new personal guarantor, and show that this step has not been done. However, on the backend we should KEEP all the employment history tied to the owner it was connected to, in case they switch who the personal guarantor is again, so they don‚Äôt have to reconnect or reupload everything (both to save the user the effort and because there is a connection fee for us each time)‚Äù

Note: the current complete/in progress/to do logic is already working correctly when the personal guarantor is switched

column1: Connect bank accounts (integration with MX) [SIMPLIFIED VERSION]
column31:
This task is a simplified version of [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-23|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-23|smart-link]  story to do the simplest integration before we run out of support with MX team until July 8th

!Screenshot 2022-06-14 at 13.03.31.png|width=1241,height=888!

!Screenshot 2022-06-14 at 13.03.40.png|width=1303,height=938!



Scope:

* Create blank page with only one button \[Business account]
* Clicking on ‚Äúconnect bank account‚Äù launches an iframe/widget using MX‚Äôs SDK that allows users to enter their bank account credentials
** [https://docs.mx.com/api#connect_the_connect_widget|https://docs.mx.com/api#connect_the_connect_widget] 
* We want to store:
** The bank account information: [https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_accounts|https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_accounts]
**  The identity of the account holder: [https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity|https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity] 
** Fields to monitor transaction activity: [https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_transactions_transaction_fields|https://docs.mx.com/api#core_resources_transactions_transaction_fields] 



*Acceptance criteria of the task:*

* Blank page with \[Business account] button
* Clicking the button opens the MX sdk modal
* After filling out the info on the modal MX will return the fields described above and we will send them to our DB

column137: 17/–∏—é–Ω/22 3:27 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  I assume that the answer will be no, but just in case: Can a user connect 2 bank accounts? (From the design it looks as if they have to remove the current one in order to connect another)
column138:
17/–∏—é–Ω/22 6:25 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;Comment from Kaela to clarify fields which we need:

Ideally in the short term I would like to see:

* On the table where we store business information, add fields for:

* Bank account holder (tbd)
* Bank account name
* Bank account type
* Bank account number
* Bank account routing
* Transaction monitoring turned on y/n (or if there is some unique identifier/key for this, use that instead and leave null if not turned on)

* On the table where we store owner information, add fields for:

* Bank account holder (tbd)
* Bank account name
* Bank account type
* Bank account number
* Bank account routing
* Transaction monitoring turned on (we won't have to use transaction monitoring for quite a while on personal bank accounts since this will only apply if they switch over to income-driven repayment)
* These fields should only be filled in for the personal guarantor, no other owners

For _now_, we do not need to store the actual transaction data anywhere, but at some point in the future we *will* want to pull that into an admin portal where our team can review transactions.¬†
column139: 17/–∏—é–Ω/22 8:11 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] for now to keep things simple, we will only allow them to connect one account. However, in the future at some point I could see a situation where we eventually allow multiple business accounts (for example, I want you to deposit the money into Account A, but withdraw payments from Account B ).
column140:
17/–∏—é–Ω/22 8:13 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;Related to the account holder (tbd) field:

We will also want to store all the fields retrieved from [https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity|https://docs.mx.com/api#identification_identity]  so we can assess how well the account holder‚Äôs identity matches the identity of the owner/business we have on file.

column1: Check if email already exists in DB when creating account
column31:
On ‚Äúset password‚Äú page we need to run a check when user creates an account (presses \[create account]) if this email already exists in DB + if password has already been created for them



If email is already in DB and password has already been set up, we need to redirect the user to the log in page: [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-10|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-10|smart-link] with warning: ‚ÄúLooks like you‚Äôve already created an account. Log in instead‚Äù



UPD: when user enters email and the password has not been created yet, BUT the user has already entered this email before and we have it in DB, we need to update this entry with this email in DB with new info the user has entered in the prequal page

column1: As a user I would like to see the progress of my application
column31:
There should be 3 statuses:

* To Do
* In Progress
* Completed


* ‚ÄúTo Do‚Äú should be there if the user has not saved any step at least once, if user presses save on Step at least once, ‚Äúin progress‚Äù should be there
* ‚ÄúIn Progress‚Äú should be there if user has at least one field with (*) is empty on ANY form OR if checkbox about 2 years of history OR all owners has not been checked
* ‚ÄúCompleted‚Äú should be there is there are no conditions for ‚ÄúTo Do‚Äù and ‚ÄúIn Progress‚Äú
* When user clicks \[Save] last third step, and at least 1 step is in progress, we need to redirect user to original /loan-application page with statuses which show what is in progress

!Screenshot 2022-06-22 at 12.38.21.png|width=577,height=662!

* \[Submit] button must be inactive if at least something is ‚Äúin progress‚Äú
* (!) We need to save the statuses for each for 3 steps because we need all 3 steps to be COMPLETED for Alloy integration

column1: Send CSV data to Continental
column31:
We will need to send Continental 2 pieces of data each day via SFTP. These files should be sent on a daily basis at 3 AM est, even if there are no new loans that day and they are empty.



Access:

*Location*: [https://sftp.cbankus.com:8080|https://us-west-2.protection.sophos.com/?d=sftp.cbankus.com:8080&u=aHR0cHM6Ly9zZnRwLmNiYW5rdXMuY29tOjgwODA=&i=NTk5MzM0OTgwNjYzMGMxMmFmMjVkNGQw&t=SVIvbFdhRE5FQlV6RXRvVWxMVFQzZ0UyV0grNmlQelN0YlFoRS9oYnhMUT0=&h=d4df6c4da1fa442e93165ea5fd3c726f] or 22 depending on how you connect

*Username*: paintbrush

*Password*: Sm00thStr0k3s\!



CSV of originated loans
[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Z6ddfC8T8ggc2EhPe1CcdHo4BXSoPwZZI6q1igguQgE/edit#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Z6ddfC8T8ggc2EhPe1CcdHo4BXSoPwZZI6q1igguQgE/edit#gid=0|smart-link] 

NACHA file for them to disburse funds

[https://www.treasurysoftware.com/ach/how-do-i-create-an-ach-nacha-file-detailed-file-format.aspx|https://www.treasurysoftware.com/ach/how-do-i-create-an-ach-nacha-file-detailed-file-format.aspx|smart-link] 



How to test: 

* we can start sending over test data whenever we're ready
* they'll let us know manually that they've received files for now, no automated way of confirming



(!) UPD. After a discussion it has been decided to break this task into the current task + 3 auxiliary tasks:
[https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-108|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-108|smart-link] 

[https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-109|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-109|smart-link] 

[https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-118|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-118|smart-link] 



DoD of this task:

* We generate the data from our DB which can be sent to bank using the creds given above
* We send the data ONLY in CSV using postman request, NOT clicking any button in our UI
* We contact bank directly via email for example and ask them if they have received the data in CSV
* Need to add endpoint in order to test the file format
* NACHA will be done separately in this task [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-118|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-118|smart-link] 
* We do NOT implement messages queue in scope of this task, this will be done here [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-109|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-109|smart-link] 
* We do NOT connect this functionality to any button on the UI at the moment, this will be done later

column1: Create loans in Peach
column31:
We will need to create the loan in peach using the following endpoint: [https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Loans#operation/peach.people.loans.handlers.loans_add|https://sandboxdocs.peach.finance/tag/Loans#operation/peach.people.loans.handlers.loans_add]   (pw: peachonthebeach), API key: 92889a81d43342eeb8ae91c97108d8b4

request path

{noformat}"personId": peachBorrowerId created for business,
"validate": false{noformat}



request body

{noformat}{
  "type": "installment",
  "loanTypeId": "LT-V2KE-36KM",
  "externalId": loan id in loans table,
  "metaData": {
    "loanName": string,
    "convertedFrom": string
    "convertedTo": string
    "repaymentType": "business"},
  "nickname": companyName + Business Repayment + StartedAt (for example, Paintbrush Business Repayment 7/18/2022),
  "servicedBy": "creditor",
  "status": "pending",
  "additionalPeople": [
    {
      "personId": PeachBorrowerId created for each individual user,
      "loanRelationType": "coBorrower" for personal guarantor, "applicant" for all other owners
    }
  ],
  "atOrigination": {
    "amountFinanced": 50000.00,
    "duration": 60,
    "originationLicense": "nationalBank",
    "originatingCreditorName": "Continental Bank",
    "interestRates": [ 
      {
        "interestType": "absolute",
        "days": null,
        "rate": .15
      }
    ],
    "aprNominal": .15, 
    "aprEffective": .15,
    "paymentFrequency": "monthly",
    "specificDays": [1],
    "personAddress": {
      "addressLine1": address1,
      "addressLine2": address2,
      "city": city,
      "countyOrRegion": null,
      "state": state,
      "postalCode": zip,
      "country": "US",
      "POBox": null
    },
    "totalInterestAmount": 21369.70,
    "totalInterestCapAmount": null,
    "skipCreditReporting": true
  }
}{noformat}

How to test:

# You should fill all steps in Loan Application and Loan Creation
#  You should create borrowers.
# Send POST request to [/api/v1/peach/|http://localhost:9000/api/v1/peach/borrowers]loans. In peach will be created loan and you can find it through GET request to [/api/v1/peach/|http://localhost:9000/api/v1/peach/borrowers]loans.

After deploy and talking to devops it appears that in our current infrastructure (mainly due to AWS load balancer and its configuration) sending the correct IP address is not the simplest task.

So the question is: how important is it to use IP to identify the user? Maybe we can use only name for now? Or we can think about another option (for example browser or device fingerprint) Just exploring different options here in order to proceed with the task more quickly

column137:
17/–∏—é–Ω/22 10:21 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;From Alloy team:

The format I've been building on for the Argyle input data is mocked up in the Postman collection, but I've attached it as a separate JSON as well. If possible, I was hoping we could get the¬†array from within the results nested object in Argyle for each respective endpoint, so we don't need to parse that on our side.

[^paintbrush_example.json]
[^Paintbrush Journey Example.postman_collection.json]
[^Alloy Webhook Journey Events.zip]

There are a few things about our API / the Postman collection that I wanted to call out specifically:

* The collection does include an example of the PUT request that would be involved for uploading documents to the application - however, if you'll be using Alloy's SDK for document collection, then this PUT request would be performed by the SDK automatically, so this is just for reference and testing
** If you use the last name of¬†KYC_DOB_NOT_VERIFIED for any of the individuals in the Journey Application request, this should trigger step up to the document verification node. There's a webhook event for this, and it's also available in the Journey Application response body

* I also included an example of the /entities API, which is not required for you all to use, but I think it may be helpful. There are some instances where you're able to use an external_entity_id in requests, but in other scenarios,¬†only the Alloy entity_token is supported right now. This specifically applies to both webhook event request bodies, and the PUT endpoint, but I've submitted feature requests to Product for us to support¬†{{external_entity_id}}¬†everywhere, so this may change soon.
In the interim, to make things a bit easier, you can use the /entities API to generate an Alloy entity token, and maintain a mapping of the External Entity ID <> Alloy Token rather than having to hit the GET /entities endpoint to do a lookup.

* In the example POST request to create a new Journey application, I've included a value for the¬†external_group_id field - this is optional, but if you have an identifier for the Paintbrush application as a whole, then you can use this field.

* There's an optional request header that you can include on the POST /applications called alloy-journey-application-sync - if you include this header, you will receive a synchronous API response to get the entire status of the Journey after completing the POST (equivalent to what's in the GET /applications request). However, if you include this header, Alloy will still send webhook notification events (assuming there's an endpoint set up to receive them) for the Journey application.
column138:
23/–∏—é–Ω/22 4:56 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;UPD: comment from Kaela:

* Alloy will also be able to return to us if a borrower does not have enough income history, so we can send them back through the Argyle flow
* We will assume that if they go through the Argyle flow once, that is enough
