column1: As a user I would like to fill out income history (Step 3) (Argyle integration)
column31:
!Screenshot 2022-06-08 at 11.31.49.png|width=951,height=655!

!Screenshot 2022-06-08 at 11.31.59.png|width=940,height=652!

!Screenshot 2022-06-08 at 11.32.08.png|width=937,height=717!

!JBEEcHonO8W5nTD1O3L_g_fQaF-dtqW5RpN84_1nia6ggI3CYKLdk2zENVmvRzYViSKhB5t2A7v6B_Bw3DT2f37sHpA72DBK9U8QqNvmUvliaPX31C24DS_VGsY70WGY9fRPSuoGhpHeWW-kcw|width=1600,height=1067!



* Employment history is only shown in the application landing page for personal guarantors
* When they click on employment history, they‚Äôll be presented with a screen explaining how much history we need and why, and a button to connect payroll, which launches the Argyle SDK/iframe [https://argyle.com/docs/solutions/voie-technical-implementation#implement-argyle-link|https://argyle.com/docs/solutions/voie-technical-implementation#implement-argyle-link]
* Not more than 10 entries for history, if user wants to add 11th: the ‚ÄúAdd another income source‚Äù button should be inactive
* If user has not added at least 1 employer, show the initial big text ‚ÄúWe need at least 2 year of experience‚Ä¶.‚Äú and the button should be \[Connect payroll] (NOT save)
** When user has added at lease one employer, the button has to show \[Save] (currently this button does not have any logic because we are saving data right after user adds every employer, we will figure out the logic for this button later)
* Add ‚Äú2 years checkbox‚Äú. \[Save] button can still be active whether this box is checked or not (because user may not be able to enter all employment information at one time). However, this step will never show as complete _until_ they have checked this box.
* (!) DO NOT put statuses on employers and other statuses (In Progres, To Do). This will be done later
* When user clicks \[Connect payroll], the Argyle modal will appear
* We need to take all the info from Argyle which is possible and save it as json string in DB
* From the employment API: [https://argyle.com/docs/developer-tools/api-reference#employment-data-employments|https://argyle.com/docs/developer-tools/api-reference#employment-data-employments] 
* From the payouts API: [https://argyle.com/docs/developer-tools/api-reference#employment-data-payouts|https://argyle.com/docs/developer-tools/api-reference#employment-data-payouts] 
* From the documents API: [https://docs.argyle.com/guides/reference/list-documents|https://docs.argyle.com/guides/reference/list-documents] 
* User can remove income source by clicking on \[Remove] button which will trigger confirmation modal: ‚ÄúAre you sure you want to remove income source?‚Äú and 2 buttons: \[Remove income] and \[Cancel]



(!) In the current scope of this task we are not showing any success screen after we got the data. We just get the info from Argyle in order to send it to Alloy

url for this page: /income-history

My guess is that we most likely need to remove all employment history (and of course tell the user about that in modal window). What do you think?
column144: 15/–∏—é–Ω/22 8:32 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] Ideally if they change the personal guarantor we would remove the employment history on the front end since there is a new personal guarantor, and show that this step has not been done. However, on the backend we should KEEP all the employment history tied to the owner it was connected to, in case they switch who the personal guarantor is again, so they don‚Äôt have to reconnect or reupload everything (both to save the user the effort and because there is a connection fee for us each time).

column31:
!Screenshot 2022-06-02 at 08.48.59.png|width=648,height=781!

!Screenshot 2022-06-02 at 09.10.19.png|width=729,height=564!



* Owners list page
** List
*** Name
*** Edit option
*** (!) First owner should be fetched from DB with info from the prequal page, and this owner has to be PG
*** If they are the personal guarantor or not, with radio button to change who is the PG
**** Personal guarantor should always be on top, so for example, if someone chooses a person who is 3rd in the list, after saving they should be on top
**** Have a tooltip to make it clear what being PG means: ‚ÄúThis person will be responsible for paying back the loan at 15% of their income should the business fail. To be eligible for a Paintbrush Loan, we require guarantors to own a minimum of 50% of the business, have a minimum credit score of 720, and have a two-year income history greater than $100,000/year‚Äú
**** If they change who is PG, pop a modal to confirm they want to switch. Modal text: ‚ÄúChange Personal Guarantor. Are you sure?‚Äú + 2 buttons: \[Yes] and \[Cancel]
** Checkbox to state if there are no other owners‚Äîif this is not checked, then this section will still show as incomplete
** Button to add new owner¬†(10 owners maximum, if there are 10, make button inactive)
** Button to ‚ÄúNeed help‚Äú
* Add/edit owner page (validations and validation texts are the same as on fields in this task [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-8|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-8|smart-link]  if not stated otherwise)
** Open text: first name field and last name field
*** Not Empty
** Open text: email
** Open text: phone
*** Validation: is all numbers
*** Validation: is 10 digits
*** Validation message: ‚ÄúPlease enter a valid phone number‚Äú
** Open text: street address (Need to research and add validation library of US addresses, show it as suggestions, but do not force user to use it. UPD: decided to fork it to another task because it might take a lot of time: [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-36|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-36|smart-link] )
*** Validation: if possible, check that there are numbers and letters and a space? ((!)NEED to investigate)
*** Validation message: ‚ÄúPlease enter a valid address‚Äú
*** Tooltip: ‚ÄúThis should be the physical address where the person resides, not a PO or UPS box.‚Äú
** Open text: street address 2
*** Validation: none
** Open text: city
*** Validation: none
** Dropdown: state (US states and territories)
** Open text: zip code
*** Validation: numbers only, 5 digits only
** Open text: date of birth
*** Validation: year can‚Äôt be more than current year minus 90
*** Validation: Month must be 1-12
*** Validation: Date must be 1-31
*** Add materialUI calendar widget (but make colors correspond to our app and styleguide)
** Open text: SSN
*** Validation: is all numbers
*** Validation: is 9 digits
*** Is not 123-45-6789
*** Does not start with 000 or 666
*** 4th and 5th digits are not 00
*** Last four digits are not 0000
*** [+https://www.lexjansen.com/nesug/nesug07/ap/ap19.pdf+|https://www.lexjansen.com/nesug/nesug07/ap/ap19.pdf]¬†
*** Maybe research for JS library which validates SSNs (?)
** Open text: % ownership
*** Number between 0 and 100 (with single decimal point: for example: 5.3)
*** Validation message: ‚ÄúPlease choose number between 0 and 100 (e.g. 20.5)‚Äú
*** Tooltip: ‚ÄúHow much of the company does this person own according to your cap table or articles of incorporation?‚Äú
** Button: Remove owner 
*** Should be a soft delete (marked as deleted in DB, do not erase it)
*** Should have confirmation modal:

!Screenshot 2022-06-02 at 13.17.21.png|width=830,height=472!
** Button: Save changes
*** Validation happens on fields that have been filled out
*** Fields are allowed to be left empty in order to still save (except name and email)
*** After saving changes, they are taken back to the owners page
** Button: Need help

# What is the total number of owners that can be added? And what happens when user reaches maximum (button becomes inactive? Maybe some warning?)
# I cannot see invite checkbox on design. Also, do we do invite logic for PG modal window?
# Just in case: do we pre-fill first owner? or by default this page is empty (with 0 owners)?
# Can we use for example 5.25% for ownership numbers or only integers?
# Checkbox delete owner: I guess it should be ‚Äúremove owner‚Äú and not a checkbox, a button with a modal in the list of all owners.
column139:
02/–∏—é–Ω/22 7:51 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;# Do we need to set a maximum number? From the legal definition of ‚Äúbeneficial owner,‚Äù it could be anyone who owns a significant % of the business as we‚Äôve defined here, but it could also end up being anyone who exerts a significant influence/control over the business even if they are not a full owner (for example, any executives). So while we expect this list to usually be fairly short due to the stage of the company starting, it has the potential to get long and we‚Äôd rather not put a hard cap on it if we don‚Äôt need to. If we have to set one, I think 10 would probably be safe.
# I cut out the logic on invites from the MVP just to simplify things. If it makes it more complicated to add that in later rather than do it now though, I can add designs and documentation for how that should work.
# Yes, we will prefill the first owner from the self-assessment page (name, email, phone number).
# Let‚Äôs do single decimal point: 5.3%
# For removing owners, don‚Äôt worry about the checkbox on the old wireframes‚Äîlet‚Äôs follow the designs in figma‚Äîthe option will appear as a link/tertiary button after an owner has been added, with a confirmation modal: [https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/?node-id=12%3A756|https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/?node-id=12%3A756|smart-link]

column31:
* Make ‚ÄúBusiness information‚Äú button clickable and redirect to this page (from this task: [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-15|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-15|smart-link] )

!Screenshot 2022-06-10 at 12.45.01.png|width=462,height=812!



* Auto-populate from prequal form but can be edited
** Open text: Startup Name (Validation: Cannot be empty, validation message: ‚ÄúPlease add the startup name‚Äú)
** Drop down: Industry
*** Software
*** Hardware
*** Consumer goods
*** Ecommerce/dropshipping
*** Locally based business
*** Biomedical/pharmaceutical
*** Content creation
*** Consulting
*** Other
* New fields
** Open text: Website
*** Validation: Is a valid website structure (has a period, ends in .com/.io/.ly etc)
*** Validation message: ‚ÄúPlease enter a valid website‚Äú
** Drop down: Business type
*** Options:¬†
**** Limited Liability Company (LLC)
**** Corporation
**** Sole proprietorship
**** Non profit
**** Partnership
**** Not registered
*** Validation: If they choose ‚Äúnot registered‚Äù, we will populate a message (Yellow message under the field) letting them know that we require their business to be registered as an LLC or Corp in order to be eligible for the loan (Yellow text: ‚ÄúLLC or Corp is required to be registered for the loan‚Äù).
*** Validation: If they choose something other than ‚Äúnot registered‚Äù but still not LLC or Corp, we tell them that their business needs to be registered as an LLC or Corp to be eligible for a Founder Loan, but we still let them save and continue (Yellow text: ‚ÄúLLC or Corp is required to be registered for the loan‚Äù)
** Drop down: Registration state
*** List of 50 US states + territories + not registered option
*** Validation: If they choose not registered, we tell them that their business needs to be registered as an LLC or Corp to be eligible for a Founder Loan, but we still let them save and continue¬†(Yellow text: ‚ÄúLLC or Corp is required to be registered for the loan‚Äù)
** Open text: Business EIN/TIN
*** Validation: 9 digits, only numbers
* All fields should be able to support tool tips explaining why we need this or where to find it, with links to FAQs (All tooltips must be empty now, except EIN/TIN tooltip)
* Validation should only be on entered data, no field is required in order to save progress
* \[Save] button saves the info and redirects to next step
* Tooltip texts: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vyoI66oAJAC7oX931NOh8X4Biijr6ZuMViFbIJPk4U8/edit#|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vyoI66oAJAC7oX931NOh8X4Biijr6ZuMViFbIJPk4U8/edit#|smart-link] (If a field is not listed, it does not need a tooltip)

column1: As a user I would like to create an account
column31:
After user has entered the info on prequal page, they will be prompted to create an account. The text at the top of the form and on the right side of the page will be different based on whether they were prequalified or not.



* *Submit state conditions*
** Show message on this screen that they might not be a good fit if :
*** Industry = Bio or content
*** Income < $100,000
*** Credit score \!= Excellent
** Else say that things are looking good

!Screen Shot 2022-05-27 at 9.43.54 AM.png|width=91.66666666666666%!

!Screen Shot 2022-05-27 at 9.44.30 AM.png|width=91.66666666666666%!

* Password reqs:
** Min 8 characters
** Min 1 uppercase
** Min 1 lowercase
** Min 1 number
** Min 1 symbol
* Should be required to confirm their password to make sure they don‚Äôt mistype it
* Validation message should tell people what exact password requirements are



* User will also need to check both boxes to create their account
** I agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
** I certify that by checking this box I have read Paintbrush‚Äôs Electronic Communications Policy and consent to receive all legally required notices and disclosures and other communications (‚ÄúCommunications‚Äù) from Paintbrush electronically and not on paper. I also confirm I am able to access, view, retain and print all of the Communications Paintbrush provides me in electronic form.



(!) Scope of this task:

* Get info from [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-8|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-8|smart-link]  (what user has input into fields) and show the correct text depending on this info
* Design fields and texts
* Apply validations
* Save password to DB

column1: As a user I would like to fill out prequal page
column31:
* We already have this page designed here: 
[https://paintbrush-official.brevitypreview.com/get-started|https://paintbrush-official.brevitypreview.com/get-started] 
(username: paintbrush
password: founders)
(design in figma just in case, pass: paintbrush): [https://www.figma.com/file/l6oVspnJGcBBegbvgnNPx8/Marketing-Website?node-id=241%3A11414|https://www.figma.com/file/l6oVspnJGcBBegbvgnNPx8/Marketing-Website?node-id=241%3A11414] 
UPD: design of the actual page: [https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=316%3A22265|https://www.figma.com/file/ZkRZyQjTmVWXXQkaBTEboE/Customer-Portal?node-id=316%3A22265] 
* (!) Scope of this task:
1. Apply validations
2. Design frontend
3. Send all info to DB to save it


*Form specifications:*

* Open text: Full Name
** Validation: is not null
** Validation message: ‚ÄúPlease add your name‚Äú
* Open text: Email
** Validation: is an email address (has an @, ends in a .com/.org/.io/etc)
** Validation: ideally filter out spam domains automatically
** Validation message: ‚ÄúPlease enter a valid email‚Äú
* Drop down: Personal Income History
** $0-$45,000/year
** $46,000-$99,000/year
** $100,000-$200,000/year
** >$200,000/year
* Drop down: Personal Credit Score
** Excellent: 720-850¬†
** Good: 690-719
** Fair: 630-689
** Bad: 350-629
* Open text: Startup Name
** Validation: not null
** Validation message: ‚ÄúPlease enter a startup name, even if it‚Äôs a temporary one‚Äú
* Drop down: Industry
** Software
** Hardware
** Consumer goods
** Ecommerce/dropshipping
** Locally based business
** Biomedical/pharmaceutical
** Content creation
** Consulting
** Other
* Checkbox: I consent to receive email communications from Paintbrush.
** Optional, checked by default
* \[Submit] button is active all the time and validation messages are shown only when when the button has been pressed



* *Acceptance criteria:*

User can fill out the form, get errors if something is not filled out properly, click submit, info is saved to DB and saved

2. These are great, thank you\! Edited one of them slightly.

3. We ended up deciding we don‚Äôt need the phone number at this stage. 

4. After they submit they should be taken immediately to [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-9|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-9|smart-link], and I added designs there. The other docs you linked to are for after they‚Äôve already created their account and are fully logged in.

column142:
31/–º–∞—è/22 6:30 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] if the user already exists, would it be possible to:

# Allow them to still submit the prequal check if they want to and display the approved/not approved language as normal (basically, don‚Äôt do any validation at this step on if they are already a user or not)

Then, when they land on the results page, do one of the following (whichever you think is easiest):

# Instead of displaying the password creation fields, we show the field to enter their password and log in to finish their application (slightly preferred unless it‚Äôs a giant pain in the ass) OR
# We show the page as normal, but when they try to create an account, we give an error and redirect them to the login page: ‚ÄúLooks like you‚Äôve already created an account. Log in instead.‚Äù
column143: 31/–º–∞—è/22 10:06 PM;5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e;[~accountid:61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52]  So after discussion with guys, we have decided that we will not send info to DB from this page, it makes more sense to do it from next page when password is set up [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-9|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-9|smart-link] . Plus we will run a check when password is being set up if the email already exists. I have created a task to track this [https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-30|https://ezetech.atlassian.net/browse/PAINT-30|smart-link]
column144: 31/–º–∞—è/22 10:29 PM;61fc70a9530d2a007147fb52;[~accountid:5a97faed1df57331bfe56e3e] one concern with that is if a user does not create a password, we want to have the information saved so we can follow up with them to remind them to apply for their loan. If we have not saved their info until after they have created their password, we won‚Äôt be able to do that. So I don‚Äôt care which page it happens on, but it DOES need to happen before they create their password.
